Actual Summary: Membership gives the ICC jurisdiction over alleged crimes committed in Palestinian territories since last June. Israel and the United States opposed the move, which could open the door to war crimes investigations against Israelis.
Model Summary: Palestinian Authority becomes 123rd member of International Criminal Court. The move gives the court jurisdiction over alleged crimes in Palestinian territories. Israel and the United States opposed the Palestinians' efforts to join the body.

Actual Summary: Theia, a bully breed mix, was apparently hit by a car, whacked with a hammer and buried in a field. "She's a true miracle dog and she deserves a good life," says Sara Mellado, who is looking for a home for Theia.
Model Summary: The dog was apparently hit by a car and buried in a field, only to survive. She has a dislocated jaw, leg injuries and a caved-in sinus cavity. A fundraising page has raised more than $10,000 for the dog's medical care.

Actual Summary: Mohammad Javad Zarif has spent more time with John Kerry than any other foreign minister. He once participated in a takeover of the Iranian Consulate in San Francisco. The Iranian foreign minister tweets in English.
Model Summary: Mohammad Javad Zarif is the Iranian foreign minister. He has played a key role in efforts to reach a deal with the U.S. on Iran's nuclear program.

Actual Summary: 17 Americans were exposed to the Ebola virus while in Sierra Leone in March. Another person was diagnosed with the disease and taken to hospital in Maryland. National Institutes of Health says the patient is in fair condition after weeks of treatment.
Model Summary: Five Americans were monitored for three weeks after being exposed to Ebola in West Africa. None developed the deadly virus. One of the five had a heart-related issue and has been discharged.

Actual Summary: Student is no longer on Duke University campus and will face disciplinary review. School officials identified student during investigation and the person admitted to hanging the noose, Duke says. The noose, made of rope, was discovered on campus about 2 a.m.
Model Summary: Student admitted to hanging a noose from a tree near a student union, Duke says. The student is no longer on campus and will face student conduct review, the school says.

Actual Summary: College-bound basketball star asks girl with Down syndrome to high school prom. Pictures of the two during the "prom-posal" have gone viral.
Model Summary: Trey Moses, a basketball star at Eastern High School in Kentucky, asked his girlfriend to be his date. Ellie Meredith, a freshman with Down syndrome, said yes. Photos of the pair have gone viral on social media.

Actual Summary: Amnesty's annual death penalty report catalogs encouraging signs, but setbacks in numbers of those sentenced to death. Organization claims that governments around the world are using the threat of terrorism to advance executions. The number of executions worldwide has gone down by almost 22% compared with 2013, but death sentences up by 28%.
Model Summary: Amnesty International releases its annual report on the death penalty. At least 607 people were executed around the world in 2014, compared to 778 in 2013. The number of executions worldwide has gone down by almost 22% on the previous year.

Actual Summary: Andrew Getty's death appears to be from natural causes, police say, citing coroner's early assessment. In a petition for a restraining order, Getty had written he had a serious medical condition. Police say this is not a criminal matter at this time.
Model Summary: Andrew Getty, 47, appears to have died of natural causes, police say. Coroner's preliminary assessment is there was no foul play involved in his death. He is the grandson of oil tycoon J. Paul Getty.

Actual Summary: Once a super typhoon, Maysak is now a tropical storm with 70 mph winds. It could still cause flooding, landslides and other problems in the Philippines.
Model Summary: Tropical storm Maysak is now a tropical storm. It's expected to make landfall Sunday morning on the southeastern coast of Isabela province.

Actual Summary: Bob Barker returned to host "The Price Is Right" on Wednesday. Barker, 91, had retired as host in 2007.
Model Summary: Bob Barker returned to "The Price Is Right" on April 1. Barker hosted the show for 35 years before stepping down in 2007.

Actual Summary: London's Metropolitan Police say the man was arrested at Luton airport after landing on a flight from Istanbul. He's been charged with terror offenses allegedly committed since the start of November.
Model Summary: Yahya Rashid, 19, was detained at Luton airport on Tuesday after he arrived on a flight from Istanbul, police said. He's been charged with engaging in conduct in preparation of acts of terrorism.

Actual Summary: "Furious 7" pays tribute to star Paul Walker, who died during filming. Vin Diesel: "This movie is more than a movie" "Furious 7" opens Friday.
Model Summary: Paul Walker died in a car crash in November 2013. His death was especially eerie given his rise to fame in the "Fast and Furious" film franchise. The film "Furious 7" will be released Friday.

Actual Summary: Museum: Anne Frank died earlier than previously believed. Researchers re-examined archives and testimonies of survivors. Anne and older sister Margot Frank are believed to have died in February 1945.
Model Summary: Anne Frank died of typhus in a Nazi concentration camp at the age of 15. Dutch authorities had previously determined that she died on March 31, 1945. New research shows that Anne and her older sister, Margot Frank, died at least a month earlier.

Actual Summary: LZ: Indiana law pushing back LGBT rights, and other states' anti-LGBT moves, bow to far right wing that GOP candidates need for 2016. Cruz, Huckabee, Jindal, Carson, Walker are reviving culture wars, he says. Equality for LGBT has not yet "won" in America.
Model Summary: LZ Granderson: Mike Pence's decision to sign anti-gay law is hurting his chances in 2016. He says it's a sign of how far right the GOP is on same-sex marriage.

Actual Summary: Singing the national anthem is a risky proposition. Whitney Houston nailed it; Roseanne Barr destroyed it.
Model Summary: Mötley Crüe's Vince Neil reminded us again of the dangers of tackling "The Star-Spangled Banner"

Actual Summary: While Republican Gov. Asa Hutchinson was weighing an Arkansas religious freedom bill, Walmart voiced its opposition. Walmart and other high-profile businesses are showing their support for gay and lesbian rights. Their stance puts them in conflict with socially conservative Republicans, traditionally seen as allies.
Model Summary: Walmart's opposition to a religious freedom law in Arkansas puts the company at odds with many in the Republican Party. The company is emerging as a bellwether for shifting public opinion on hot-button political issues that divide conservatives and liberals.

Actual Summary: Amnesty International releases its annual review of the death penalty worldwide; much of it makes for grim reading. Salil Shetty: Countries that use executions to deal with problems are on the wrong side of history.
Model Summary: Amnesty International releases its annual review of the death penalty worldwide. Amnesty International: Governments using death penalty in misguided attempt to tackle crime and terrorism.

Actual Summary: Marseille prosecutor says "so far no videos were used in the crash investigation" despite media reports. Journalists at Bild and Paris Match are "very confident" the video clip is real, an editor says. Andreas Lubitz had informed his Lufthansa training school of an episode of severe depression, airline says.
Model Summary: Prosecutor: "So far no videos were used in the crash investigation" German daily Bild and French magazine Paris Match claim to have video of the crash. A Gendarmerie spokesman calls the reports "completely wrong" and "unwarranted"

Actual Summary: The Rev. Robert Schuller, 88, had been diagnosed with esophageal cancer in 2013. His TV show, "Hour of Power," was enormously popular in the 1970s and 1980s.
Model Summary: Robert Schuller was the founder of "Hour of Power" and the Crystal Cathedral megachurch. He was diagnosed with esophageal cancer in August 2013.

Actual Summary: Former GOP representative compares President Obama to Andreas Lubitz. Bachmann said with possible Iran deal, Obama will fly "entire nation into the rocks" Reaction on social media? She was blasted by Facebook commenters.
Model Summary: Michele Bachmann compares President Obama to the co-pilot of the doomed Germanwings flight. Bachmann made the comparison in a Facebook comment posted March 31.

Actual Summary: Father: "I know he went through what he went through" Louis Jordan was found on his sailboat, which was listing and in bad shape, rescuer says. He appears to be in good shape, physically and mentally.
Model Summary: Louis Jordan, 37, left Conway, South Carolina, to fish in the ocean. A storm capsized his boat and broke his mast. He was rescued by a container ship in Norfolk, Virginia.

Actual Summary: Richard Klass: Iran framework agreement on nukes is strong, but opponents will cast doubts on this and try to obscure its facts. He says the deal would cut uranium stockpile, centrifuges, implement rigorous inspections; it should be judged on merits, not disinformation.
Model Summary: Frida Ghitis: U.S. reached deal with Iran that limits its nuclear program. She says critics are wrong to make many assumptions about the deal.

Actual Summary: Americans paid more for some fruits and vegetables last year because of the drought. Tourists will now have to ask for a glass of water at a California restaurant. Perhaps the only good thing is another "great" wine grape harvest last year.
Model Summary: California's drought is affecting the rest of the country, too. Food prices are expected to rise this year because of inflation, an economist says. The price of beef and veal rose 12.1% in 2014 because of the drought.

Actual Summary: The FBI cites social media messages sent by Keonna Thomas, 30. She's accused of trying to travel overseas to join ISIS. Thomas is one of three women facing federal terror charges this week.
Model Summary: Keonna Thomas, 30, is one of three women arrested this week on terror charges. She's accused of trying to travel overseas to fight for ISIS.

Actual Summary: Iranian sports official: The ban will be lifted for some events in the coming year. But he says "families are not interested in attending" some sports matches.
Model Summary: Women have been barred from attending most sports events involving men since the Islamic Revolution in 1979. A top Iranian sports official says the ban will be lifted for some events in the next year.

Actual Summary: Going online has become the path of least resistance if you want to make yourself heard. But where there is the restrictive rule of law, journalists are vulnerable to the anger of officialdom. From China to Malaysia, journalists and bloggers have been jailed -- even killed.
Model Summary: Lack of access to traditional media is driving dissident voices to post online, says Peter Bergen. Bergen: China is biggest jailer of journalists, followed by Vietnam, Malaysia.

Actual Summary: The singer had been off the scene for a while. She says she was bedridden for months. Lavigne was sometimes too weak to shower.
Model Summary: Avril Lavigne says she was bedridden for five months after contracting Lyme disease. The singer believes she was bitten by a tick last spring. Lavigne is releasing a new single this month to support the 2015 Special Olympics.

Actual Summary: Here are six of CNN's best videos of the week. Clips include a look at Mike Tyson's abandoned mansion.
Model Summary: A former heavyweight champ's gaudy, abandoned Ohio mansion features a marble-and-gold Jacuzzi. A shepherd describes the final seconds of a plane crash in the French Alps. Penn Jillette talks about Indiana's religious freedom law.

Actual Summary: Netanyahu says third option is "standing firm" to get a better deal. Political sparring continues in U.S. over the deal with Iran.
Model Summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says he sees better options than "this bad deal or war" Sen. Dianne Feinstein, D-California, says Netanyahu needs to "contain himself" Republican Sen. Lindsey Graham says almost any of Obama's successors "could do better" Energy Secretary Ernest Moniz defends the deal, saying it prevents Iran from getting a nuclear bomb.

Actual Summary: Indiana town's Memories Pizza is shut down after online threat. Its owners say they'd refuse to cater a same-sex couple's wedding.
Model Summary: Memories Pizza in Walkerton, Indiana, refused to cater a same-sex couple's wedding. Critics called for boycotts; supporters rallied, raising more than $842,000.

Actual Summary: Authorities in the Indian city of Malegaon have asked residents to take a'mugshot' of their cattle. Cows are revered by the majority Hindu population, and many parts of the country have laws banning the slaughter of cattle. Officials in Malegaon believe this is the best way to solve cow slaughter cases and enforce the law.
Model Summary: Police in the Indian city of Malegaon have asked residents to take a'mugshot' of their cattle and submit it to the police. The move follows a recent state-wide ban on the sale and consumption of beef.

Actual Summary: A South Carolina man says he spent 66 days alone at sea before being rescued. Other sole survivor stories include a Japanese man washed away by a tsunami. An El Salvador man says he drifted from Mexico to Marshall Islands over a year.
Model Summary: It's hard to imagine a single person being stranded at sea for more than a few days. But such stories do happen, and they are often recounted by lone survivors. Louis Jordan, Jose Salvador Alvarenga and Ron Ingraham are among those who have survived.

Actual Summary: The Large Hadron Collider (LHC) begins again after a two-year shutdown. The restart was delayed in March.
Model Summary: The Large Hadron Collider (LHC), a particle accelerator and the largest machine in the world, is ready for action following a two-year shutdown. The purpose of the lengthy project is to recreate the conditions that existed moments after the "Big Bang" The LHC generates up to 600 million particles per second, with a beam circulating for 10 hours.

Actual Summary: FBI agents and a suspected serial robber exchange gunfire in an FBI stakeout. Two FBI agents are injured and the suspect is shot during the gunfight.
Model Summary: Kevone Charleston, 36, is suspected of 32 commercial robberies dating to November 2013. He was shot and wounded by FBI agents and task force officers. Two agents were injured in a crash and the suspect was shot before being captured.

Actual Summary: The total eclipse will only last 4 minutes and 43 seconds. People west of the Mississippi River will have the best view. Parts of South America, India, China and Russia also will see the eclipse.
Model Summary: A total lunar eclipse will begin at 3:16 a.m. Pacific Daylight Time. It will only last four minutes and 43 seconds, making it the shortest one of the century. People west of the Mississippi River will have the best view.

Actual Summary: Terrorist group Al-Shabaab has attacked a Kenyan college, killing and taking hostages. It is a clear indicator the security situation in East Africa is deteriorating, says Stefan Wolff. More than military action aloe is needed to combat terrorism in the region, he says.
Model Summary: Somalia-based Al-Shabaab has claimed an attack on Garissa University College in eastern Kenya, in which many people have been killed and still more taken hostage. The attack is another step in the ongoing escalation of the terrorist group's activities.

Actual Summary: Easter is a key event in the Christian faith, but where did the Easter Bunny come from? Why is the date different every year, and what does it have to do with the moon?
Model Summary: Unlike Christmas, Easter doesn't fall on the same day every year. It shifts around in spring depending upon cosmic events.

Actual Summary: In response to lawsuit, NCAA says it doesn't control quality of education for student-athletes. But its website emphasizes importance of education, "opportunities to learn" Lawsuit claims students didn't get an education because of academic fraud at UNC.
Model Summary: The NCAA says it has no legal obligation to ensure the education of student-athletes. The NCAA is responding to a lawsuit filed by former University of North Carolina athletes.

Actual Summary: Judge won't allow teen leave hospital before her last chemotherapy treatment. Attorneys for the teen are deciding whether to appeal. Cassandra C. is now in remission and is no longer opposed to the chemotherapy treatments.
Model Summary: Cassandra C., 17, has been forced to have chemotherapy to treat Hodgkin lymphoma. She is in temporary custody of the state of Connecticut. A juvenile court judge denied a request to let her go home.

Actual Summary: The song rules the chart for 13th week. It passes Robin Thicke's "Blurred Lines" Song three weeks from potentially tying "One Sweet Day" for record.
Model Summary: Mark Ronson's "Uptown Funk!" is the longest-leading Billboard Hot 100 of the 2010s. It's also just the 10th single in the Hot 100's entire history to spend at least 13 weeks at No. 1.

Actual Summary: High temperatures are recorded on the northern tip of the Antarctica Peninsula. The World Meteorological Organization will make the final determination.
Model Summary: The temperature was recorded at Argentina's Esperanza Base on the northern tip of the Antarctica Peninsula.

Actual Summary: A Native American from a tribe not recognized by the feds wins the return of his eagle feathers. An IRS accountant is fired for insisting on carrying a symbolic Sikh knife to work. A group of Chicago pastors takes on City Hall over its permits for new churches and loses.
Model Summary: 20 states have some version of the Religious Freedom Restoration Act. RFRA prohibits the federal government from "substantially burdening" a person's exercise of religion.

Actual Summary: Robert Lewis Burns Jr. was part of Lynyrd Skynyrd's original lineup. His car hit a mailbox and a tree just before midnight.
Model Summary: Robert Lewis Burns Jr. was the original drummer in Lynyrd Skynyrd. He died after his car hit a mailbox and a tree in Cartersville, Georgia.

Actual Summary: Kim Ki-Jong is charged with attempted murder and assaulting a foreign envoy. He's accused of stabbing U.S. Ambassador Mark Lippert in the face and arm. Police said Kim opposed the joint U.S.-South Korean military drills.
Model Summary: Kim Ki-Jong is charged with attempted murder and assaulting a foreign envoy. He is accused of stabbing U.S. Ambassador Mark Lippert in Seoul last month.

Actual Summary: Hong Kong banker alleged murder case adjourned until May. The 29-year-old Rurik Jutting is accused of killing two Indonesian domestic workers.
Model Summary: Rurik Jutting, 29, has been charged with two counts of murder in Hong Kong. He was arrested after police found the bodies of two Indonesian women at an apartment. The bodies of Sumarti Ningsih and Seneng Mujiasih were found in November.

Actual Summary: Thai Airways subsidiary Thai Smile features Cartoon Network paint job on A320 jet. Overhead bins, head rests and air sick bags feature characters from Cartoon Network.
Model Summary: Thai Smile has unveiled a new livery for its Airbus A320. The airline is a subsidiary of Thailand flag carrier Thai Airways. The interior of the plane also has an Adventure Time theme. The inaugural flight takes place on April 4.

Actual Summary: Manning is serving a 35-year sentence for leaking thousands of classified documents. She says she will be using a voice phone to dictate her tweets.
Model Summary: Chelsea Manning is serving a 35-year prison sentence for leaking classified documents. In a series of tweets, she says she will be using a voice phone to dictate her tweets.

Actual Summary: Frida Ghitis: President Barack Obama is right to want a deal, but this one gives Iran too much. She says the framework agreement starts lifting Iran sanctions much too soon.
Model Summary: President Obama has tied himself to a nuclear deal with Iran even before he became the Democratic candidate for president.

Actual Summary: The final film featuring the late Paul Walker, "Furious 7" is opening around the globe this weekend. It's worldwide debut may approach or cross $300 million by the end of Easter Sunday.
Model Summary: "Furious 7" is getting the widest release in Universal's history. The film is expected to earn $135 million-$138 million this weekend. It will be the biggest opening in North America since fall 2013.

Actual Summary: Deion Sanders calls out son for "hood doughnuts" comments. "You're a Huxtable with a million $ trust fund. Stop the hood stuff!"
Model Summary: Deion Sanders Jr. tweeted that he only eats "hood doughnuts" His father reminded him he has a trust fund, a condo and his own clothing line.

Actual Summary: An outside review found that a Rolling Stone article about campus rape was "deeply flawed" Danny Cevallos says that there are obstacles to a successful libel case, should one be filed.
Model Summary: David Frum: Rolling Stone article about alleged gang rape at UVA may have been defamatory. He says there are rules about who can sue for defamation, and they apply to UVA as well as other fraternities.

Actual Summary: Shibuya ward in Tokyo passes an ordinance that gives same-sex couples some of the rights of married heterosexual couples. Activists welcome the decision; hope that it will lead to greater equality for LGBT people in Japan. Recent poll finds most young Japanese open to the idea of gay marriage.
Model Summary: Shibuya ward, one of Tokyo's most famous districts, passes ordinance recognizing same-sex unions. The certificates will not be issued until later in the summer and are not legally binding. Proponents of marriage equality in socially conservative Japan say it is a step in the right direction.

Actual Summary: A test in Kansas finds listeria in a Blue Bell ice cream cup. The company announces it is temporarily shutting a plant to check for the source. Three people in Kansas have died from a listeria outbreak.
Model Summary: CDC warns consumers not to eat any Blue Bell-branded products made at the Broken Arrow, Oklahoma, plant. Listeria monocytogenes was found in a cup of ice cream from the plant in April 2014. It is the third time Blue Bell has taken action in light of a listeria outbreak at a Kansas hospital.

Actual Summary: Japan's top military official earnestly revealed that the country's Self Defense Force (SDF) had never encountered a UFO. Celebrity politician and former wrestler Antonio Inoki had posed a question concerning extraterrestrials to a government committee.
Model Summary: Japan's Defense Minister Gen Nakatani tells the Diet that his jets have never encountered UFOs from outer space. He was responding to a question from flamboyant former wrestler-turned-politician Antonio Inoki. Inoki, a maverick politician, is known in Japan for his red scarf and wrestling prowess.

Actual Summary: Bombing of targets in central Sanaa smashes residents' windows and doors. Hundreds killed in less than two weeks; humanitarian situation desperate, agencies say.
Model Summary: More than 600 people have been killed in Yemen since the conflict began, officials say. The Red Cross is pleading with Saudi Arabia to allow aid into the country.

Actual Summary: David Lynch says he won't be directing new episodes of Twin Peaks. Showtime "saddened" over decision, which involved a dispute over money.
Model Summary: David Lynch has confirmed he will no longer direct the revival of "Twin Peaks" The cult 1990s television show was set to return in 2016. Lynch said he felt the network was not offering enough money.

Actual Summary: Kentucky player mutters N-word under his breath about a Wisconsin player at postgame news conference. Andrew Harrison, who is black, tweets that he apologized to Frank Kaminsky, who is white. Kaminsky says he's talked it over with Harrison -- 'I'm over it"
Model Summary: A hot mic picked up Kentucky guard Andrew Harrison saying of Wisconsin's Frank Kaminsky, "F**k that (N-word)." Harrison, who is is black, said his words were "in jest," and that he meant no disrespect to Kaminsky.

Actual Summary: A man killed in a raid in the Philippines in January was a "most wanted" terrorist, the FBI says. Marwan was a Malaysian believed to have provided support to Islamist terror groups. 44 elite Philippine commandos were killed in the raid on his hideout last month.
Model Summary: Malaysian bomb maker Zulkifli bin Hir was one of the FBI's most wanted terrorists. He was believed to be a member of Jemaah Islamiyah's central command. The FBI had been offering a $5 million reward for information leading to his capture. But in January it launched a surprise raid in pursuit of Marwan. The mission went disastrously awry, with 44 members of the police's elite Special Action Force killed.

Actual Summary: Delaware family becomes ill at the Sirenusa resort in the U.S. Virgin Islands. Preliminary EPA results find methyl bromide was present in unit where family stayed. U.S. Justice Department has initiated a criminal investigation into the matter.
Model Summary: EPA says there was a presence of methyl bromide in the unit where the family was staying. Exposure to the pesticide can cause serious health effects, the EPA says.

Actual Summary: Chris Rock posts selfies after being pulled over three times in last seven weeks. "Stopped by the cops again wish me luck," he posted this week.
Model Summary: Comedian Chris Rock tweets photos of three traffic stops in seven weeks. Blacks are about 30% more likely to be pulled over by police than whites, the Bureau of Justice Statistics says.

Actual Summary: A blast rocks a chemical plant in China's southeastern Fujian province for the second time in two years. Six were injured after the explosion and are being hospitalized. The explosion was triggered by an oil leak, though local media has not reported any toxic chemical spills.
Model Summary: Six people injured in explosion at chemical plant in China's Fujian province. Blast occurred at an oil storage facility after an oil leak. Plant produces paraxylene, a carcinogenic chemical used in the production of polyester films and fabrics.

Actual Summary: Justice Department prosecuting FedEx over unauthorized shipment of drugs. Danny Cevallos: FedEx has a strong argument that it shouldn't be held responsible.
Model Summary: U.S. Department of Justice names FedEx as new defendant in war on drugs. David Frum: Corporations can be prosecuted just like people.

Actual Summary: Mark Wahlberg is planning to appear in "Patriots' Day" The film will be about events surrounding the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing. Another film, "Boston Strong," is also in the works.
Model Summary: Mark Wahlberg will star in a film about the Boston Marathon bombing. The film, to be titled "Patriots' Day," is being produced by CBS Films.

Actual Summary: "The Price Is Right" gives away a car... accidentally. A model makes a big mistake during a game. Host Drew Carey thought the error was hilarious.
Model Summary: Manuela Arbelaez accidentally revealed the correct answer to a guessing game for a new Hyundai Sonata. Drew Carey couldn't stop laughing.

Actual Summary: Carlos Colina, 32, is arraigned on charges of assault and battery, improper disposal of a body. Body parts were discovered Saturday in a duffel bag and a common area of an apartment building. The victim in the case is identified as Jonathan Camilien, 26; authorities say he knew Colina.
Model Summary: Carlos Colina, 32, was arraigned on charges of assault and battery. Police found human remains in a duffel bag in Cambridge, Massachusetts, over the weekend. Surveillance video led them to an apartment building, where more body parts were found. The remains at both locations belonged to the same victim, identified Monday as Jonathan Camilien, 26.

Actual Summary: Fan favorite series "Arrested Development" to return for a fifth season, according to producer. Brian Grazer claimed the show would be back in a podcast. Netflix is not commenting.
Model Summary: "Arrested Development" executive producer Brian Grazer says the show will return for a fifth season. The fourth season was streamed exclusively on Netflix in 2013.

Actual Summary: "Mad Men's" final seven episodes begin airing April 5. The show has never had high ratings but is considered one of the great TV series. It's unknown what will happen to characters, but we can always guess.
Model Summary: "Mad Men's" eighth and final season begins Sunday. The show is about a 1960s advertising agency and its collision with changing times.

Actual Summary: "Vampire Diaries" star Nina Dobrev announces she's leaving the show. "Nothing will be the same again," fans say.
Model Summary: "Vampire Diaries" star Nina Dobrev announced she will leave the show at the end of this season. Some fans are upset that the show will go on to a seventh season after Dobrev's departure.

Actual Summary: Federal education minister Smriti Irani visited a FabIndia store in Goa, saw cameras. Authorities discovered the cameras could capture photos from the store's changing room. The four store workers arrested could spend 3 years each in prison if convicted.
Model Summary: Education minister Smriti Irani was visiting a FabIndia outlet in the tourist resort state of Goa. She discovered a surveillance camera pointed at the changing room, police said. Four employees of the store have been arrested, but its manager is still at large.

Actual Summary: The group included four children, Turkish official says. Turkish military didn't say what group's intent was. UK Foreign Office says it is trying to get information from Turkish officials.
Model Summary: Nine British citizens were arrested at the Turkey-Syria border, the Turkish military says. The group included four children, the oldest of whom was 10 or 11, a Turkish official says.

Actual Summary: Submarine is in Zvyozdochka shipyard, in northwestern Russia. No "dangerous" substances on the submarine, shipyard spokesman told ITAR-Tass.
Model Summary: A nuclear submarine is being repaired at a Russian shipyard, according to a law enforcement source. Tass reports that insulation caught on fire as welding work was being done on the submarine.

Actual Summary: Kayahan wrote some of Turkey's best-loved pop songs. The singer was first diagnosed with cancer in 1990. He most recently performed in February in Istanbul.
Model Summary: Kayahan was first diagnosed with cancer in 1990, the year he competed in the Eurovision Song Contest. His album "I Made a Vow" ignited his career.

Actual Summary: Prosecutors formally charged former top official Zhou Yongkang. Zhou charged with accepting bribes, abuse of power and leaking state secrets. Former domestic security official is the most senior Chinese official to face corruption charges.
Model Summary: Zhou Yongkang is the highest-ranking Chinese Communist Party official ever to face corruption charges. He is charged with abuse of power and leaking state secrets.

Actual Summary: Some of Jesus' most important financial backers were women, historians say. Joseph of Arimathea and Nicodemus, both men of stature and wealth, chipped in to help fund Jesus' ministry.
Model Summary: John Sutter: Money was a concern for Jesus as he preached on the perils of wealth. He says Jesus and his followers had few means of support, so how did they survive? He says they probably relied on begging and hospitality to feed themselves and others.

Actual Summary: Three people killed; five wounded in attack on attorney general's office in Balkh province. Staff and civilians have been rescued as gunmen engaged Afghan security forces.
Model Summary: Gunmen storm attorney general's office in Balkh province, northern Afghanistan. Two police officers and a security guard are among the dead.

Actual Summary: Georgia Powers: Rand Paul, running for president, would like minorities to think he's an advocate. His record on rights shows otherwise. On civil rights, women's choice, voting rights, immigrant DREAMers, education, he has shown he'd take country backwards, she says.
Model Summary: Sen. Rand Paul (R-Kentucky) announced he's running for president. Donna Brazile says Paul's views on civil rights and women's issues are outdated.

Actual Summary: Network regains control of Facebook page and one of its 11 channels. ISIS logos displayed but no claim of responsibility made by any group. Network reaches 260 million homes worldwide.
Model Summary: French-language TV network TV5Monde says it was hacked by an Islamist group. The network lost control of its social media outlets and its websites, its director says.

Actual Summary: Couple spends $1,200 to ship their cat, Felix, on a flight from the United Arab Emirates. Felix went missing somewhere at John F. Kennedy International Airport, airline says. Pets are "treated no differently than a free piece of checked luggage," Jennifer Stewart says.
Model Summary: Jennifer Stewart's 2-year-old cat, Felix, went missing after a flight from Abu Dhabi to New York. She believes the cat's plastic carrier was damaged during the flight or the transfer from the airplane to the airport. Etihad Airways is investigating the incident and is working with ground handlers at the airport to help locate the cat.

Actual Summary: The trials of Dzhokhar Tsarnaev and Aaron Hernandez are coming to a close. Voting has put Rahm Emanuel and Ferguson, Missouri, back in the headlines. Rand Paul has announced his bid for the presidency.
Model Summary: In Louisville, Kentucky, Sen. Rand Paul announced he will run for president. In Chicago, voters will head to the polls in a runoff between Mayor Rahm Emanuel and challenger Jesus "Chuy" Garcia. In Ferguson, Missouri, the shadow of Michael Brown will loom large over the city's elections.

Actual Summary: Fire breaks out at the General Electric Appliance Park in Louisville, Kentucky. City official: No is believed to be injured or trapped.
Model Summary: The fire broke out at the General Electric Appliance Park in Louisville, Kentucky. No one was injured or trapped, an official says.

Actual Summary: Ted Cruz has built a brand as a stalwart conservative on fiscal issues. But he's also eager to champion social issues at a time when many Republicans are eager to avoid them. Cruz says the GOP needs to unite young libertarian-minded voters and evangelicals.
Model Summary: Ted Cruz visited Iowa last week for the first time as a presidential candidate. The state is known for its vocal and active evangelical base. Cruz is courting evangelicals as part of a three-pronged strategy to win the nomination.

Actual Summary: Kenyans use hashtag #147notjustanumber to honor victims of Kenya university attack. The attack killed 142 students, three security officers and two university security personnel.
Model Summary: Kenyans use social media to share pictures of the victims' stories, hopes and dreams. The hashtag #147notjustanumber is a reference to the number of people killed at Garissa University College.

Actual Summary: The penalty is more than 10 times the previous record, according to a newspaper report. Utility commission to force Pacific Gas & Electric Co. to make infrastructure improvements. Company apologizes for explosion that killed 8, says it is using lessons learned to improve safety.
Model Summary: Pacific Gas & Electric Co. ordered to pay a record $1.6 billion penalty for unsafe operation of its gas transmission system. Pipeline rupture that killed eight people in San Bruno in September 2010. Most of the penalty amounts to forced spending on improving pipeline safety.

Actual Summary: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev is found guilty on all 30 charges he faced. Seventeen counts were capital charges, meaning he is eligible for the death penalty.
Model Summary: Seventeen of the 30 counts were capital charges, meaning he is eligible for the death penalty. The trial will next move into a penalty phase, where the jury will hear testimony and arguments.

Actual Summary: The incident occurred on April 7 north of Poland in the Baltic Sea. U.S. says plane was in international airspace. Russia says it had transponder turned off and was flying toward Russia.
Model Summary: The U.S. RC-135U was flying over the Baltic Sea when it was intercepted by a Russian SU-27 Flanker. The Pentagon said the Russian pilot's actions were "unsafe and unprofessional"

Actual Summary: Mother must complete "treatment" before she can be extradited, Maryland police say. Mom told police son was with her in Maryland, but he was found Friday alone in woods. Victim being treated for malnutrition, dehydration; mother faces host of charges after extradition.
Model Summary: Nyia Parler, 41, cannot be extradited to Philadelphia until she completes unspecified "treatment," police say. Parler is accused of leaving her quadriplegic son, 21, in the woods while she went to see her boyfriend in Maryland.

Actual Summary: A new Kansas law bans what it describes as "dismemberment abortion" Supporters say it's a groundbreaking step. Opponents say it's dangerous and politically motivated.
Model Summary: Kansas Gov. Sam Brownback signs a law banning a common second-term abortion procedure. The law defines "dismemberment abortion" as "knowingly dismembering a living unborn child" Opponents call it dangerous and among the most restrictive abortion laws in the country.

Actual Summary: Dillard was the first of the Duggar daughters to be married. Her 9-pound, 10-ounce son was overdue.
Model Summary: Jill (Duggar) Dillard gave birth to a son on Monday. She and husband Derick have named him Israel David.

Actual Summary: Relatives of Wayne Community College shooting victim say he was gay, local media report. The suspect had worked for the victim but was let go, college president says. The suspect, Kenneth Morgan Stancil III, was found sleeping on a Florida beach and arrested.
Model Summary: Kenneth Morgan Stancil III is accused of killing an employee at Wayne Community College. The victim, Ron Lane, was white, as is the suspect, police say. Police are looking into whether the killing was a hate crime.

Actual Summary: Richie Benaud first earned fame as a cricket player, later as broadcaster. Prime Minister Tony Abbott calls him "a cricketing champion and Australian icon"
Model Summary: Richie Benaud has died at the age of 84. Benaud was a former Australian cricketer and broadcaster. He was known for his witty one-liners from the commentary box.

Actual Summary: Company known for use of publicity stunts. Tweet contained pun on name of Liverpool's Kop stand. It was used to link to Liverpool-Newcastle stats. Social media backlash leads to apology.
Model Summary: Irish betting company Paddy Power apologizes for tweet about Newcastle United. Tweet referred to recent police killings of unarmed African-American men in the United States. Spokesman: "It was a joke, and no offense was meant. This is for real" Liverpool beat Newcastle 2-0 at Anfield in English Premier League on Monday.

Actual Summary: The migrants were picked up 30 miles off the coast of Libya, an Italian leader says. At least 480 migrants have died while crossing the Mediterranean this year.
Model Summary: The migrants were picked up 30 miles off the coast of Libya. More than 10,000 migrants arrived in Italy in the first three months of 2015. At least 480 migrants have died crossing the Mediterranean since the beginning of the year.

Actual Summary: In an interview with The New York Times, President Obama says he understands Israel feels particularly vulnerable. Obama calls the nuclear deal with Iran a "once-in-a-lifetime opportunity" Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and many U.S. Republicans warn that Iran cannot be trusted.
Model Summary: President Barack Obama says he's committed to keeping Israel's military advantage over Iran. His comments come amid criticism from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of the Iran nuclear deal.

Actual Summary: Cape Verde seeking to tap-into rich cultural heritage. Tiny island nation wants to grow creative economy.
Model Summary: Cape Verde is home to more musicians per square kilometer than any other country in the world. The island nation is looking to tap-into its rich musical heritage to help its economy flourish. The country's prime minister has acknowledged the economic potential of music.

Actual Summary: New research indicates that a play published in 1728 was written by William Shakespeare. Scholar Lewis Theobald had passed the work off as his own. Texas researchers used software to analyze and compare the language of the men.
Model Summary: "Double Falsehood" was first published in 1728 by Lewis Theobald. But scholars have long suspected it was written by William Shakespeare. A new study shows the play was written more than a century earlier by Shakespeare himself.

Actual Summary: The attack at a Garissa university last week killed 147 people, mostly students. The government is tracking the finances of people suspected of ties to Al-Shabaab.
Model Summary: Kenya freezes 86 accounts linked to suspected Al-Shabaab supporters. Militants massacred 147 people last week at a university in Garissa.

Actual Summary: Jodi Arias is sentenced to life in prison with no possibility for parole. Arias expressed remorse for her actions.
Model Summary: Jodi Arias was sentenced to life in prison for the 2008 murder of her ex-boyfriend Travis Alexander. Arias expressed remorse for her actions.

Actual Summary: Maya Wang: 5 women held by China authorities after planning International Women's Day protests on sex harassment remain detained. She says in a year when country poised to adopt anti-domestic violence law, Beijing also sending chilling message on women's activism.
Model Summary: Wu Rongrong was arrested for planning to protest on International Women's Day. She is one of China's most inventive women's rights activists.

Actual Summary: Astrophysicist Amy Mainzer says she was was touched by Malala's story of determination. Mainzer also works on educating children about science.
Model Summary: Astrophysicist Amy Mainzer has named an asteroid after Malala Yousafzai. Malala was shot by a Pakistani Taliban gunman for promoting the right of girls' to go to school.

Actual Summary: Emy Afalava is a loyal American and decorated veteran; he's also an American Samoan. Sam Erman and Nathan Perl-Rosenthal: It is outrageous that he and others like him are denied citizenship.
Model Summary: Emy Afalava was born in American Samoa, a U.S. territory since 1900. He and other American Samoans are suing the government to become citizens.

Actual Summary: April 8, 2014, the WHO finally started reporting the Ebola epidemic was a "concern" Front line health care workers and Ebola survivors say the world has to act quicker.
Model Summary: More than 25,000 people have been infected with Ebola in the last year. Dozens of new cases were reported in the week of April 5.

Actual Summary: Attorney General Holder reiterates Justice Department policy on prostitutes. Soliciting prostitutes is banned, even in places where it's legal, Holder says. His memo comes weeks after a report involving DEA agents and prostitutes.
Model Summary: Attorney General Eric Holder: Prostitution "threatens the core mission of the department" The directive applies to all U.S. Justice Department personnel, including agents and prosecutors. It comes after a report found DEA agents in foreign postings had sex parties with prostitutes.

Actual Summary: Nashville's district attorney banned prosecutors from offering female sterilization in plea deals. Danny Cevallos: Present-day sterilization plea deals are voluntary and unlike creepy antiquated practices.
Model Summary: A Tennessee district attorney has banned prosecutors from offering female sterilization in plea deals. Luke Francona: Sterilization as a punishment is not a new idea; it's been done for years.

Actual Summary: Haroon Moghul: Tsarnaev found guilty in terrorist bombing of Boston Marathon. How to prevent future such acts by young Muslims? Pew reports by 2050, one in 4 will be Muslim. Many equate terror with Islam. Not true, but we should grasp what causes radicalization. Moghul: Muslims see their community besieged around world, some think solution is violence. They must be shown other way to help.
Model Summary: Frida Ghitis: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev's guilty verdict isn't surprising, but it could be a wake-up call. She says radicalization is rooted in politics, religion and identity; it's about being part of a community. Ghitis says we need to show young Muslims that extremism doesn't help them; it harms them.

Actual Summary: Errol Louis: By chance a bystander video caught South Carolina officer shooting apparently unarmed black man. Federal law on reporting of such shootings goes unenforced -- how many instances do we never hear about? he asks. Louis: It's long past time for officials to tell the truth -- even when there's no video.
Model Summary: Michael Slager's shooting death of Walter Scott raises troubling questions about police killings in U.S.

Actual Summary: Dean Obeidallah: Apple's new emoji lineup is diverse in race, ethnicity and sexual orientation. It's just like America, but what took Apple so long? Obeidallah asks. He says change may rankle (or win over?) conservatives who discriminate against people because of their sexual orientation.
Model Summary: Apple released a new version of its mobile operating system that includes more diversity than ever.

Actual Summary: Jennifer Lawless: There's a strong temptation to view Hillary Clinton's candidacy as all about cracking the glass ceiling for women. She says the reality is that most people will vote not on gender but on the economy and partisanship.
Model Summary: Julian Zelizer: Hillary Clinton's candidacy will be a barometer for gender equality in U.S.

Actual Summary: Sequel to popular "Bible" miniseries debuting on NBC. "Mad Men" premieres the first of its final episodes. Netflix premieres its first Marvel series, "Daredevil"
Model Summary: "A.D. The Bible Continues" debuts on NBC on Easter Sunday. "Mad Men's" final episodes will air on AMC on Sunday. Louis C.K.'s comedy "Louie" returns for a fifth season. Billy Crystal's "The Comedians" is a mockumentary.

Actual Summary: Pentagon releases map showing coalition forces have taken back 25-30% of Iraq territory from ISIS. Counterinsurgency specialist Afzal Ashraf on what new data tells us about fight. Ashraf: Where it counts (ISIS is) not standing and fighting.
Model Summary: Pentagon map shows coalition forces have taken back 25-30% of Iraqi territory seized by ISIS. CNN asked Afzal Ashraf, a counterinsurgency specialist, what this data tells us about the fight against ISIS.

Actual Summary: Arsenal beat Burnley 1-0 in the EPL. A goal from Aaron Ramsey secured all three points. Win cuts Chelsea's EPL lead to four points.
Model Summary: Arsenal beat Burnley 1-0 at Turf Moor to keep title hopes alive. Arsenal now four points behind leaders Chelsea. Aston Villa and Crystal Palace both win. Sunderland lose at home to Crystal Palace.

Actual Summary: Mark O'Mara: Video captured Michael Slager shooting Walter Scott; if cop had been wearing a body camera, he probably wouldn't have fired. O'Mara says such cameras are expensive, but cheaper than wrongful death payouts -- and the cost of a human life. The underlying problem is racial bias in policing; until that's solved, body cameras are a good interim solution.
Model Summary: Lawrence Lessig: Officer Michael Slager should have been wearing a body camera. He says it could have prevented the fatal shooting of Walter Scott, who was shot eight times.

Actual Summary: Edward McCaffery: There's a fundamental unfairness to U.S. tax laws. But Americans don't care because most of us get a refund on Tax Day, and that makes us happy.
Model Summary: 8 out of 10 American taxpayers get a refund when they file their taxes, and the average amount is close to $3000.

Actual Summary: ISIS raided Yarmouk refugee camp near Damascus on April 1. 18,000 Palestinian refugees remain in the camp, cut off from vital aid. One defiant elderly resident told CNN: "I will not leave the Yarmouk camp even if I am 75 or 76 years old"
Model Summary: Yarmouk camp was set up as a refugee camp for Palestinians in the 1950s. Since 2012 it has been engulfed in the Syrian conflict. ISIS fighters stormed the area two weeks ago.

Actual Summary: MTV Movie Awards host Amy Schumer had some hits and misses during the show. Rebel Wilson tossed in a censor-worthy joke.
Model Summary: The 2015 MTV Movie Awards were held Sunday night. Amy Schumer hosted, and Channing Tatum twerked for Jennifer Lopez.

Actual Summary: Marvel Studios releases first looks at Paul Bettany as the Vision in "Avengers: Age of Ultron" and Charlie Cox in full "Daredevil" costume. Jamie Bell's character of The Thing was also unveiled for 20th Century Fox's Marvel-based reboot of "Fantastic Four" Bryan Singer unveiled the first look at "X-Men: Apocalypse" Angel played by Ben Hardy.
Model Summary: Paul Bettany will play Vision in the "Avengers: Age of Ultron" movie. He joins the cast of the new Netflix series "Daredevil" Director Bryan Singer also announced a new character for "X-Men: Apocalypse"

Actual Summary: Ursula Ward talks about the shock and pain of her son's murder. Odin Lloyd's sister said her brother's death has felt like 'a bad dream'
Model Summary: Aaron Hernandez was convicted of first degree murder and sentenced to life in prison. Odin Lloyd, 27, was killed in June 2013. His mother, sister, uncle and cousin described him as a champion of family.

Actual Summary: Aaron Hernandez has been found guilty in Odin Lloyd's death, but his troubles are not over. He also faces murder charges in Suffolk County, Massachusetts, but trial was postponed. In addition, Hernandez will face two civil lawsuits; one is in relation to Suffolk County case.
Model Summary: Aaron Hernandez could face three more trials. He is accused of killing two men and wounding another near a Boston nightclub in 2012.

Actual Summary: Critically acclaimed series "Orphan Black" returns. "Turn: Washington's Spies" starts a second season. "Game of Thrones" is back for season five.
Model Summary: The second season of "Orphan Black" premieres on Saturday. "Game of Thrones" returns for a fifth season. "Nurse Jackie" wraps up its final season.

Actual Summary: Milano had pumped while on plane. Travelers are asked to carry only what they need.
Model Summary: Actress Alyssa Milano was on a "romantic getaway" when her milk was allegedly confiscated. Heathrow Airport asks that travelers only carry what they need for the flight.

Actual Summary: Prosecutor Ray Gricar has been missing for 10 years. His laptop and hard drive were found too damaged to read. Gricar has been declared legally dead.
Model Summary: Ray Gricar was 59 when he went missing in 2005. His laptop and hard drive were found on the banks of the Susquehanna River.

Actual Summary: Akhil Amar: Lincoln's two biggest legacies, keeping union together and abolishing slavery, had Midwestern roots. Lincoln saw the federal government as pre-eminent and believed there was no logical border for dividing the U.S.
Model Summary: Lincoln's two greatest legacies grew organically from his Midwestern roots.

Actual Summary: Marvel's long-awaited show "Daredevil" began streaming early Friday. Binge-watchers are already giving the series high marks.
Model Summary: Marvel's "Daredevil" premiered its first season on Netflix on Friday. Critics are raving about the show.

Actual Summary: 29 elephants currently live at the circus sanctuary, and 13 more will join by 2018. The expansion comes after Ringling Bros. said it would stop using elephants in circus. $65,000 worth of care annually includes pedicures, stretching and tons -- literally -- of food.
Model Summary: Ringling Bros. Center for Elephant Conservation houses 29 elephants. 13 more will join the group by 2018. Decision to end use of elephants came after years of litigation.

Actual Summary: Citizens gather to honor victims on One Boston Day, two years after the marathon bombings. "Today will always be a little emotional for me," one Bostonian tells CNN.
Model Summary: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev was convicted last week on 30 charges related to the 2013 Boston Marathon bombings. He is scheduled to be sentenced next week; the death penalty is on the table. Wednesday marked "One Boston Day," a day of remembrance for the victims and survivors.

Actual Summary: Students stampeded; some jumped from a fifth story at a dorm; one student died, school officials say. The blasts were caused by faulty electrical cable, and Kenya Power is at the school. The panic came less than two weeks after terrorists attacked Kenya's Garissa University.
Model Summary: University of Nairobi students heard explosions and thought it was a terror attack. They stampeded down the halls of a dormitory and some jumped from its fifth floor. One person died and hundreds were injured.

Actual Summary: Reserve Deputy Robert Bates surrenders to authorities, posts bail of $25,000. Bates is charged with second-degree manslaughter in the killing of Eric Harris.
Model Summary: Tulsa County reserve deputy Robert Bates turns himself in to authorities. He is charged with second-degree manslaughter in the shooting death of Eric Harris. Video shows Bates announcing he is going to deploy his Taser but then shooting Harris in the back with a handgun.

Actual Summary: Somali sisters, Iman and Siham Hashi, make up Faarrow. A fusion of hip-hop, world pop and Afrobeats, they are currently finishing debut album.
Model Summary: Iman and Siham Hashi, sisters from Mogadishu, Somalia, were forced to flee their homeland after war broke out in 1991. They relocated to Canada, where they discovered a passion for music and now have their own label, Faarrow. They describe their Afro-pop sound as "pop with undertones of hip hop and rhythmic African percussion"

Actual Summary: ISIS attacked the Baiji oil refinery Saturday. The refinery, Iraq's largest, has long been a lucrative target for militants.
Model Summary: Hundreds of additional Iraqi troops are being sent to reinforce colleagues at Baiji oil refinery, Hasd Al-Shaabi militia says. The reinforcements come four days after ISIS began attacking Iraq's largest oil refinery.

Actual Summary: The operator of the Fukushima nuclear plant said it has abandoned a robotic probe inside one of the damaged reactors. A report stated that a fallen object has left the robot stranded. The robot collected data on radiation levels and investigated the spread of debris.
Model Summary: The robot was set out to collect data on radiation levels and investigate the spread of debris. It stalled after moving about 10 meters, according to Tokyo Electric Power Company. TEPCO decided to cut off the cable after it had covered two-thirds of its planned route.

Actual Summary: Saudi general says more than 1,200 airstrikes since campaign began March 26. Three Saudis were killed in attack on border position, source tells CNN.
Model Summary: More than 500 Houthi rebels have been killed, a Saudi official says. The nine-nation coalition has undertaken 1,200 airstrikes since March 26, he says.

Actual Summary: Tourists and locals queue for several hours to get their hands on Jenny's butter cookies. People are even hired to stand in line to buy the cookies, which are later sold at an up-to-70% mark-up. Food frenzies have also taken place in other parts of the world.
Model Summary: People in Hong Kong are lining up for hours to get their hands on Jenny's cookies. The buttery treats cost $9 a tin and are popular with tourists and locals. Bakery owners are discouraging people from buying knockoffs.

Actual Summary: Woman leaves explosives-laden handbag beside bus during boarding. No group has claimed responsibility, but Boko Haram is suspected.
Model Summary: Explosion outside a bus station in Gombe, Nigeria, kills at least five people and injures more than a dozen, witnesses say. Woman left her explosives-laden handbag near a bus filling up with passengers, a witness says. No one has claimed responsibility for the attack, but Boko Haram is the main suspect.

Actual Summary: Obama's point man in ISIS fight doesn't rule out U.S. military action beyond Iraq and Syria. Brett McGurk: Iraqi leader making progress with Sunni tribes in planned Anbar offensive.
Model Summary: Brett McGurk is the Obama administration's point man in the fight against ISIS. He says the number of foreign fighters in Syria is "off the charts historically"

Actual Summary: "Amy" features archival footage of the singer and original music tracks. "Amy" seeks to "truly capture not just the great artist that she was," filmmakers say. Winehouse, who died at 27, said fame would probably drive her "mad"
Model Summary: Amy Winehouse documentary "Amy: The Girl Behind the Name" is set for UK release on July 3. The first trailer features early footage of the late singer talking about her music career. Winehouse died from alcohol poisoning at the age of 27 in 2011.

Actual Summary: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev was found guilty of all 30 counts, may face death penalty. The sentencing phase starts April 21; a judge predicts it will last four weeks. He warns jurors not to do anything that could be prejudicial to the case.
Model Summary: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev's sentencing phase begins April 21, a day after the Boston Marathon. Federal Judge George A. O'Toole tells jurors not to attend any events related to the marathon. Tsarnaev was convicted on all 30 of the charges against him.

Actual Summary: Alexander Blair, 28, of Topeka accused of knowing about bomb plot but not contacting authorities. Fort Riley's security was never breached and the device was "inert" and not a threat, authorities say. John T. Booker Jr., 20, of Topeka had acquired bomb parts and made a propaganda video, the Justice Department says.
Model Summary: John T. Booker Jr., an American citizen also known as Mohammed Abdullah Hassan, was arrested Friday. He was charged with trying to detonate a car bomb at Fort Riley military base in Kansas. A second man allegedly knew about the bomb plot but didn't call authorities.

Actual Summary: Actress Gwyneth Paltrow is trying to live on $29 worth of food for one week. It's a part of the #FoodBankNYCChallenge, which is bringing awareness to food poverty. Paltrow was nominated by her friend chef Mario Batali.
Model Summary: Gwyneth Paltrow is participating in the #FoodBankNYCChallenge. The challenge is an attempt to live on a food stamp budget for one week.

Actual Summary: Rowing team at Washington University attacked by flying carp. Member of the team caught the attack on video.
Model Summary: A swarm of Asian carp attacked the Washington University of rowing team's boat. The team was practicing on Creve Coeur Lake near St. Louis.

Actual Summary: Muhammadu Buhari tells CNN's Christiane Amanpour that he will fight corruption in Nigeria. Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa and is grappling with violent Boko Haram extremists. Nigeria is also Africa's biggest economy, but up to 70% of Nigerians live on less than a dollar a day.
Model Summary: Muhammadu Buhari tells Christiane Amanpour he plans to aggressively fight corruption. He says he'll focus on curbing violence in the northeast, where Boko Haram operates. Buharian defeated incumbent Goodluck Jonathan by about 2 million votes.

Actual Summary: Families flee parts of western Iraq amid continuing onslaught from ISIS fighters. Officials there say the Iraqi government is failing to protect them. Thousands have been forced to grab what they can and head east toward the capital.
Model Summary: Over the weekend ISIS fighters moved into towns just to the north of Ramadi, which lies 68 miles (110km) west of Baghdad, sending thousands fleeing on foot into the city.

Actual Summary: Amina Ali Qassim's family sought shelter in a mosque before fleeing Yemen. Thousands like them are boarding boats to sail to Djibouti. Saudi Arabia has been pounding Yemen in a bid to defeat Houthi rebels.
Model Summary: Amina Ali Qassim and her family fled the Yemeni island of Birim to Djibouti in a boat with 25 other families. The boat journey across the Bab al-Mandab Strait was a "catastrophe," her son says.

Actual Summary: Georgia Gov. Nathan Deal signs a medical marijuana bill. The bill is inspired by Haleigh Cox, a 5-year-old whose seizures threatened her life.
Model Summary: Georgia Gov. Nathan Deal signs bill that will legalize low-THC cannabis oil for certain "medication-resistant epilepsies" Haleigh Cox, 5, has been the face of the bill after her mother moved her to Colorado for treatment.

Actual Summary: Carolina Sandretto focuses on the crumbling buildings many Cubans live in together. The maze-like "solares" often include separate families under one roof.
Model Summary: Photographer Carolina Sandretto focuses on "solares," the crumbling buildings that many Cubans divide and cohabitate. Many families share one dwelling, often with several generations and separate families sharing one dwelling.

Actual Summary: Framework agreement with Iran over its nuclear program was reached this month. Julian Zelizer: White House should seek congressional approval for final deal. There's a history of Congress causing trouble for major international treaties, he says.
Model Summary: Julian Zelizer: It's a mistake to say Obama doesn't need Congress' approval for Iran nuclear deal. He says history shows presidents have succeeded in getting Congress to ratify important international agreements.

Actual Summary: Country band Lady Antebellum's bus caught fire Thursday on a Texas freeway. A CNN iReporter captured the dramatic scene on video. Singer Hillary Scott shared a pic of the charred bus on Instagram.
Model Summary: Lady Antebellum singer Hillary Scott's tour bus catches fire on a Texas freeway. Everyone on board was safely evacuated, Scott says on Instagram.

Actual Summary: Bill passes 92 to 8; passage came just hours before cuts to physicians would have taken place. GOP presidential candidates Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio vote against the bill, candidate Rand Paul votes for it.
Model Summary: The Senate passes a Medicare reform bill 92 to 8. The bill includes a permanent solution to the "doc fix" The House passed the bill more than two weeks ago.

Actual Summary: An Australian woman finds a ring while snorkeling in Bali. Words engraved on the antique ring give clues to its owner's identity.
Model Summary: Roxy Walsh found the ring while snorkeling at Finn's Beach in Bali. It was engraved with the words, "Darling Joe, Happy 70th Birthday 2009. Love Jenny" Walsh posted the find on her company's Facebook page, Kids in Adelaide. She was able to reunite the ring with its owner, Joe Langley, in Noosa, Australia.

Actual Summary: Six people, including one civilian, are killed when a car bomb explodes near a police station. Six others are killed when their armored vehicle is attacked on a highway in northern Sinai. Ansar Beit Al-Maqdis, an ISIS affiliate, claims responsibility.
Model Summary: Ansar Beit Al-Maqdis, an ISIS affiliate, claims responsibility for a car bomb attack in Al-Arish. Six people, including one civilian, are killed in a separate attack on a police station, authorities say.

Actual Summary: P!nk took to Twitter to address online comments about her body. Her "squishiness" is a result of happiness, she says.
Model Summary: P!nk responded to body-haters after she posted a photo of herself in a black dress to a cancer benefit. Her response rallied her fans, who started sharing photos of themselves post-pregnancy.

Actual Summary: Cynthia Lennon was John Lennon's first wife. She was there during the rise of the Beatles. Her death was announced by her son, Julian.
Model Summary: Cynthia Lennon died at her home in Mallorca, Spain, after a short but brave battle with cancer. She and John Lennon were married for six years. She wrote two books about her marriage to the Beatle.

Actual Summary: President Barack Obama is attending the Summit of the Americas. Frida Ghitis says he must work to improve ties with region.
Model Summary: U.S. President Barack Obama and Cuban President Raul Castro will meet this week in Panama. Julian Zelizer: Obama needs to put on a strong performance at the Summit of the Americas.

Actual Summary: Australia to cut welfare benefits for parents who refuse to vaccinate their children. The "no jab, no pay" policy will come into effect in January 2016. The Australian government estimates more than 39,000 children who have not been vaccinated.
Model Summary: Parents who refuse to vaccinate their children can lose up to $11,000 of welfare benefits a year under a new government policy. The Australian government estimates more than 39,000 children under the age of seven have not been vaccinated because of their parents' objections.

Actual Summary: The items were originally given to a historian who opposed the camps, CNN affiliate reports. Auctioneer hoped they would be bought by museum or someone who would donate them for historical appreciation. Japanese-Americans were furious about items from family members, others being sold.
Model Summary: The items were made by Japanese-Americans confined to World War II internment camps. "Star Trek" actor George Takei led a campaign to stop the sale of the items.

Actual Summary: Hanan, 19, was captured by ISIS when militants took the town of Sinjar. She was among the women and girls separated to be sold as sex slaves.
Model Summary: Thousands of Yazidi women and girls were taken captive by ISIS in August. They were separated from their families and sold as sex slaves. Hanan, 19, was one of 25 Yazidi girls who managed to escape. She tells CNN about her ordeal in the Shariya refugee camp.

Actual Summary: V. Stiviano must pay back $2.6 million in gifts from Donald Sterling. Sterling's wife claimed the ex-Clippers used the couple's money for the gifts. The items included a Ferrari, two Bentleys and a Range Rover.
Model Summary: A judge orders V. Stiviano to pay back more than $2.6 million in gifts from Donald Sterling. The gifts included a Ferrari, two Bentleys and a Range Rover. Sterling's wife sued her, accusing her of targeting wealthy older men.

Actual Summary: Officers arrested Jason Rezaian and his wife in July on unspecified allegations. It took months to charge him; charges were made public last week. The Washington Post and the State Department find the charges "absurd"
Model Summary: Jason Rezaian, the Washington Post's bureau chief in Tehran, was arrested in July. He is accused of economic spying, according to Iranian state media. The State Department calls the charges "absurd"

Actual Summary: Thabo Sefolosha says he "experienced a significant injury and... the injury was caused by the police" He and teammate Pero Antic were arrested near the scene of a stabbing early April 8. They were not involved in the stabbing police said, but they were arrested for obstruction, other charges.
Model Summary: Thabo Sefolosha says he suffered a season-ending leg injury when he was arrested last week. The Atlanta Hawks guard and teammate Pero Antic were arrested near the scene of a stabbing.

Actual Summary: Gaioz Nigalidze is banned from the Dubai Open Chess Tournament. Officials say he frequented the bathroom, where his phone was hidden in toilet paper. That phone had a chess analysis application open, officials say.
Model Summary: Georgian chess grandmaster Gaioz Nigalidze has been banned from the Dubai Open Chess Tournament. Officials discovered he was darting to the toilet to consult his smartphone, which was logged onto a chess analysis app.

Actual Summary: Al Qaeda confirms that two of its leaders were killed in January drone strikes. Other leaders have been killed or captured recently. The terrorist group's capacity to carry out attacks in the West has been greatly diminished.
Model Summary: Al Qaeda confirmed the deaths of two of its top leaders in January. Peter Bergen says the deaths show how al Qaeda has been decimated.

Actual Summary: Maricopa County Sheriff's Office in Arizona says Robert Bates never trained with them. "He met every requirement, and all he did was give of himself," his attorney says. Tulsa World newspaper: Three supervisors who refused to sign forged records on Robert Bates were reassigned.
Model Summary: Tulsa County Sheriff's Office denies allegations in a new newspaper report. Robert Bates, 73, is accused of killing Eric Harris during a police sting operation in April. A newspaper report says supervisors were told to falsify training records for Bates.

Actual Summary: TV5Monde went black late Wednesday and was still out hours later. The network blames an "Islamist group"; there's no claim of responsibility.
Model Summary: French-language global TV network TV5Monde lost control of its 11 channels and its social media outlets. The network says it was "hacked by an Islamist group," but no one has claimed responsibility.

Actual Summary: Robby Mook, Hillary Clinton's soon-to-be campaign manager, distributes a "values statement" The memo maintains that the campaign must remain humble, disciplined and united.
Model Summary: Hillary Clinton's campaign-in-waiting met Saturday in its Brooklyn headquarters. Robby Mook, Clinton's soon-to-be campaign manager, distributed a "values statement" The document outlines what the campaign will stand for, what their goals are and how they plan to win. Clinton is planning to officially announce her presidential candidacy on Sunday.

Actual Summary: John Helinski's ID and Social Security cards had been stolen. His case worker and a cop had to get foreign ID papers to get him a driver's license. Then Helinski remembered a bank account he used to have.
Model Summary: John Helinski was homeless and nameless for three years. His ID and Social Security cards were stolen. A big-hearted cop and a case worker helped him get back into the system.

Actual Summary: The cause of a gas line explosion in Fresno, California, is unknown. Two of the injured were undergoing emergency surgery.
Model Summary: Natural gas line explosion injures 11 people, including two sheriff's deputies, sheriff says. Blast happened at spot where county worker was operating front loader. Most serious injuries were suffered by inmates assigned to work detail at firing range.

Actual Summary: Foreign fighters are increasingly signing up to fight ISIS on the front lines. For some of the jihadist group's foes, foreign fighters are not welcome comrades. Training and logistical support, some argue, is the best way to support the fight against ISIS.
Model Summary: U.S. military training efforts are being supplemented by outside agencies. Dozens of foreigners, including Americans, have volunteered to take the fight to ISIS.

Actual Summary: The film's cast is diverse. EW points out that Hollywood still needs to catch up. One of the stars says the franchise has evolved.
Model Summary: Vin Diesel predicts "Furious 7" will win best picture at the Oscars. The cast is racially and ethnically diverse. The "Fast and Furious" films have a diverse focus and appeal.

Actual Summary: Officials say 131 Californians were affected by one strain, five by other strains. About 70% of the people who could show health records were unvaccinated. Outbreak began in December among visitors to two Disney theme parks.
Model Summary: It has been 42 days since the last known case of the B3 strain of measles in California. Of 131 cases, 81 people were able to get the vaccination status for 81 of them.

Model Summary: Aaron Hernandez was convicted of first-degree murder in the death of Odin Lloyd. The jury deliberated more than 35 hours over parts of seven days. "It's the hardest thing I've ever done in my life," one juror says.

Actual Summary: Third suspect identified as George Davon Kennedy of Murfreesboro, Tennessee. Young woman was raped on a crowded beach in broad daylight, police say. Some bystanders saw what was happening and didn't stop it, authorities say.

Two other men have been charged with sexual battery by multiple perpetrators. A woman told police she may have been drugged and gang-raped on a beach.

Actual Summary: USS Oklahoma was lost during Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941. Hundreds of crew members were buried without identification.
Model Summary: Remains of up to nearly 400 service members tied to the USS Oklahoma will be exhumed this year. The USS Oklahoma sank when it was hit by torpedoes on December 7, 1941. A total of 429 sailors and Marines were killed.

Actual Summary: Yarmouk is a refugee camp near Damascus in war-ravaged Syria. Pierre Krähenbühl of the United Nations: Individual lives underscore need for humanitarian action.
Model Summary: U.N. chief Ban Ki-moon visited the Yarmouk refugee camp in Damascus. He met two infants who had been taken from the camp.

Actual Summary: Official: Girl, 15, "expressed an interest in joining a terrorist group called ISIS" Authorities detain girl at Cape Town airport, release her into family's care, he says.
Model Summary: Authorities detained a 15-year-old girl from Cape Town, South Africa, at the city's airport. She had been using social media and reading material that suggested she wanted to join ISIS, official says.

Actual Summary: Kenneth Morgan Stancil, charged with first-degree murder, swears at the judge. Deputies escort him from court after he tries to flip over a table. Stancil is accused of killing an employee at Wayne Community College.
Model Summary: Kenneth Morgan Stancil III is accused of killing an employee at a North Carolina community college. He is charged with first-degree murder and faces the death penalty if convicted. In court Thursday, he swore at a judge and tried to flip over a table.

Actual Summary: "I rate this as No. 1 on my list of things in my life that I regret," Robert Bates tells "Today" He says he didn't mean to kill Eric Harris and rejects claims his training records were forged. "I still can't believe it happened," Bates tells the NBC show.
Model Summary: Robert Bates is accused of manslaughter in the death of Eric Harris. Bates says he mistook his gun for a Taser and shot Harris accidentally. Sheriff's office denies falsifying training records.

Actual Summary: The attack at a Garissa university last week killed 147 people, mostly students. Mohamed Mohamud taught at a Madrassa in the Kenyan town. Authorities fear the rise of homegrown terrorists in the African country.
Model Summary: Mohamed Mohamud is suspected of masterminding the attack on a Kenyan university last week. He once taught at the same religious school as the 147 people killed in the attack. Officials say he is now in command of an Al-Shabaab militia based near Kenya's border with Somalia.

Actual Summary: Previous popes had finessed the question of whether the killing of 1.5 million Armenians was genocide. Because he often shines such a smiley face on the world, it can be easy to forget the bluntness Francis sometimes brings to the bully pulpit.
Model Summary: Pope Francis used the word "genocide" in a speech to mark 100 years since the Armenian genocide. Turkey's foreign minister called it "unacceptable" and "out of touch with historical facts"

Actual Summary: Adrian Peterson had been suspended after pleading guilty to misdemeanor reckless assault. NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell requires him to keep going to counseling, other treatment. Minnesota Vikings, 7-9 last season, say they look forward to him rejoining the team.

Actual Summary: Police say Robert Bates, 73, thought he pulled out his Taser during an arrest. Instead, he shot the suspect, who later died at a local hospital.

Actual Summary: Jack White taking a hiatus from touring after brief acoustic jaunt. He'll play five states he has yet to get to, charge just $3. Places and times of shows are currently a mystery.
Model Summary: Jack White announced he'll take a hiatus from touring. White will wrap his touring efforts in support of "Lazeretto" with a brief, first-ever acoustic tour. The shows will be unannounced until day-of-show.

Actual Summary: Almost 16 million people in Yemen are in need of humanitarian aid, according to U.N. Planeload of aid supplies including food and medicine was flown in to Sanaa on Tuesday. A rare ceasefire was negotiated to allow the plane to land briefly.
Model Summary: CNN was granted rare access to Sanaa Airport on a humanitarian mission by Unicef. More than 100,000 Yemeni civilians have fled their homes since fighting began. UN estimates 15.9 million people in Yemen are in need of assistance.

Actual Summary: The Soviets invaded Poland in World War II and deported hundreds of thousands of people. Tomasz Lazar photographed some of these Poles and listened to their stories.
Model Summary: Tomasz Lazar spent hours photographing and interviewing adults who were ripped from their homes as children in the 1940s. Soviet authorities invaded Poland during World War II and deported hundreds of thousands of Poles.

Actual Summary: Reserve deputy Robert Bates said he meant to use a Taser but accidentally shot and killed a man. Lawyer for slain man's family says Bates wasn't qualified to be on the force and received preferential treatment. "Robert Bates has met all the requisite training required by Oklahoma to be a reserve deputy," Bates' lawyer says.

Actual Summary: Abdirahman Sheik Mohamud pleads not guilty to charges of providing material support to terrorists and lying to the FBI. The Columbus, Ohio, resident became a U.S. citizen in February 2014. In April 2014, he went to Syria for terrorism training, prosecutors say in a news release.
Model Summary: Abdirahman Sheik Mohamud, 23, pleads not guilty to federal charges. He allegedly traveled to Syria for training and wanted to return home to kill Americans.

Model Summary: Andreas Lubitz, co-pilot of Germanwings Flight 9525, was diagnosed with depression. David Perry: Pilots can compartmentalize personal problems, but stress can manifest as depression. He says Lubitz had to go through rigorous training to be a pilot, which raises questions about his mental health. Perry: If he had mental issues, it would have been obvious to those who knew him.

Actual Summary: Here's a roundup of the week's trending pop-culture stories. They include a new "Star Wars" trailer and an ill-advised, on-camera rant.
Model Summary: Producers of "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" unveiled a nearly two-minute trailer. The first set of female quintuplets was born in Houston, Texas.

Actual Summary: Michelle MacLaren is no longer set to direct the first "Wonder Woman" theatrical movie. MacLaren left the project over "creative differences" Movie is currently set for 2017.
Model Summary: Michelle MacLaren is leaving the upcoming "Wonder Woman" movie. She was announced as the director in November. The movie is still set for release on June 23, 2017.

Actual Summary: The young boy's face appeared on milk cartons all across the United States. Patz's case marked a time of heightened awareness of crimes against children. Pedro Hernandez confessed three years ago to the 1979 killing in.
