Model Summary: U.N. report: 1 in 3 women face some form of sexual violence at least once in their lifetime. Study: 80% of women in Mumbai have been street harassed.

Actual Summary: Jonathan Crombie is best known for playing Gilbert Blythe in "Anne of Green Gables" Book, movies about girl sent to live on Canadian farm.
Model Summary: Jonathan Crombie played Gilbert Blythe in the "Anne of Green Gables" movies. He died Wednesday from complications of a brain hemorrhage, producer Kevin Sullivan says.

Actual Summary: Al-Shabaab's attack on Garissa University College is the group's deadliest so far in Kenya. Authors: The group is under pressure from African Union forces and a covert U.S. war.
Model Summary: This week's attack on Garissa University College is Al-Shabaab's fifth major assault in Kenya in the past year and a half.

Actual Summary: Former rap mogul Marion "Suge" Knight will be tried for murder in a videotaped hit-and-run. His bail is reduced to $10 million from $25 million. A judge dismisses one of four charges against Knight.
Model Summary: Marion "Suge" Knight is ordered to stand trial for murder and other charges stemming from a deadly hit-and-run confrontation. The judge also lowered Knight's bail to $10 million from $25 million.

Model Summary: National Park Week runs April 18 through April 26. Most of the National Park Service's 407 sites are free year-round.

Actual Summary: CNN's John Sutter told the story of the "Poor kids of Silicon Valley" HUD Secretary Julián Castro: Our shortage of affordable housing is a national crisis that stunts the economy.
Model Summary: Stephanie Coontz: 7.7 million low-income households live in substandard housing.

Model Summary: Carol Costello: Rolling Stone's mistakes amount to journalistic malpractice. She says magazine's reaction to Columbia report shows it's not ready to change its operations.

Model Summary: Jon Cryer and James Corden re-created the "Duckie" record-store dance on "Late Late Show" It's one of the best-loved bits from the 1986 John Hughes film.

Actual Summary: Ines Dumig's photo series "Apart Together" follows a Somali refugee living in Germany. The underlying themes include isolation and "otherness" and the search for human dignity.
Model Summary: Ines Dumig's photo series "Apart Together" focuses on Somali refugee Sahra. Sahra is a survivor determined to establish a new life for herself in Germany.

Actual Summary: Stoll is a center who has played for the Kings since 2008. He is reportedly involved with sportscaster and "Dancing with the Stars" host Erin Andrews.
Model Summary: L.A. Kings center Jarret Stoll is charged with possession of controlled substances, KSNV reports. He is reportedly involved with TV personality Erin Andrews, who co-hosts "Dancing with the Stars"

He shoplifted the gun and ammo from a Walmart, where a saleswoman who showed him the weapon alerted security. Walmart says the lock was properly installed but police say it was loose when it was found.

But 10 seconds later he fired into the air, and less than a minute later a police car slammed into him. He was hospitalized and faces 15 charges, including shoplifting.

Model Summary: ISIS claims responsibility for a suicide car bomb attack near the U.S. Consulate in Irbil, Iraq. Police say at least four people were killed and 18 injured in the attack. All American Consulate personnel are safe and accounted for, the State Department says.

Actual Summary: South Africa is battling xenophobic violence after some said foreigners are taking jobs away. A 14-year-old boy is among those killed after a mob with machetes targeted foreigners.

Actual Summary: Davion Only took to the pulpit to find a forever home. After some setbacks, his family is set to make it official in April.

Model Summary: Sen. Elizabeth Warren says she won't back down on her calls for breaking up banks. Julian Zelizer: Democrats need to take on Wall Street and tackle economic inequality.

Model Summary: Thursday marks three weeks since Saudi Arabia began airstrikes on Houthi rebels in Yemen. There is little sign that the rebels are being driven back or that lives are being saved.

Actual Summary: 20-year-old American dancer makes $240 a month at Kremlin Ballet Theatre. Joy Womack studied at Bolshoi Ballet Academy but left in cloud of controversy.

Actual Summary: Nepal civil war aftermath inspired Maggie Doyne to help children. Doyne's BlinkNow Foundation supports a home for 50 children and a school that educates hundreds more. Do you know a hero? Nominations are open for 2015 CNN Heroes.

Model Summary: Photographer Timothy Bouldry captures what it's like to live inside a landfill in India. The Boragaon landfill in Guwahati is home to about 100 families who scavenge for recyclable materials.

Model Summary: J.J. Abrams and the cast of "Star Wars: Episode VII -- The Force Awakens" introduced the new film. The trailer was emotional, with many crying and cheering.

Actual Summary: The city with most multimillionaires in Africa is Johannesburg. However a crop of new pretenders have been expanding their millionaire count.

Model Summary: ISIS has been using Abu Ghraib and other cases of Western abuse to legitimize its current actions in Iraq as the latest episodes in over a decade of constant "Sunni resistance" to "American aggression" and to "Shiite betrayal," authors say.

Model Summary: Robert Kennedy Jr. compared "vaccine-induced" autism to the Holocaust.

Actual Summary: President Obama attends Howard University roundtable on climate change and public health. Linking climate change to how it affects a person's health is a new way to talk about the subject.
Model Summary: President Barack Obama joined U.S. Surgeon General Dr. Vivek Murthy and EPA Administrator Gina McCarthy for a roundtable discussion on climate change. Obama: "There are a whole host of public health impacts that are going to hit home" The World Health Organization estimates climate change will cause an additional 250,000 deaths per year between 2030 and 2050.

Actual Summary: A selection of notes from British artist's 1,500-note collection goes on display in London. Artist spent six years trawling streets finding scraps of paper detailing people's lives. In era of smartphones and social media, notes provide reminder of power of handwritten word.

Pharmacists say role as health care providers conflicts with participation in lethal injection. The pharmacy association first adopted a policy against lethal injection in 1985.

Model Summary: Mike Rowe meets Chad Pregracke, the founder of Living Lands & Waters. The nonprofit has collected 8.4 million pounds of trash from U.S. waterways.

Actual Summary: Josh and Vanessa Ellis, a couple in their 20s, were youth pastors in a suburban Seattle church. They and their 8-month-old son, Hudson, are killed when a highway barrier falls on their car. "We are stunned! Shocked!" the church's lead pastor writes on Facebook.

Actual Summary: Ford Vox: Florida law keeps doctors from talking gun safety with patients; Arizona law forces doctors to promote disputed abortion claim. He says doctor organizations are failing to defend medical profession against politically motivated interference by clueless lawmakers.

Actual Summary: Italian Navy's "Mare Nostrum" mission to rescue would-be migrants in peril rescued an estimated 100,000 people. Operation ended in October 2014, but the tide of people trying to cross the Mediterranean has not abated. Italy has borne brunt of task of picking up, sheltering and providing food and medical help to illegal migrants.
Model Summary: Mare Nostrum was a naval mission that rescued would-be migrants in peril as they tried to cross the Mediterranean to seek security and a new life in Europe. Without European support, the Italian government cut back the naval assets dedicated to rescuing migrants.

Actual Summary: Keith Crandall: Five years after the Deepwater Horizon rig exploded, we are only beginning to understand its effects on the Gulf. A crab species may be a key indicator of the impact, he says.
Model Summary: Five years after the Deepwater Horizon oil spill, scientists are trying to understand the effects of the disaster.

He says a plea might have been better, to keep bomber out of the news and let him fade into obscurity in maximum security cell. Kennedy: The people who deserve to be remembered are victims and MIT officer who was killed.

Model Summary: The TV season is winding down, and the finales are starting. "The Americans," "Scorpion," "Vikings," "Fresh Off the Boat" and "Broadchurch" are all airing this week.

Model Summary: "Fantastic Four" and "Jurassic World" both release new trailers this weekend.

Gray has a criminal history but it's unclear whether that had anything to do with his arrest, or death.

Model Summary: Olivia Wilde and Garrett Hedlund will reprise their roles from 2010's "Tron: Legacy" The sequel is being directed by Joseph Kosinski.

Model Summary: Stunning sunsets were the result of raging wildfires in parts of Siberia. Winds carried the smoke across the Pacific Ocean and brought it to the Pacific Northwest.

Model Summary: Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott has been caught on camera guzzling a glass of beer in seven seconds. He was in a Sydney pub on Saturday evening when a group of Australian rules football players invited him to have a drink with them.

Actual Summary: ACMs celebrated 50 years Sunday night. Best moments: Garth Brooks, Reba McEntire, Taylor Swift's mom.
Model Summary: The Academy of Country Music Awards celebrated its 50th anniversary on Sunday night. Garth Brooks saluted the U.S. military during his performance of "All-American Kid"

Actual Summary: Find the FDA's official report for the recalled product. If the product is within the use-by date, it should still be recalled.
Model Summary: Sabra hummus was recalled last month due to possible listeria contamination. John Swartzberg, M.D., says there's no way to know if your food is safe to eat. He says to check the official recall report on the Food and Drug Administration website.

Model Summary: New Line Cinema is planning a Mariah Carey Christmas movie. Producer Jonathan Shestack confirmed that he is working on the project. Her 1994 hit "All I Want For Christmas is You" is a classic.

Model Summary: Saudi Arabia has executed a second Indonesian domestic worker this week. Jakarta has called for clemency for a number of foreigners on death row.

Model Summary: The fire has burned nearly 2,000 acres in Miami-Dade County. It was 50% contained Monday night.

Actual Summary: The iPad was engraved with "His Holiness Francisco" and "Vatican Internet Service, March 2013" A Harley-Davidson the Pope donated to charity sold for $284,000 last year.

Model Summary: A small boat carrying about 50 migrants left from the area of Le Borgne, west of Cap-Haitien. It was caught in bad weather and sank as it tried to return to shore.

Actual Summary: Cyclist Wang Pingan had his cycle stolen just days before completing an epic ride around China. Locked bike was stolen outside an electronics market in Shenzhen, Guandong Province. Wang had vowed to complete his journey by foot, but police managed to recover it against the odds.

Model Summary: Recent spikes in HIV and hepatitis C infections among injecting drug users have brought up the topic of syringe exchange programs again.

Model Summary: A new species of glassfrog has been discovered in Costa Rica. The species is called Diane's bare-hearted glassfrog.

Actual Summary: Alfred Taubman, who died Friday, was active in philanthropy and worth an estimated $3.1 billion. Model Summary: Alfred Taubman, a real estate developer who helped change the face of suburban life, dies at 91. He is credited with popularizing upscale indoor shopping malls in the U.S. He was born in 1924 in Michigan to German Jewish immigrants.

Actual Summary: Phnom Penh, the Cambodian capital, fell to the genocidal Khmer Rouge 40 years ago today. At least 1.7 million people were killed in the subsequent four years, before the regime was driven out. Decades on, the country is still struggling to gain justice for victims and heal from the genocide.

Actual Summary: Larry Upright's family says he would enjoy the request. Some vow to honor it, but others say they'll still vote for Hillary Clinton.

Model Summary: Hugh Rodham was buried in Scranton, Pennsylvania, in 1993. His headstone was found tipped over this week, just a couple of days after Hillary Clinton announced her run for president. Police are investigating, but no other headstones were knocked over.

Actual Summary: Tsarnaev family members arrive in Boston, but it's not clear if they'll testify. A woman testifies that she had to choose whether to keep her leg; some other victims had no choice. Model Summary: WWF report: Economic powerhouse of the ocean is under assault, valued at $24 trillion. WWF: 70 percent of ocean's overall economic value relies on its continued health.

Actual Summary: "We all share the same pain," Valerie Braham tells Memorial Day crowd in Israel. Her husband, Philippe Braham, was among 17 killed in January's terror attacks in Paris. French authorities foil a new terror plot -- a painful reminder of widow's recent loss.
Model Summary: Valerie Braham's husband, Philippe, was killed in January's terror attacks in Paris. He was laid to rest in Jerusalem's Givat Shaul cemetery after the attacks.

Actual Summary: Would-be immigrants come from more than 20 countries to North Africa to cross Mediterranean to Europe. They risk their lives crossing deserts and mountains; many are robbed or cheated as they try to reach the Libyan coast.
Model Summary: Eritreans and Syrians made up half of the migrant traffic to Europe last year. Somalis flee Al-Shabaab and clan warfare; Syrians have given up hope of returning home. Upheavals and instability across much of Africa and the Middle East.

Actual Summary: South Korean investigators say they have proof that North Korea is launching cyberattacks. Reports say the North is investing heavily in digital warfare. December attack on banks in South Korea caused about $820 million worth of damage, a report says.
Model Summary: Experts say North Korea is increasingly investing in cyberwarfare. In March, a cyberattack paralyzed banks and broadcasters in South Korea. In December, computers at the country's nuclear operator were breached. South Korean authorities say they have the actual malicious codes used in the attacks.

Actual Summary: Meaghan Keeler-Pettigrew, Stuart Bradin: U.S. must rethink special forces. United States is spreading foreign military assistance too thin, they say.
Model Summary: Peter Bergen: U.S. is failing its partners by not investing enough in special operations forces.

Actual Summary: Former Yemeni President Ali Abdullah Saleh will leave, a source says. Ousted leader Abdu Rabu Mansour Hadi promises to return. Next phase, called "Operation Renewal of Hope," will focus on political process.
Model Summary: "Operation Renewal of Hope" will focus on the political process, Saudi officials say. A Saudi-led coalition has been bombing Houthi positions in Yemen for nearly a month.

Actual Summary: Indonesia has advised foreign consular officials to travel to Indonesia's "execution island" The 10 death row inmates being held have had their legal bids rejected. They include Australian "Bali Nine" members Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran.
Model Summary: Indonesia has ordered preparations for the execution of 10 inmates on death row. They include Filipina maid Mary Jane Veloso and Australians Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran. Convicts had their petitions for clemency denied by President Joko Widodo in late 2014.

Actual Summary: FAA backtracks on saying crew reported a pressurization problem. One passenger lost consciousness. The plane descended 28,000 feet in three minutes.
Model Summary: SkyWest Airlines flight makes emergency landing in Buffalo, New York. Passenger received medical attention before being released, spokeswoman says. Plane descended 28,000 feet in three minutes.

Actual Summary: New Orleans bars are smoke-free as of Wednesday morning. A lawsuit by Harrah's and bar owners seeks to overturn the ban.
Model Summary: The New Orleans City Council passed a ban against smoking in most places in January. Harrah's New Orleans and bar owners filed a lawsuit to stop the ban.

Actual Summary: Rebecca Francis' photo with a giraffe was shared by Ricky Gervais. Francis was threatened on Twitter for the picture. Francis, a hunter, said the giraffe was "close to death" and became food for locals.
Model Summary: Rebecca Francis posed for a photo while lying next to a dead giraffe five years ago. Comedian Ricky Gervais tweeted the photo with a question. Francis says she was asked to "preserve" the giraffe for the local people.

Actual Summary: Ruth Ben-Ghiat: Italy's colonial past plays a key role in the migrant humanitarian disaster in the Mediterranean. She says African migrants still bound to histories of exploitation that shaped their home countries long after end of Italian rule.
Model Summary: Migrants fleeing Libya are part of a century-long chain of migrations, expulsions, and exiles sparked by Italy's imperial ambition and commercial interests.

Actual Summary: Scott Kelley, stepfather accused of kidnapping, is arrested at the Atlanta airport. Mother Genevieve Kelley's trial is set to begin next month. Mary Nunes' father says he is "overjoyed she is alive and back in the US"
Model Summary: Scott Kelley, 50, was arrested at the Atlanta airport after arriving on a flight from Costa Rica. He and his wife, Genevieve, are accused of kidnapping their 8-year-old daughter in 2004. The case was featured on CNN's "The Hunt"

Actual Summary: Vidarbha, the eastern region of the state of Maharashtra, is known as the epicenter of the suicide crisis. Farmers are becoming burdened with debt due to falling prices but rising costs.
Model Summary: One cotton farmer commits suicide every eight hours in Western India's cotton production belt. Vidarbha, in Maharashtra state, is known as the epicenter of the suicide crisis. Record cotton production in 2014 pushed down prices, leaving many farmers in debt.

Actual Summary: The whale, Varvara, swam a round trip from Russia to Mexico, nearly 14,000 miles. The previous record was set by a humpback whale that migrated more than 10,000 miles.
Model Summary: The whale, named Varvara, swam nearly 14,000 miles (22,500 kilometers) She left her primary feeding ground off Russia's Sakhalin Island to cross the Pacific Ocean.

Actual Summary: Vatanka: Tensions between Iran and Saudi Arabia are at an unprecedented level. Iran has proposed a four-point plan for Yemen but Saudis have ignored it. Vatanka: Saudis have tried to muster a ground invasion coalition but have failed.
Model Summary: Relations between Iran and Saudi Arabia have always been thorny, but rarely has the state of affairs been as venomous as it is today. Both sides blame the other for much of the turmoil in the Middle East.

Actual Summary: Wei Tingting, Wang Man, Zheng Churan, Li Tingting and Wu Rongrong are free. They will be under police surveillance for a year and have their activities restricted, attorney says. The international community has harshly criticized keeping the women in custody.
Model Summary: The women will be under police surveillance for a year, their attorney says. They were detained days before events planned for International Women's Day.

Actual Summary: Victoria Maizes, a doctor, says she avoids Girl Scout cookies because they contain sugar, fats. Can't Scouts promote healthy snacks? She says pediatricians offer little guidance on nutrition, yet a diet low in sugars, GMO's, transfats, lowers overall mortality.
Model Summary: Carol Maizes: Girl Scout cookies are full of unhealthy ingredients. She says they contain trans fats, high fructose corn syrup, GMO crops, cancer risk. Maizes says more doctors need to teach kids about nutrition.

Actual Summary: Walter Scott was killed by a South Carolina police officer in April. Danny Cevallos: Failure to pay child support should be a civil matter, not a crime.
Model Summary: Walter Scott was arrested on a bench warrant for $18,000 in unpaid child support in South Carolina. Aaron Carroll: Bench warrants for deadbeat dads are not arrest warrants for crimes. Failure to pay child support is not a crime; it's a civil matter, Carroll says.

Actual Summary: Video shows ESPN reporter Britt McHenry berating and belittling a tow company worker. Drexler: She was wrong to act that way, but aren't we too quick to judge without seeing full video?
Model Summary: ESPN's Britt McHenry was caught on camera berating and belittling an employee of a tow company. Frida Ghitis: We're quick to condemn McHenry, but we don't know her side of the story.

Actual Summary: In a few years, the military will be unable to recruit enough qualified soldiers because of America's obesity problem. Carol Costello: We have a serious national security issue at hand, but it's within our control if we could own up to it.
Model Summary: Gen. Allen Batschelet: By 2020, only 10% of U.S. recruits will be overweight. He says obesity is a national security issue. Dr. Sanjay Gupta: Why are we so afraid to admit we have a weight problem?

Actual Summary: Aaron Hernandez will serve life in Souza-Baranowski Correctional Center outside Boston. Souza opened in 1998 and is one of the most high-tech jails in the United States. It's also "dangerous," "sterile" and "violent," a legal advocate for inmates says.
Model Summary: Aaron Hernandez is being processed at Massachusetts' flagship maximum-security prison. It's one of the most high-tech jails in the United States with no history of breakouts.

Actual Summary: U.S. Sen. Jim Inhofe: Nuclear is our largest source of carbon-free energy, generating over 60% of our carbon-free electricity. So why doesn't the President's climate plan, allegedly aimed at reducing carbon emissions, do more with nuclear power?
Model Summary: Nuclear power is our largest source of carbon-free energy, says Bill Bennett. Bennett: Obama's climate plan is an energy policy plan, not a carbon reduction plan.

Actual Summary: Obama recently explained U.S. foreign policy moves on Iran and Cuba. Sager: Misguided U.S. leadership and policies are reasons for the enduring tragedy in the Middle East.
Model Summary: U.S. President Barack Obama's recent explanation of how his administration will engage with the Middle East is far from reassuring to the region.

Actual Summary: Raul Reyes: In seeking Latino vote, Marco Rubio his own worst enemy on two key issues: immigration reform, Cuba relations. He says on health care, climate change and other issues, he breaks from Latinos' positions. Polls show they don't favor him.
Model Summary: Ruben Navarrette: Marco Rubio has been his own worst enemy on immigration reform and Cuba relations.

Actual Summary: Jurors in sentencing phase in Dzhokhar Tsarnaev's trial hear of loss. Victims testify about the impact of the bombing on their lives.
Model Summary: Adrianne Haslet-Davis and her husband, Adam Davis, were standing near the finish line on the day of the Boston Marathon bombing. "We were so in love and happy together," she told a federal jury Wednesday.

Actual Summary: Peter Moskos: Reserve cop, 73, meant to use a Taser on a man, but shot him dead instead. Why was a volunteer cop witha gun in a violent crimes unit? He says the man may have bought his way in with donations to police. Cops are, and should be, wary of those a little too eager to be police. Moskos: Right approach is unarmed auxiliary cops, like in NYC, volunteering as a way to connect public to police.
Model Summary: Robert Bates, 73, shot and killed a man while playing cops and robbers with real police.

Actual Summary: A businesswoman worries that if Hillary Clinton becomes president, her hormones will make her go to war. Mel Robbins: What's scary is that the bias against women in the workplace is still going strong in 2015.
Model Summary: Cheryl Rios, CEO of Go Ape Marketing, says Hillary Clinton shouldn't be president because of her hormones. Donna Brazile: Hormones aren't the only factor in presidential politics; gender bias is.

Actual Summary: Police say the thieves gained entry through the building's communal elevator shaft. Police give no value of the amount taken in the heist in London's jewelry district. There's no evidence of forced entry to the building, police say.
Model Summary: Police say there was no sign of forced entry in the heist of safe deposit boxes in London's jewelry district. A former police official in London has speculated that the loss could run to 300 million dollars.

Actual Summary: British tabloid releases video it says shows the robbery being carried out. British police say they didn't respond to a burglar alarm in jewelry district. Police give no value of the amount taken in the heist in London's jewelry district.
Model Summary: British police say they knew a burglar alarm went off but didn't respond. Newspaper claims to have video of the heist.

Actual Summary: NFL investigating why game balls provided by New England Patriots for championship game were underinflated. It's not clear when investigation by attorney Ted Wells will be complete. Patriots say they follow the rules and expect to be vindicated and get an apology.
Model Summary: The NFL launched an investigation into the New England Patriots in January. It's still not clear when the investigation will be completed and when the findings will be announced.

Actual Summary: Sawyer Sweeten played across from his twin brother and their sister as the children of Ray and Patricia Barone. Report: Sweeten was visiting family in Texas and is believed to have shot himself.
Model Summary: Sawyer Sweeten was best known for his role as Geoffrey Barone on "Everybody Loves Raymond" He committed suicide early Thursday, his sister says.

Actual Summary: Loeb says he filed the lawsuit and doesn't want want money from his "ex" Nick Loeb reportedly wants to prevent Vergara from destroying the embryos. Vergara spoke of freezing embryos with Loeb in a 2013 interview.
Model Summary: Sofia Vergara is the star of the hit TV sitcom "Modern Family" She split from businessman Nick Loeb in May 2014. Loeb is suing the actress to prevent her from destroying their two frozen embryos.

Actual Summary: S.E. Cupp: Clinton making women central to outreach, but she should really focus on men. In 2014 election, overplaying to one gender failed -- particularly with "war on women"
Model Summary: Hillary Clinton's new campaign video makes it clear she's going all-in on being a woman. Julian Zelizer says it's a good strategy, but it backfired in 2014 midterm elections.

Actual Summary: Collector says he bought the outfit as it was about to be thrown away. Vivien Leigh wore it in several key scenes in the 1939 movie.
Model Summary: Dress worn by Vivien Leigh in "Gone With the Wind" fetches $137,000 at auction. Collector bought it decades ago for $20 as it was on the verge of being tossed out. It was the most sought after item among roughly 150 pieces of movie memorabilia.

Actual Summary: April 20 marks 5 years since the BP oil spill. At the time, there were dire predictions for the environment. Today, it is still too soon to know the long-term impact.
Model Summary: Five years after the Macondo oil spill, scientists are still trying to determine the spill's long-term effects. The company that caused the spill says the Gulf of Mexico is recovering. The government says it's too soon to draw conclusions about the health of the Gulf.

Actual Summary: Ugandan Ashish Thakkar built a vast business empire. The entrepreneur says the answer to unemployment lies in nurturing small businesses. Africa's lack of legacy systems has sped up innovation on the continent.
Model Summary: Ashish Thakkar is one of Africa's most successful entrepreneurs. His Mara Group has operations in over 20 countries. He is the first African to travel to space with Richard Branson's Virgin Galactic.

Actual Summary: A top official with President Dilma Rousseff's ruling party is arrested in bribery probe. Joao Vaccari Neto denies wrongdoing, says all donations were legal. Hundreds of thousands of Brazilians have protested against Rousseff in the last few months.
Model Summary: Joao Vaccari Neto faces charges of corruption and money laundering. He is the treasurer of the ruling Workers' Party.

Actual Summary: Police: Some suspects involved in Pakistan blast that killed, injured more than 300. Evidence suggests Vatican was discussed as a possible target in March 2010, police say. State news: Some members of alleged terrorist cell had direct contact with Osama bin Laden.
Model Summary: Italian authorities launch a "vast anti-terrorism operation" against suspects associated with al Qaeda. Some members of the terrorist cell had direct contact with Osama bin Laden before his death, police say. Police say the group planned to carry out terrorist attacks in Afghanistan and Pakistan.

Actual Summary: Miller: The former secretary of state has to decide whether she's going to differ with Barack Obama's handling of foreign policy. He says her experience overseas could be an asset as long as she doesn't get ensnared by controversy over Obama policies.
Model Summary: Julian Zelizer: Hillary Clinton's foreign policy experience will be an asset in 2016.

Actual Summary: African students and car enthusiasts are creating eco-friendly cars. Nigerian students will compete in an "Eco-Marathon" in May.
Model Summary: Nigeria's ABUCAR 2 will compete in the European leg of this year's Shell Eco-marathon. Students from Makerere University in Uganda are also working on a two-seater electric car. Ghanaian inventor Postle Safo is building electric SUVs with rechargeable batteries.

Actual Summary: Cory Booker: The unfortunate reality is that the United States leads the world in incarceration, not education. At the same time, we are losing the increasingly important race to educate our citizens.
Model Summary: The U.S. leads the world in incarceration, not education, authors say.

Actual Summary: Almost 2 feet of ash fell in some areas. Authorities evacuate 4,400 people. The last time Calbuco erupted was 1972.
Model Summary: Eruption is "stronger than the first one," Chile's Geology and Mining Service says. More than 4,400 people have been evacuated from southern Chile.

Actual Summary: White House weighing whether Obama should meet with Raul Castro. A serious congressional ripple effect from the Menendez indictment? It's decision time for GOP operatives as the 2016ers get ready to launch.
Model Summary: Hillary Clinton will soon make her presidential campaign official. The White House is weighing whether to meet with Cuban leader Raul Castro. The Robert Menendez indictment could have a ripple effect on the GOP field.

Actual Summary: Jake Tapper will add the Sunday show "State of the Union" to his portfolio at CNN. Tapper also anchors "The Lead" on weekdays.
Model Summary: Jake Tapper will take over CNN's "State of the Union" in June. He'll remain the channel's chief Washington correspondent and anchor of "The Lead"

Actual Summary: Gov. Mike Pence extends public health emergency by 30 days. 129 cases of HIV have been confirmed since mid-December. More than 4,300 needles have been distributed through temporary needle exchange program.
Model Summary: Indiana Gov. Mike Pence extends a public health emergency in response to an HIV outbreak. There have been 135 confirmed cases of HIV in Scott County since mid-December. The outbreak has been linked to injection drug use.

Actual Summary: Ahmed Farouq was a leader in al Qaeda's India branch. He was killed in a U.S. counterterrorism airstrike in January. Like Adam Gadahn, Farouq was American and part of al Qaeda.
Model Summary: Ahmed Farouq was deputy emir of al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent. He died in a U.S. counterterrorism airstrike in January.

Actual Summary: Hoesik is the Korean tradition of eating and drinking together. Anthony Bourdain travels to Korea for the season five premiere of "Parts Unknown"
Model Summary: Most companies in South Korea have hoesik -- official drinking fests -- every month or so. Drinking is considered a way to get to know people, especially if you're new to the country. Drinking etiquette can be tricky, but here are seven rules to follow.

Actual Summary: Sissa Abu Dahou recently was honored as one of Egypt's ideal mothers. But for 43 years she has dressed as a man so she could work in the conservative country. "People talked but I said I decided to be a man so I can take care of my small daughter," says Dahou.
Model Summary: Sissa Abu Dahou has dressed as a man for 43 years to avoid oppression and eek out a living in Egypt's conservative Muslim state.

Actual Summary: The ramp agent fell asleep in the plane's cargo hold. He can no longer work on Alaska Airlines flights.
Model Summary: 911 call: "I feel like it's up moving in the air. Can you please tell somebody (to) stop it?" The caller was a ramp agent who fell asleep in the plane's cargo hold. The ramp agent has been permanently banned from working on Alaska Airlines planes.

Actual Summary: Classic comic book "The Dark Knight Returns" is getting a second sequel. Legendary comics writer Frank Miller is returning to the story that made him famous.
Model Summary: "The Dark Knight Returns" writer Frank Miller is returning to his best-known story. The Dark Knight III: The Master Race will be released in the fall. Miller will be joined by artist Brian Azzarello.

Actual Summary: Martha Pease: Hillary Clinton got her presidential bid launched by reframing who she is, what she's about. She says Clinton took a low-key, unconventional approach, unlike Marco Rubio's standard announcement.
Model Summary: Julian Zelizer: Hillary Clinton surprised the world with unconventional way she launched her campaign. He says her video, new logo and road trip are part of a strategy to "rebrand" herself.

Actual Summary: The international community is calling for the release of the five women. Chinese authorities detained them last month over their campaign for gender equality.
Model Summary: U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry calls on China to release five young feminists. Authorities detained the women in three cities ahead of events planned for International Women's Day. They were initially held on suspicion of "picking quarrels and provoking trouble"

Actual Summary: After calling off its air campaign, Saudi Arabia resumes airstrikes in Yemen. No casualties are reported, but 3 Houthi military compounds were destroyed. Saudi airstrikes resumed after rebel forces attacked a Yemeni military brigade.
Model Summary: Airstrikes target Houthi militant positions in three parts of Sanaa, officials say. Saudi Arabia announced the end of its nearly month-long air campaign Tuesday.

Actual Summary: Jared Leto unveiled as the Joker for the first time on Twitter. Leto stars in 2016's "Suicide Squad"
Model Summary: Jared Leto will play the Joker in 2016's "Suicide Squad" He's the first actor to play the character on the big screen since Heath Ledger.

Actual Summary: Bill Richardson: U.S announced plan to cut greenhouse gas emissions by 26% to 28% below 2005 levels by 2025. He says China, India, major corporations, cities among those already setting goals for cutting emissions. U.S. must lead in this effort.
Model Summary: The U.S. is proposing to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 26% to 28% below 2005 levels by 2025.

Actual Summary: Sen. Elizabeth Warren has publicly criticized so-called "fast track" trade authority. Sally Kohn: Why does President Obama call her wrong, and why is Hillary Clinton equivocating?
Model Summary: President Obama and Sen. Elizabeth Warren are at odds on trade policy. Julian Zelizer says Hillary Clinton is treading a fine line between populism and pragmatism.

Actual Summary: A Japanese court has rejected a petition by residents to delay the reactivation of reactors in the country's southwest. The reopening of two other nuclear reactors in Fukui was recently blocked by a Japanese court over safety fears. Japan's 48 nuclear reactors have been offline in the wake of the 2011 Fukushima disaster.
Model Summary: Kagoshima District Court finds no "irrationalities" in new safety standards. The ruling could provide a fillip to the government's plans to bring Japanese nuclear reactors back into operation. Japan's 48 nuclear reactors are offline in the wake of the Fukushima disaster in 2011.

Actual Summary: Robert Blecker: In sentencing phase, the prosecution lays out wealth of evidence that Dzhokhar Tsarnaev deserves penalty reserved for the worst of the worst. He predicts most of the jury will vote for a death sentence, but it must be unanimous; therefore, Tsarnaev will most likely get life in prison.
Model Summary: Douglas Rushkoff: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev's crimes are heinous, cruel and depraved. He says Tsarnaev's lack of remorse shows that he lacks empathy for victims. He predicts a jury will find Tsarnaev guilty of murder and sentence him to death.

Actual Summary: Georgia State Patrol provides more details of crash. Georgia Southern University mourns five nursing students killed in auto accident. Five cars and two tractor-trailers were involved in crash on Interstate 16.
Model Summary: Five Georgia Southern nursing students were killed in a crash near Savannah. They were on their way to finish their first set of clinical rotations.

Actual Summary: 5 suspects arrested in attack on Kenyan campus, official says. Student tells CNN of smearing herself with blood to escape death. Al-Shabaab gunmen opened fire, and 147 people died.
Model Summary: Kenyan police arrest five suspects in connection with Thursday's attack at Garissa University College. 147 people were killed, including 142 students, three security officers and two university security personnel.

Actual Summary: America has the highest incarceration rate in the world, holding 25% of the world's prisoners. Evan Feinberg: We must change the dismal status quo with specific solutions.
Model Summary: America has the highest incarceration rate in the world, with 25% of its prisoners.

Actual Summary: "We're all equal, and we all deserve the same fair trial," says one juror. The months-long murder trial of Aaron Hernandez brought jurors together. Foreperson: "It's been an incredibly emotional toll on all of us"
Model Summary: "It's been an incredibly emotional toll on all of us," jury foreperson Lesa Strachan says. Former NFL star Aaron Hernandez was convicted of first-degree murder in the death of Odin Lloyd.

Actual Summary: 18 dead and 5 being treated, Nigeria says. Locally brewed alcohol is suspected. Some patients have died within hours.
Model Summary: The cases have all occurred in Nigeria's Ondo state since April 13.

Actual Summary: U.S. hostage Warren Weinstein is believed to have been accidentally killed in counter-terrorism strike. Peter Bergen: U.S. should rethink hostage policy to increase chances of freeing those held.
Model Summary: Warren Weinstein appears to have been the only American citizen held hostage by al Qaeda. He was killed in a U.S. drone strike in January.

Actual Summary: Three passengers report a loss of consciousness on SkyWest flight. But officials say there is no evidence of a pressurization problem.
Model Summary: SkyWest Airlines flight made emergency landing in Buffalo, New York, on Wednesday. Pilot told passengers to prepare for an emergency landing, passenger Larry Johnson says. FAA initially reported a pressurization problem, later said it would investigate.

Actual Summary: Molly Schuyler scarfed down three 72-ounce steaks Sunday in Amarillo, Texas. The Sacramento woman, 35, is a professional on the competitive-eating circuit.
Model Summary: Molly Schuyler ate three 72-ounce steaks, three baked potatoes, three side salads, three rolls and three shrimp cocktails. She did it all in 20 minutes, setting a record in the process.

Actual Summary: The FDA may take a more hands-on approach to regulating homeopathic medicine. It does not go through the same approval process as over-the-counter drugs. Some studies suggest homeopathic medicine is no more effective than placebos.
Model Summary: A third of Americans use some form of alternative medicine, including homeopathic remedies. Homeopathic medicine is a $2.9 billion business, according to the FDA. The FDA is holding a two-day hearing on homeopathic medicine.

Actual Summary: Profile in Courage award is going to a Republican congressman who risked his career while recognizing the danger of climate change. Authors: Addressing climate challenge is today's moon shot, an enormous effort that will pay big benefits.
Model Summary: Sen. Cory Booker and Rep. Patrick McHenry share belief that U.S. must lead on climate change. Booker, McHenry: Kennedy's example of courage in space exploration holds lessons for us today.

Actual Summary: Slovenian archaeologist Ivan Šprajc discovers ancient Mayan cities in the jungles of Mexico. His discoveries could help explain why so many Mayan cities were abandoned before the arrival of the Spaniards.
Model Summary: Slovenian archaeologist Ivan Šprajc has discovered more than 80 ancient Mayan cities in the jungles of Mexico. He has found the lost city of Lagunita, which was built circa 700 AD and mysteriously abandoned four centuries later. He says the region in which he has found such riches had gone unexplored because it's so hard to get there.

Actual Summary: April 25, 2015 marks the centenary of the start of the Gallipoli Campaign in Turkey during WWI. Anzac troops stormed the beaches at Gallipoli, beginning a bloody eight-month campaign.
Model Summary: The centenary of the Gallipoli campaign is being marked with a heavy dose of military commemoration. Peter Greste says it's wrong to make war remembrance a zero sum game. He says Australia's participation in the war was contested from the outset.

Actual Summary: Mackey predicted what would happen to Iraq if the U.S. invaded and deposed Saddam Hussein. She also wrote a book credited with helping bridge gap between Arabs and Americans.
Model Summary: Sandra Mackey's book on Iraq became required reading for many military leaders. She was an undercover reporter working for U.S. newspapers from Saudi Arabia. Her 2002 book "The Reckoning -- Iraq and the Legacy of Saddam Hussein" portended some of the outcomes of the war in Iraq.

Actual Summary: Officials say the investigation originated from intercepted chatter. Possible threat focused on parts of California, one says.
Model Summary: The FBI is investigating a possible ISIS-inspired terrorist threat in the United States, officials say. No arrests have been made, and it's not clear whether the threat is real or aspirational. The investigation focused on parts of California where officials stepped up security, one official says.

Actual Summary: Israeli law says the Prime Minister must form his government in less than 42 days. Netanyahu cites government stability and reaching "agreement on important issues" as reasons he needs additional time.
Model Summary: Benjamin Netanyahu must form a government in less than 42 days, according to Israeli law. Netanyahu made the request at President Reuven Rivlin's Jerusalem home Monday.

Actual Summary: She hosted a controversial discussion on the disappearance of people. She knew what she was doing was dangerous and had received death threats before. Mahmud loved books, Jimi Hendrix and discussions about human rights.
Model Summary: Sabeen Mahmud was gunned down at her cafe in Karachi. She was leading a discussion on a topic that many in Pakistan want silenced.

Actual Summary: A Russian presidential aide says Kim will be in Moscow for May 9 Victory Day celebrations, news agency reports. This Victory Day marks the 70 years since the Soviet victory over Germany in World War II.
Model Summary: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un will visit Moscow next month for Victory Day celebrations. It would be Kim's first official foreign trip since taking over the leadership of North Korea. Kim will meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin as part of the May visit, Tass reports.

Actual Summary: Fethiye Cetin learned of her Armenian heritage from her grandmother. The grandmother survived the 1915 killings, assimilated, then kept her real identity hidden. Cetin, others want Turkey to recognize the killings as a genocide; the government has refused. In the last decade a more public dialogue on the subject has begun in Turkey.
Model Summary: Fethiye Cetin is a prominent Turkish-Armenian-Turkish lawyer. She was forced to hide her Armenian heritage after her grandmother revealed her true heritage. She says the 1915 deportations and massacres of Armenians were not taught in Turkey's schools. The Republic of Turkey has always rejected the term "genocide"

Actual Summary: NGO where Lo Porto works describes him as a lively, positive man with lots of friends. London university says he was a "popular student... committed to helping others" He was killed in a U.S. counterterrorism strike in January, authorities say.
Model Summary: Giovanni Lo Porto was killed in a U.S. drone strike two years ago. He was heading to Pakistan to work on a clean water and sanitation project.

Actual Summary: Roxanne Jones: Jury right to find Hernandez guilty, but the waste of life for player and his victim is tragic. She says NFL, Patriots knew his troubled past, but could not have predicted his actions, and both handled case well.
Model Summary: Aaron Hernandez was convicted of murder and sentenced to life in prison. Ruben Navarrette: He didn't look ashamed or remorseful in court. He says NFL and Patriots did right thing by letting him go.

Actual Summary: Oskar Gröning is on trial over his alleged role in deaths at Auschwitz. Lawrence Douglas: Other mass atrocities still await moment of moral reckoning.
Model Summary: Oskar Gröning, 93, was convicted of complicity in the murder of 300,000 Jews during his service at Auschwitz.

Actual Summary: Wealthy Africans are investing in some of London's most upscale real estate. Some Nigerians are spending as much as $37 million on houses. Property experts say African investment in London is set to grow.
Model Summary: Nigerians have spent over $900 million on luxury residential property in London over the past three years. They mainly come from six countries: Nigeria, Ghana, Congo, Gabon, Cameroon and Senegal. Nigerians typically spend between $22 and $37 million on securing a property in the British capital. Many of the African buyers see these houses as a way of maintaining cultural ties with London.

Actual Summary: Earthquake scientists have been expecting major event in Nepal since 1934. Population density, weak building infrastructure amplified damage, USGS spokesman says. "This event, while large and tragic, is not unusual" in region, geological engineer says.
Model Summary: Earthquakes are a fact of life in Nepal, with tremors of magnitude 4 or 5 occurring several times each year. The last major earthquake to affect this part of the Himalayas was in the 1500s.

Actual Summary: This page includes the show Transcript. Use the Transcript to help students with reading comprehension and vocabulary. At the bottom of the page, comment for a chance to be mentioned on CNN Student News. You must be a teacher or a student age 13 or older to request a mention on the CNN Student News Roll Call.
Model Summary: This page includes the show Transcript. Use the Transcript to help students with reading comprehension and vocabulary. At the bottom of the page, comment for a chance to be mentioned on CNN Student News. You must be a teacher or a student age 13 or older to request a mention on the NPR Student News Roll Call.

Actual Summary: About a year after al Qaeda took Warren Weinstein hostage, his family paid a ransom, a Pakistani source says. The captors demanded that other prisoners be released, the source says. Weinstein, an American aid worker, was killed in a drone strike in January, the U.S. says.
Model Summary: Warren Weinstein's family paid money to his captors, a Pakistani source says. The money did not lead to the American aid worker's release, and he was killed in a U.S. drone strike in January.

Actual Summary: "Grey's Anatomy" is in its 11th season. Derek Shepherd, played by Patrick Dempsey, died after a car crash.
Model Summary: Patrick Dempsey's character dies on "Grey's Anatomy" He still has a year left on his contract. Ellen Pompeo is also signed through season 12.

Actual Summary: Massacre of 1.5 million ethnic Armenians under the Ottoman Empire is widely acknowledged by scholars as a genocide. Turkish government officially denies it saying hundreds of thousands of Turkish Muslims and Armenian Christians died in intercommunal violence.
Model Summary: 1.5 million ethnic Armenians were systematically killed in the final years of the Ottoman Empire. Turkey denies that a genocide took place, maintaining that hundreds of thousands of Turkish Muslims and Armenian Christians died in intercommunal violence.

Actual Summary: Rare set of female quintuplets was born this month in Houston, Texas. The girls were born via C-section at 28 weeks and two days. Another family kept the news of twins secret until birth.
Model Summary: The first set of female quintuplets in the world since 1969 was born in Houston on April 8. Parents Danielle and Adam Busby are blogging about their unique experience.

Actual Summary: Social media largely supports Jenner. More people seemed intrigued that he's a Republican.
Model Summary: Bruce Jenner came out as transgender on Friday night. His daughter Kendall Jenner tweeted: "I'm so proud of you, Dad. You are so brave" There were mixed reactions to the news on social media. Some poked fun at him for being a Republican.

Actual Summary: Dawn MacKeen: 2015 marks 100th anniversary of slaughter of Armenians by Ottoman Empire. Kim Kardashian has used fame to spotlight this. She says Armenian community has long sought global recognition of the atrocity, but it took a Kardashian to catapult it into the news.
Model Summary: More than one million Armenians were killed during the last days of the Ottoman Empire in 1915.

Actual Summary: Companies including Philip Morris and R.J. Reynolds in suit alleging violation of free speech. In March, the FDA issued guidance about changes to tobacco product labels. If significant changes are made to a product's label, like color or a logo, the product requires new approval.
Model Summary: Tobacco companies including Philip Morris and R.J. Reynolds sue the FDA. The companies say the FDA is violating their free speech rights.

Actual Summary: 92 percent of Americans say it is important to get an annual head-to-toe physical exam. Randomized trials going back to the 1980s just don't support that belief.
Model Summary: More than 44 million Americans go to the doctor for an annual physical exam. There's little evidence that annual physicals do any good for healthy adults. A Kaiser Family Foundation poll found 92 percent of Americans say it is important to get an annual exam.

Actual Summary: Two neuroscientists have conducted brain imaging to examine moments of clarity. Sudden "insights" are otherwise known as "Eureka" or "Aha" moments. We can increase our chance of these insights with a variety of daily changes.
Model Summary: Authors John Kounios and Mark Beeman have written a book on how the brain works. Their book, "The Eureka Factor", explains how to get creative inspiration at the most unexpected time. They say it's important to clear out mental junk to make way for pivotal revelations. Sleep deprivation and lack of sleep can inhibit your creative thinking, they say.

Actual Summary: The 14-year-old had communicated with terror suspects in Australia, authorities said. Police: The teenager encouraged others to attack a parade and behead someone in Australia.
Model Summary: A 14-year-old boy was taken into custody after encouraging an attack on an Australian parade honoring the war dead. He was charged with two counts of inciting another person to commit an act of terrorism overseas.

Actual Summary: How does ISIS govern? Robert Downey Jr. isn't the only celebrity to walk out of an interview.
Model Summary: CNN's Atika Shubert looks at the role of ISIS in some communities. Michelle Obama is 51 years old, but she doesn't look it in the eyes of one youngster. CNN's Richard Roth looks at a sweet tradition that's leaving some with a bitter taste.

Actual Summary: The critically acclaimed "Daredevil" will be back for season 2. Charlie Cox plays a blind attorney by day who is a superhero by night.
Model Summary: Marvel's "Daredevil" will return for a second season in 2016. The first season premiered on Netflix earlier this year.

Actual Summary: April 23 marks 10 years since first video, "Me at the zoo," was uploaded to YouTube. Site gets billions of views every day; 300 hours of uploads every minute. New studios being opened for budget filmmakers to improve quality of output.
Model Summary: In 2015, YouTube is investing in "YouTube Spaces," where "creators" have access to professional studios, training, and many resources. The Tokyo space is one of five worldwide available for free to YouTube partners.

Actual Summary: From belfies to butt implants, the Kardashian clan has inspired many a trend. The latest: Kylie Jenner's pouty lips spark the #KylieJennerChallenge.
Model Summary: Kylie Jenner inspired the lip-plumping trend, which involves sucking on a shot glass. The "butt selfie" is another Kardashian-inspired trend.

Actual Summary: Fox plans to make a TV movie of "The Rocky Horror Picture Show" Some of the producers behind the original film are involved. TV is in the midst of a musical craze.
Model Summary: Fox is developing a two-hour remake of the 1975 cult classic. The project is tentatively titled "The Rocky Horror Picture Show Event" The special is timed to celebrate the 40th anniversary of the film.

Actual Summary: Alice Barker was a dancer in the 1930s and '40s. Thanks to filmmakers, Barker -- now 102 -- finally saw herself dance.
Model Summary: Alice Barker was a dancer in New York nightspots in the 1930s and 1940s. She was part of chorus lines that entertained Bill "Bojangles" Robinson and Frank Sinatra.

Actual Summary: Freddie Gray's death has fueled protests in Baltimore. Demonstrators accuse police of using too much force and say officers should face charges.
Model Summary: Protesters want answers about what happened to Freddie Gray, who died in police custody. Police say they chased Gray for "running while black," but his family says they didn't have probable cause to pursue him. Police union says it's 100% behind the officers and compares protesters to a lynch mob.

Actual Summary: Chris Evans and Jeremy Renner get in hot water after a joke made about "Avengers" character Black Widow. Renner called Scarlett Johansson's character a "slut" and Evans referred to her as a "whore" The actors issued an apology on Thursday.
Model Summary: "Avengers: Age of Ultron" co-stars Chris Evans and Jeremy Renner apologize. They were asked about the character Black Widow's flirtations with other superheroes.

Actual Summary: Common joins "Suicide Squad" cast, which already includes Will Smith, Jared Leto. Film is about supervillains who team up.
Model Summary: Oscar-winning rapper-turned-actor Common has joined the cast of "Suicide Squad" David Ayer is directing the all-star action movie featuring DC Entertainment super-villains.

Actual Summary: A magnitude-7.8 earthquake struck near Kathmandu, Nepal. Carolyn Miles: Many survivors will have nowhere to go.
Model Summary: Nepal has made remarkable progress in maternal and child health in recent years, says Sally Kohn. Kohn: Nepal is one of her favorite countries to visit, and she was deeply saddened by the news of the earthquake.

Actual Summary: 15 buffalo are shot on Friday after escaping the day before from a farm in Schodack, New York. Police helicopters fly overhead and nearby schools put on alert in the final moments of the chase. The herd breaks through three layers of barbed wire fencing and crosses the Hudson River during the escape.
Model Summary: Twenty-two buffalo escaped from a farm in upstate New York on Thursday. Police chased the herd through forests and over the Hudson River. Fifteen buffalo were killed by "snipers" from the animals' farm.

Actual Summary: Florida A&M drum major Robert Champion died in 2011 after a hazing ritual aboard a bus. A jury convicted the last three defendants of manslaughter and hazing with the result of death.
Model Summary: Robert Champion died in November 2011 after a band hazing ritual. He was beaten aboard a school bus after a football game.

Actual Summary: David Chase walks through the ending of "The Sopranos" The use of particular shots and "Don't Stop Believin' " build tension. Chase still doesn't reveal Tony Soprano's fate.
Model Summary: Show creator David Chase explains the reasoning behind the final scene of "Sopranos" Chase says the scene is a master class in how to build tension in a seemingly nondescript situation. Chase didn't reveal whether Tony Soprano was killed or survived.

Actual Summary: Documents show that officers thought Robert Bates got special treatment. The reserve deputy has pleaded not guilty to charge of second-degree manslaughter. Bates says meant to use his Taser but shot Eric Harris by mistake.
Model Summary: Robert Bates is charged with second-degree manslaughter in the shooting of Eric Harris. A 2009 internal investigation found that Bates was shown special treatment and training policies were violated. Bates' attorney says the report is based on misunderstandings and misstatements.

Actual Summary: Geoffrey Lewis appeared in many movies, TV shows. Actor was frequently collaborator with Clint Eastwood. Actress Juliette Lewis, his daughter, called him "my hero"
Model Summary: Lewis played Orville Boggs in "Every Which Way But Loose" and its sequel. He also appeared with Clint Eastwood in "High Plains Drifter" and "Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil" He was the father of Oscar-nominated actress Juliette Lewis.

Actual Summary: Veteran Time magazine film critic Richard Corliss died Thursday night in New York City. Corliss reviewed more than 1,000 movies and authored four books on film.
Model Summary: Richard Corliss was Time magazine's film critic for 35 years. He was perhaps the magazine's most quoted writer of all time, colleague Richard Zoglin says. His all-time top 100 movies list included everything from "Finding Nemo" to "Drunken Master II"

Actual Summary: Pilot stopped during security checks as the flight prepared to depart on Saturday night. Cathay Pacific runs regular flights between its Hong Kong hub and London. The male pilot has been bailed pending an investigation.
Model Summary: Pilot arrested after trying to board flight from London to Hong Kong with knives in his luggage. He was stopped during security checks as the flight prepared to depart on Saturday night. Passengers were forced to wait in the seats on board the Boeing 777 for more than two hours.

Actual Summary: Anthony Doerr's "All the Light We Cannot See" wins Pulitzer for fiction. Elizabeth Kolbert's "The Sixth Extinction" wins general nonfiction prize.
Model Summary: Anthony Doerr's "All the Light We Cannot See" wins the Pulitzer Prize for fiction. Stephen Adly Guirgis' play "Between Riverside and Crazy" wins for drama. Elizabeth Kolbert's "The Sixth Extinction: An Unnatural History" won the Pulitzer for general nonfiction.

Actual Summary: Americans on the no-fly list will now get info about why they've been banned from flights. ACLU says the policy still denies "meaningful notice, evidence, and a hearing"
Model Summary: People on the U.S. no-fly list will now be given the opportunity to dispute their status, court documents say. The new policy comes in response to a June ruling by a federal judge. The decision was part of an American Civil Liberties Union lawsuit.

Actual Summary: Anthony Bourdain teaches Anderson Cooper a Korean recipe. Budae-jiigae is a stew made with all sorts of canned meat, including Spam.
Model Summary: Buddae-jjigae -- or "army stew" -- dates back to the scarce years of the Korean War. "Parts Unknown" host Anthony Bourdain cooked up a Korean version of the dish.

Actual Summary: This is week three of an ongoing series: A Catholic Reads the Bible. Read week one and week two. This week's reading is a Lot to take in. Literally.
Model Summary: The story of Sodom and Gomorrah is the inspiration for the word "sodomy"

Actual Summary: A new TSA report advises against full screening of airport workers. The report says such measures would not lower the overall risk to the public.
Model Summary: TSA report: Full employee screening would not "appreciably increase the overall system-wide protection" Only two major airports in the U.S. require employees to be screened through metal detectors. TSA Secretary Jeh Johnson announced immediate actions as a result of the report.

Actual Summary: The overturned car was smoldering on a New Jersey roadway when police arrived. It burst into flames shortly after they pulled out the unconscious driver.
Model Summary: Dawn Milosky, 45, of Beachwood, New Jersey, was airlifted to a hospital and survived. She was charged with driving while intoxicated, reckless driving and other offenses. A police dash cam captured the dramatic rescue.

Actual Summary: Vijay Chokal-Ingam says he pretended to be black to get into medical school. He says the experience showed him that affirmative action is a flawed system.
Model Summary: Vijay Chokal-Ingam is pitching a book about his experiences as a "hard-partying college frat boy" He says he posed as a black man to get into medical school and that the experience opened his eyes to what he calls the hypocrisy of affirmative action.

Actual Summary: Mary Magdalene is one of the Bible's most complicated characters. Mark Goodacre, who appears in the series, answers your questions about her.
Model Summary: Viewers were invited to tweet and post their questions on the "Finding Jesus" Facebook page about Mary Magdalene.

Actual Summary: What do funeral strippers, a quadruple rainbow and Kylie Jenner have in common? They all trended this week!
Model Summary: Four rainbows appeared in the early morning sky in New York. In China, exotic dancers are being used to cheer up mourners.

Actual Summary: A mom of two got upset when "Big Hero 6" fabric didn't include the two female characters. Another mom called attention to gender stereotypes on a TOMS Web page. In both cases, the companies responded quickly to answer parents' concerns.
Model Summary: Melissa Atkins Wardy is a passionate advocate for fighting gender stereotypes. Wardy shared a story about a company that didn't include female characters in a "Big Hero 6" fabric. The company responded quickly, saying it would talk with Disney about new designs.

Actual Summary: Obama promised Armenian-Americans he would call the atrocity genocide during the 2008 campaign. The White House views Turkey as a more crucial ally than Armenia. Pope Francis, actor George Clooney, and even the Kardashians have taken the moral position, calling it the Armenian genocide.
Model Summary: This week is the 100th anniversary of what many historians acknowledge as the Armenian genocide. On the 2008 campaign trail, Obama promised to use the word "genocide" to describe the 1915 massacre by Turks of Armenians.

Actual Summary: Massive 7.8 magnitude earthquake has struck Nepal near its capital, Kathmandu. As the death toll rises, witnesses describe devastation and panic.
Model Summary: Nepal's capital, Kathmandu, was rocked by a 7.8 magnitude earthquake on Saturday. Witnesses describe people sheltering in tents, waiting for aftershocks. One man says his family is "traumatized" by the quake.

Actual Summary: Ohio Gov. John Kasich: Washington is gridlocked, but states can make a difference. He says Ohio has gone from a budget deficit to surplus, from losing jobs to creating them.
Model Summary: Ohio Gov. John Kasich has turned around the fortunes of his state in less than a decade. He says America needs leaders who don't let ego, selfishness and power distract them.

Actual Summary: The two moms from "Big Bang Theory" guest star this week. "Backstrom," "Blue Bloods" are among the week's season finales. Comedy "Younger" is gaining big buzz.
Model Summary: Christine Baranski and Laurie Metcalf are back on "The Big Bang Theory" "Saturday Night Live" is back this weekend.

Actual Summary: Joel Burger and Ashley King have been engaged since October. Their engagement photo with a Burger King sign attracted, and the company offered to pay for their wedding.
Model Summary: Joel Burger and Ashley King met in kindergarten and grew up together in New Berlin, Illinois. Burger King got wind of their story and offered to pay for their wedding.

Actual Summary: Experts have raised red flags about the warming of planet by 2 degrees Celsius. John Sutter: This one little number is significant as a way to focus world's attention on problem.
Model Summary: John Sutter will be reporting on climate change for the rest of the year. He wants you to help him decide which of these stories he'll report on best. Sutter: The 2-degree threshold is the "north star" of climate negotiations.

Actual Summary: Police say they can't confirm whether Jones was involved in the crash, which injured a pregnant woman. Jones is the reigning UFC light heavyweight champion.
Model Summary: Jon "Bones" Jones is the reigning UFC light heavyweight champion. He is wanted for "his possible involvement in a hit-and-run accident," police say.

Actual Summary: The two males arrested are 21 and 15 years old, St. Louis police say in a tweet. A video that went viral showed three black males attacking a white man.
Model Summary: The beating may have been sparked by a question about the Michael Brown shooting. There had been speculation that the suspects might be charged with a hate crime.

Actual Summary: Australian and Philippines governments given notice their nationals will be executed in 72 hours. They include Philippines maid Mary Jane Velos and Australians Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran. Australia has repeatedly appealed for clemency for the pair.
Model Summary: Nine of ten mostly foreign prisoners on death row in Indonesia have been given 72 hours notice ahead of their execution. French national Serge Atlaoui had filed a challenge to the State Administrative Court on Thursday so his sentence has been delayed. The ten include two Australian citizens Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran -- members of the so-called "Bali Nine" smuggling ring.

Actual Summary: Coast Guard says about 50 people were rescued from Mobile Bay. More than 100 sailboats took part in the Dauphin Island Race, an annual event.
Model Summary: Severe weather struck a sailing regatta in Mobile Bay, Alabama, Saturday afternoon. More than 100 sailboats took part in the Dauphin Island Race. As many as 50 people were rescued from the water, the Coast Guard said.

Actual Summary: Willis never trademarked her most-famous work, calling it "my gift to the city" She created some of the city's most famous neon work.
Model Summary: Betty Whitehead Willis designed the "Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas" sign. She also designed the signs for the Moulin Rouge Hotel and Blue Angel Motel.

Actual Summary: Dr. Kristen Lindsey has since removed the post of her holding the dead cat by an arrow. Her employer fired her; the sheriff's office is investigating. Activist offers $7,500 reward.
Model Summary: Dr. Kristen Lindsey allegedly shot an arrow into the back of an orange tabby's head. She posted a proud photo of herself smiling, as she dangled its limp body by the arrow's shaft.
