Model Summary: Tickets will go on sale for the May 2 fight between Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao. A deal has been reached on allocation of tickets for the highly-anticipated Las Vegas event. Kenny Bayless has been named as the referee of the welterweight world title fight.

Actual Summary: Funeral strippers in rural China are the latest focus of the country's crackdown on vice. In some areas of China, the hiring of professional mourners is commonplace, but some performances are getting racy. Government report says that stripteases undermine "the cultural value of the entertainment business"
Model Summary: Hiring exotic dancers to perform at wakes is an increasingly common practice in rural China. China's Ministry of Culture has announced a crackdown on the practice.

Actual Summary: Most Americans say businesses should not discriminate against same-sex weddings. Public opinion has shifted on the issue since last fall. Indiana passed and later changed its religious freedom law after public outcry.
Model Summary: A new CNN/ORC poll finds 57% feel businesses should be required to serve gay or lesbian couples just as they would heterosexual couples. That's a shift from a Pew Research Center poll conducted last fall, which found just 49% thought businesses ought to.

Actual Summary: The Italian coast guard says 8,480 migrants were rescued from Friday to Monday. Save the Children said Tuesday 400 migrants could be missing from a boat. The Italian coast guard cannot confirm that report.
Model Summary: Italian coast guard says 8,480 migrants were rescued from 20 boats in distress from Friday to Monday. Save the Children fears 400 migrants could be missing, citing testimony from survivors. Coast guard says it cannot confirm such an incident and has not yet found evidence at sea to indicate a migrant boat carrying 550 has capsized.

Actual Summary: Trial for Aurora theater shooting suspect begins Monday. Survivors say the shooting changed their lives, but doesn't define it.
Model Summary: James Holmes goes on trial for 165 counts, including murder and attempted murder, on Monday. Twelve people were killed and 70 were injured in the July 20, 2012, shooting at a movie theater in Aurora, Colorado.

Actual Summary: For 25 years, Ali Addeh refugee camp has been a holding point for those fleeing into Djibouti. Many come from Somalia, Ethiopia and especially Eritrea -- which is ruled by a one-party state. Despite the risks, Eritrean refugees say they'd risk their lives with people smugglers.
Model Summary: Ali Addeh refugee camp has been a holding point for those fleeing into Djibouti for 25 years. The camp's 10,000 residents, who mostly come from Eritrea, Ethiopia and Somalia, are waiting to be resettled. Henol and Mebratu are among the 20 friends who drowned off the shores of Italy this week.

Actual Summary: The mom saw her son on TV throwing rocks at police, CNN affiliate reports. Police praise her actions.
Model Summary: Video shows woman smacking her son in the head as he walks away from crowd. Police commissioner praises mom for taking charge of her son.

Actual Summary: The earthquake that struck Nepal has left thousands of Nepalis without shelter. Torrential rains making situation worse; food and drinking water supplies could become a serious issue soon. It's unclear how bad conditions are closer to the epicenter.
Model Summary: Nepal's capital, Kathmandu, has been hit hard by the earthquake. CNN's Mark Morgenstein says people are huddled in tents in the streets. He says there's little food and water in the city, and people are desperate for shelter.

Actual Summary: Rapper Lil Wayne not injured after shots fired at his tour bus on an Atlanta interstate, police say. No one has been arrested in the shooting.
Model Summary: No one was injured in the shooting. Lil Wayne was in Atlanta for a performance at Compound nightclub Saturday night.

Actual Summary: Defense expected to show Dzhokhar Tsarnaev as a puppet of his dominant older brother. A deadlocked jury would result in an automatic life sentence for Tsarnaev.
Model Summary: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev faces the death penalty for the Boston Marathon bombings. His defense attorney says he will get years of punishment and no martyrdom if he is sentenced to death.

Actual Summary: Tremors subside finally in Kathmandu, but after-effects of Saturday's staggering tragedy will be felt for years. Arwa Damon and Gul Tuysuz take tour of devastated city as locals struggle to cope. Workers dig painstakingly, slowly removing piles of stone and debris.
Model Summary: Kathmandu was hit by the worst earthquake in 80 years. The death toll has passed 3,000 and is expected to rise.

Actual Summary: Gray's family asked there be no protests; they condemned violence. Community leaders and brave residents got in between rioters and police.
Model Summary: Freddie Gray's family asked there be no protests, let alone violence, on the day he was laid to rest. A handful of people stood in the way of rioters, but they were a finger in a dam.

Actual Summary: Warren Weinstein's wife says the family is still searching for answers. Officials say Weinstein and another al Qaeda hostage were accidentally killed in a U.S. drone strike. Gunmen abducted the USAID contractor from his home in Pakistan in 2011.
Model Summary: Warren Weinstein, 73, was killed in a U.S. drone strike in Pakistan, officials say. His wife says she is still searching for answers. Obama praises Weinstein's lifelong dedication to service.

Actual Summary: A Texas A&M Galveston professor said in an email to students he would fail the entire class. University officials won't necessarily stand by failing grades, CNN affiliate KPRC reports.
Model Summary: Irwin Horwitz is an instructional associate professor at Texas A&M Galveston. In an email to his strategic management students, he says he will fail the entire class.

Actual Summary: Gloria Borger: Hillary Clinton's team is doing all it can to make her appear relatable to ordinary people. She asks if the most famous woman in the world can really connect with ordinary voters?
Model Summary: Julian Zelizer: Hillary Clinton's campaign is trying to make her seem less of a big shot.

Actual Summary: Nepali Pranksters make hidden camera videos of awkward social situations. The three-person team was filming as the Nepal earthquake began.
Model Summary: Nepali Pranksters were shooting a hidden camera episode when the earthquake struck. They kept the camera rolling, capturing scenes of heroism and chaos.

Actual Summary: India has launched a massive aid mission to its earthquake-hit neighbor Nepal. Disaster relief troops and tons of food, water and medicine have been flown in.
Model Summary: India began planning a massive cross-border aid mission within hours of the first quake. On Sunday alone, India delivered 187 tons of supplies, including 50 tons of water, 22 tons of food and 2 tons of medicine.

Actual Summary: Off-duty member of the Uniformed Division of Secret Service arrested Friday. Police said he was charged with trying to break into a woman's residence.
Model Summary: Arthur Baldwin, 29, was arrested at a woman's residence in Southeast Washington. He has been placed on administrative leave and his security clearance has been suspended, the Secret Service said. He is charged with first-degree attempted burglary and destruction of property.

Actual Summary: Calls for Lee Wan-koo to resign began after South Korean tycoon Sung Woan-jong was found hanging from a tree in Seoul. Sung, who was under investigation for fraud and bribery, left a note listing names and amounts of cash given to top officials.
Model Summary: South Korea's Prime Minister Lee Wan-koo offered to resign on Monday. He will stay in his official role until South Korean President Park Geun-hye accepts his resignation.

Actual Summary: Concerns growing for people trapped higher up the mountain. Helicopters begin airlifting injured people from the base camp in Nepal. Climber reports at least 17 dead; many others injured, missing or stuck.
Model Summary: Aftershocks continue to rock Mount Everest, complicating rescue efforts. Climber: Most of the injured have been airlifted out of base camp.

Actual Summary: Baby Sonit Awal found in rubble of Nepal earthquake, Sunday morning. Spent 22 hours buried under his home after 7.8-magnitude quake.
Model Summary: Four-month-old Sonit Awal was buried when his house collapsed. His father frantically searched for him for 22 hours before the Nepalese Army rescued him.

Actual Summary: Military has not confirmed if any rescued girls came from 2014 Chibok mass abduction. Nigerian troops raided Boko Haram camps in northeastern Nigeria, military says.
Model Summary: Nigerian troops rescue 200 girls and 93 women from Boko Haram camps in the Sambisa Forest. None of the girls have been identified thus far as among the missing Chibok girls, an army official says. The official did not rule out that captives from other camps that were raided might be girls abducted in April 2014.

Actual Summary: The sentences came after a trial in Pakistan, a judge says. Malala Yousafzai is an outspoken advocate for the education of girls. She was attacked in Pakistan in 2012.
Model Summary: Ten people have been sentenced to life in prison for their roles in the 2012 attack. Malala Yousafzai was shot as she was traveling home on a school bus.

Actual Summary: Roads out of Kathmandu are damaged but passable. Even close to the capital, aid is taking forever to trickle through. East of the city, the village of Ravi Opi counts the cost of devastation.
Model Summary: Roads out of Kathmandu show signs of damage from Saturday's earthquake. In Ravi Opi, a village 30 miles from the capital, roads are filled in with rubble and dirt. Maili Tamang, 62, was trapped in her house when the quake struck, but survived. She and her family are now living in a makeshift shelter.

Actual Summary: Despite pleas for mercy, Indonesia executed eight prisoners on Wednesday. Included two of the "Bali Nine," convicted drug traffickers from Australia. Executions will damage relations between countries, but public image will take longer to heal.
Model Summary: Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran's deaths will result in short to medium term frictions between Canberra and Jakarta. Australian public's view of Indonesia, and anger with its government, will take much longer to subside. Australia and Indonesia have a number of common interests that neither side can abandon.

Actual Summary: What to expect if Bernie Sanders takes the presidential plunge. Biden's and Kasich's "wait and see" 2016 strategies. GOP recruiting Senate candidates for 2016 in Nevada and Colorado.
Model Summary: Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont is expected to announce his candidacy within days. Ohio Gov. John Kasich is taking a wait-and-see approach to the 2016 race. The GOP establishment is putting a lot of emphasis on retaining control of the Senate.

Actual Summary: Indonesia executed eight prisoners including two Australians on Wednesday. Two of "Bali Nine" were killed despite Australia's pleas for mercy. All around the world, innocent people being killed by the state in our name, writes Mark Beeson.
Model Summary: Many Australians are appalled by the brutal and pointless executions of Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran in Indonesia. The executions raise questions about the powers we give to state officials.

Actual Summary: Prosecutors get investigative report a day early, but don't expect immediate word on charges. Attorney general: We're continuing "careful and deliberate examination of the facts" Gray family was told "answers were not going to come quickly," and that's fine, attorney says.
Model Summary: Baltimore police hand over files on Freddie Gray's death to prosecutors. No reports will be made public, police commissioner says. Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake dances around questions about whether charges will be filed.

Actual Summary: Peggy Drexler: In interview to promote movie, Robert Downey Jr. walked out after being asked personal questions. She says his behavior was rude, demeaning to the interviewer, who was just doing his job.
Model Summary: Robert Downey Jr. walked out of an interview with a British journalist who dared to veer away from the superhero movie he was promoting.

Actual Summary: German police say they think they "have thwarted an Islamist attack," interior minister for Hesse state says. German terrorism researcher: Couple accused of planning bomb attack on bicycle race near Frankfurt.
Model Summary: German police arrest a man and a woman on suspicion of planning a Boston-style attack. A terrorism researcher says the couple had ties to radical Islamist circles in the Frankfurt area.

Actual Summary: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe will address Congress on Wednesday. Paul Sracic: Abe has a lot riding on TPP trade agreement.
Model Summary: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is scheduled to speak Wednesday to a joint meeting of Congress.

Actual Summary: Gabriel Salvador set up an initial meeting between a TV exec and Manny Pacquiao's trainer. Salvador is an actor and waiter at Craig's restaurant in Los Angeles.
Model Summary: Les Moonves' waiter offered him an "in" to the Floyd Mayweather vs. Manny Pacquiao fight. Gabriel Salvador is an actor who has appeared in "Bones" and "Blue Bloods" Salvador's son trained at the gym owned by Mayweather's trainer, Freddie Roach.

Actual Summary: Kim Bok-dong is determined to share her story of sexual slavery until she's no longer physically able. Kim was held prisoner by the Japanese military in a "comfort station" for five years, raped ceaselessly. She says she won't rest until she receives a formal apology from the Japanese government.
Model Summary: Kim Bok-dong spent five years as a sex slave in Japanese military brothels. She is now blind and deaf, but says she will continue to speak out until she dies. An estimated 200,000 Japanese women were sex slaves during World War II. Critics say Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has not done enough to apologize.

Actual Summary: Death toll in Nepal climbs above 4,600, officials say, with more than 9,000 injured. Shattered villages near epicenter are hard to reach, says aid worker in the area. More bad weather is forecast for the region in the coming days.
Model Summary: Up to 200 people are feared missing after a landslide in Langtang National Park, an official says. More than 8 million people are affected by the earthquake, officials say.

Actual Summary: Indian Air Force and Nepalese Army medical team launch rescue mission to bring injured people to hospitals in Kathmandu. Forshani Tamang's family carried her for four hours to reach help after she was wounded when their home was destroyed.
Model Summary: Indian air crew and Nepalese army medical team deliver relief supplies to remote village. More than 5,000 people have been killed in Nepal's 7.8-magnitude quake. Many of the most seriously injured are being treated in Kathmandu.

Actual Summary: "I had never seen a judge conduct himself in that way," defendant's lawyer says. A judge reduces prison sentences for 3 educators in the Atlanta Public Schools cheating scandal. "I'm not comfortable with it," Judge Jerry Baxter said of the original longer sentences.
Model Summary: Judge Jerry Baxter says he's not "comfortable" with seven-year prison terms for three Atlanta educators. Baxter had earlier given the three the harshest sentences.

Actual Summary: About a dozen Native American actors walk off set of Adam Sandler comedy, says report. Actors say satirical Western's script is insulting to Native Americans and women.
Model Summary: Native American actors walk off set of Adam Sandler movie "The Ridiculous Six" They say script insults Native Americans and women, according to Indian Country Today Media Network. Sandler has not commented publicly on the walkout.

Actual Summary: Wave of deadly anti-immigrant violence has caused thousands to flee their homes in South Africa. Immigrants fear further attacks despite clamp down by authorities. "How am I going to pay the rent and feed my wife?" says one man.
Model Summary: Anti-immigrant violence has swept South Africa in recent days, leaving several dead. CNN spoke to several immigrants living and working in the country about the crisis.

Actual Summary: Beginning Friday, some ranks of the Indianapolis police department will wear white shirts. Police say the change in attire is not related to any specific incident. The new uniform shirt color is aimed at ensuring accountability.

Actual Summary: Renner showed off his vocal skills. He sang an Ed Sheeran hit.
Model Summary: Hawkeye was a guest on "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon" He showed off some of his other talents.

Actual Summary: A group of fighters in Afghanistan is filmed by a CNN cameraman parading ISIS flags. U.S. official: ISIS militants have "no military capability" at present, but are trying to recruit disillusioned Taliban in several areas. Rivalry between ISIS and the Taliban in Afghanistan is fierce enough to mean the ISIS fighters could be killed for brandishing the flag.

Model Summary: Thousands are missing in Nepal after a devastating earthquake on Saturday. Many are trekkers and adventurers who have not been heard from. Technology has played a huge role in helping families share their worries.

Model Summary: Marion "Suge" Knight pleads not guilty to murder and other charges related to a fatal hit-and-run in January. The former rap mogul's bail is set at $10 million, down from $25 million. He faces up to life in prison if convicted.

Actual Summary: Stephen Hawking is a famed cosmologist and mathematician. He sings Monty Python's "Galaxy Song" in a hilarious new video.
Model Summary: Stephen Hawking has teamed up with Monty Python to recreate "Galaxy Song" The song is from their 1983 film "The Meaning of Life" The 7-inch single is available for download.

Model Summary: Iran's elite Revolutionary Guard's Quds Force is training, advising and supporting Iraqi Shia militias in their fight against ISIS. Iranian officials say they would like better cooperation with the U.S., but point out that the level of trust simply isn't there.

Model Summary: Universal announced Thursday that the sequel to the box office blockbuster will hit theaters on Feb. 10, 2017. The third film in the series will debut Feb. 9, 2018.

Actual Summary: British monarchy's 1,000-year history has seen 34 Kings and just 6 Queens on the throne. Victoria Arbiter argues the royal family needs a baby girl to fill the female void of future generations.
Model Summary: Bets on the arrival of a baby girl continue to be placed at a feverish rate. The birth of a girl matters on a far deeper level: the monarchy needs a girl to fill the female void of future generations.

Model Summary: Linda Thompson says she would not have married Bruce Jenner if she had known about his "gender issue" when they first met. The Olympic gold medalist and "Keeping Up With The Kardashians" star has publicly declared he is transgender.

Model Summary: Sen. Bernie Sanders, a Vermont Democrat, is running for president. Julian Zelizer says Sanders is an authentic voice who speaks without fear.

Model Summary: Julian Zelizer: With Congress gridlocked, it's time for liberals to look to local initiatives. He says states have shown that they can take bold steps without fear of being outmaneuvered.

Actual Summary: Death toll rises to more than 6,100. Pemba Tamang, 15, shows no apparent signs of serious injury after rescue. U.S. special forces helicopter 30, including 3 Americans, to safety.
Model Summary: Pemba Tamang, a 15-year-old Nepalese boy, was pulled from the rubble Thursday. A U.S. special operations forces team rescued 30 people, including three Americans, by helicopter.

Actual Summary: Fabien Le Coq took photos of trees from the bottom looking up. The branches take on their own patterns in the sky: "Each tree has its own personality"
Model Summary: Fabien Le Coq's photo series "Treesome" features trees with spindly branches. The series was shot between 2012 and 2014 in France and around the world.

Model Summary: Dzhokhar "Jahar" Tsarnaev's defense team is seeking to spare him from a death sentence. He was convicted on all 30 counts, including 17 that carry a possible death penalty. His older brother, Tamerlan, was portrayed as harsh, overbearing and bent on jihad.

Actual Summary: Mui Thomas has a rare genetic condition that leaves her skin raw and open to infection. Abandoned at birth, Tina and Rog Thomas adopted Mui. She's now 22, a rugby referee and an inspirational speaker.
Model Summary: Mui Thomas was born with Harlequin ichthyosis, a rare skin condition. Her skin is extremely thick, dry and flaky -- resembling fish scales. Model Summary: Gen. Khalifa Haftar says Libyan authorities were not consulted about EU plan to stem migrant flow. He says Libya will not cooperate with any EU military action intended to stem the flow of undocumented migrants trying to reach Europe.

Model Summary: Ciudad Juarez, Mexico, was once known as the murder capital of the world. Now officials say the city is much safer, and plans are underway to lure tourists and investors back to Juarez.

Model Summary: Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe addressed the U.S. Congress on the 70th anniversary of the end of World War II.

Model Summary: Hundreds of bodies were found buried in the streets of Damasak, Nigeria. The town had recently been freed from the Boko Haram terror group.

Actual Summary: The Israeli military says the militants were trying to plant a bomb. The men crossed from Syria, Israel says.
Model Summary: Airstrikes were carried out in the occupied Golan Heights against four militants, Israel says. Three of the alleged attackers were killed, Israeli media reported.

Model Summary: The FBI is trying to track down some of the country's most wanted domestic terrorists. Among the most wanted are Timothy McVeigh, Cheri Laverne Dalton, Leo Burt and Ted Kaczynski.

Model Summary: Prosecutor Javier de Luca dismisses allegations that President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner tried to cover up Iran's involvement in a 1994 bombing. The original prosecutor who brought the allegations was found dead in January.

Model Summary: Anamarie Shreeves, 26, lives a zero-waste lifestyle. She composts, makes her own shampoo, toothpaste and even uses reusable feminine products. She has collected nearly half a year's worth of garbage in a mason jar.

Model Summary: Roxanne Jones: Miami riots of 1980 were first major "race riots" since 1960s. She says they were sparked by acquittal of police officers in beating death of motorcyclist Arthur McDuffie.

Model Summary: Heavy drinking among Americans rose 17.2 percent between 2005 and 2012. The rate of binge drinking among women increased more than seven times the rate among men.

Model Summary: Roseanne Barr said she suffers from macular degeneration and glaucoma. The actress said marijuana is "good medicine" for relieving the pressure in her eyes.

Model Summary: Jean Nidetch started Weight Watchers with a group of friends in 1961. She took the company public five years later.

Model Summary: Roseanne Barr has macular degeneration and glaucoma. The diseases can get progressively worse over time. There are ways to reduce your risk.

Model Summary: "Avengers: Age of Ultron" has plenty of action, but some of the action scenes are lackluster. Director Joss Whedon mixes some brooding down-time in with the abundant spectacle.

Actual Summary: British actress takes FHM's top spot in the list of 100 sexiest women in the world. People's most beautiful woman is nowhere on the list.
Model Summary: Michelle Keegan is named the sexiest woman in the world by British men's magazine FHM. She is followed by Kendall Jenner, Jennifer Lawrence, Kate Upton and Caroline Flack.

Actual Summary: Beloved children's performer Lois Lilienstein has died. She was a member of CBC and Nickelodeon TV stars Sharon, Lois and Bram. CNN independently confirmed with Sharon and Bram's manager that Lilienstein passed away at 78 of a a rare cancer.
Model Summary: Lois Lilienstein was a co-star of "Sharon, Lois & Bram's Elephant Show" The show ran on CBC in Canada from 1984 to 1989, before continuing in reruns on Nickelodeon stateside until 1995.

Actual Summary: Oscar-winning cinematographer Andrew Lesnie has died. He is best known for "Lord of the Rings," "The Hobbit" and "Babe"
Model Summary: Andrew Lesnie won an Oscar for his work on "The Fellowship of the Ring" He also worked with director Peter Jackson on "King Kong" and "The Lovely Bones"

Actual Summary: Timberlake and Biel welcome son Silas Randall Timberlake. The couple announced the pregnancy in January.
Model Summary: Justin Timberlake and Jessica Biel have a son. The baby is named Silas Randall Timberlake.

Actual Summary: Johnny Kemp is "believed to have drowned at a beach in Montego Bay," police say. He is best known for the 1988 hit "Just Got Paid"
Model Summary: Johnny Kemp is best known for the 1988 party anthem "Just Got Paid" He is believed to have drowned at a beach in Montego Bay, Jamaica.

Actual Summary: Koch Brothers removing checkbox on criminal records from job applications. Authors: Major companies are recognizing that those with criminal pasts can be productive workers.
Model Summary: Koch Industries will remove box that asks about convictions from job applications. Julian Zelizer: This is a big step forward in the movement to break down barriers to employment for people with records.

Actual Summary: Sally Kohn: Supreme Court seems to have increasingly become a place for partisan theatrics. She says marriage equality arguments seemed even more shaped by politics than the law.
Model Summary: Ruth Bader Ginsburg alluded to S&M during Supreme Court arguments on same-sex marriage. Julian Zelizer: Marriage equality arguments seem more about politics than the law.

Actual Summary: Kabul faces uncertain future as NATO presence -- and the money that came with it -- fades away. Interpreters are out of work, NATO trucks sit idle on roads, restaurants are empty.
Model Summary: Kabul's population is five times what it was when NATO arrived in the city in 2001. The city has been transformed since then, but many are still waiting for the end of the war.

Actual Summary: UK tennis star Andy Murray wed his long-term girlfriend, Kim Sears, in Dunblane, Scotland. Saturday's event has been dubbed "the royal wedding of Scotland"
Model Summary: Andy Murray marries long-term girlfriend Kim Sears in Dunblane, Scotland. The royal wedding was dubbed "the royal wedding of Scotland" Murray wore a traditional tartan kilt and Sears wore a vintage-style gown.

Actual Summary: Simon Brann Thorpe's project makes real-life soldiers resemble toy soldiers. He shot the images in Western Sahara, a disputed region of northwestern Africa.
Model Summary: Photographer Simon Brann Thorpe used the desert of Western Sahara as a backdrop for his project "Toy Soldiers" The soldiers are with the Polisario Front, an independence movement that has been clashing with Morocco over the region since the 1970s. Thorpe hopes his images will raise questions on "how images of war will be consumed in the future"

Actual Summary: "When a Man Loves a Woman" singer Percy Sledge dies at 73. Sledge died Tuesday morning in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. "When a Man Loves a Woman" is cornerstone of soul music, much covered and much played.
Model Summary: Percy Sledge's biggest hit, "When a Man Loves a Woman," was No. 1 in 1966. Sledge had other hits, including "Take Time to Know Her" and "Warm and Tender Love"

Actual Summary: Southwest Airlines tops Consumer Reports' survey, with the most seats available. JetBlue is at the bottom of the list but ranks high in customer satisfaction.
Model Summary: Consumer Reports analyzed award-seat availability for the five biggest U.S. airlines. Southwest Airlines offered the most award tickets, 11.9 million. JetBlue offered the lowest percentage of award seats and the fewest number of award tickets.

Actual Summary: Gulnaz was jailed after the attack as her rapist was married. Her case gained international attention; prompted a presidential pardon. She was forced to marry her attacker or face disgrace.
Model Summary: Gulnaz was raped by her cousin's husband when she was 16 years old. She was jailed for adultery as her attacker was married, but was pardoned by presidential decree. After her release, she was pressured to marry her attacker. She says she did not want to ruin her daughter's life.

Actual Summary: An attorney for Freddie Gray's family alleges that police are involved in a cover-up. There are ongoing administrative and criminal investigations. Baltimore's mayor promises to get the bottom of what happened.
Model Summary: Attorney for Freddie Gray's family alleges police are involved in a cover-up. Gray died Sunday, one week after being taken into police custody in Baltimore.

Actual Summary: Etan Patz disappeared in 1979; his face appeared on milk cartons all across the United States. His case marked a time of heightened awareness of crimes against children. Pedro Hernandez confessed three years ago to the killing.
Model Summary: Pedro Hernandez is charged with the 1979 killing of 6-year-old Etan Patz. He confessed to police three years ago, but his lawyers say he made up his account of the crime.

Actual Summary: Amanda Curtis, CEO of a fashion company in New York, posted a picture of four rainbows to Twitter. "I had a small moment of awe," she said.
Model Summary: Amanda Curtis snapped a picture of four rainbows in the early morning sky in New York on Tuesday. The phenomenon is believed to be a double rainbow, due to a smooth body of water underneath the rainbow.

Actual Summary: Japan aims to put an unmanned rover on the surface of the moon by 2018. The mission is expected to to be used to perfect technologies which could be utilized for future manned space missions.
Model Summary: Japan's space agency says it will put an unmanned rover on the surface of the moon by 2018. The mission is expected to be used to perfect soft-landing technologies. China, the United States and the former Soviet Union are the only other nations to have so far landed craft on the moon.

Actual Summary: Video of Toya Graham going to a protest and forcefully removing her son went viral, drew a lot of praise. The single mother of six tells CNN her son was scolded that he wasn't brought up that way. Michael Singleton says he knows his mom was trying to protect him.
Model Summary: Toya Graham says she wasn't concerned that she might be embarrassing her son. The video of her slapping her son and pulling him out of a Baltimore protest has gone viral. The single mother of six says her son, Michael Singleton, 16, is not a thug.

Actual Summary: Four Turkish troops were wounded in the flight, according to the country's military. Turkey President Recep Tayyip Erdogan says clashes are attempt to halt a resolution process with Kurds. Violence between Kurds and the Turkish military has been ongoing for more than three decades.
Model Summary: Four Turkish soldiers also were wounded in the fighting, the military says. Kurdish separatists opened fire from a long distance, targeting Turkish soldiers, CNN Turk reports.

Actual Summary: USS Independence was sunk in 1951 after weapons tests. Carrier was close-in guinea pig to two atomic bomb tests. Agency: Ship looks remarkably intact 2,600 feet below surface of the Pacific Ocean.
Model Summary: The USS Independence survived a Japanese torpedo strike and two atomic bomb blasts. It was scuttled in 1951 during weapons testing near California's Farallon Islands. Researchers surveyed the wreck with an underwater drone last month.

Actual Summary: A survivor tells authorities that migrants were trapped behind locked doors. Rescuers say they have found scores of bodies in the waters off Libya.
Model Summary: Maltese Prime Minister Joseph Muscat calls the tragedy "genocide" A Bangladeshi migrant tells investigators that smugglers locked the doors on lower levels of the boat, prosecutors say. The boat capsized after sending out a distress call in the dark of night.

Actual Summary: Creflo Dollar's ministry had posted a now-withdrawn request asking 200,000 people to chip in $300 each. Dollar preaches a prosperity gospel, which promises wealth to those who tithe 10% of their income to the church. The Atlanta-based pastor said the devil wants to stop him from traveling the world, spreading Christianity.
Model Summary: Creflo Dollar responds to critics of his campaign to buy a Gulfstream G650. The Atlanta-area pastor says the devil is trying to discredit him in regards to the campaign. In March, he sought $300 from 200,000 people globally to help buy the luxury jet.

Actual Summary: Jonathan Gottschall: Millions to tune in to see Mayweather-Pacquiao fight, but this doesn't show resurgence of declining sport of boxing. So why will so many watch?He says a fight is metaphor for the whole human condition, with everything noble and ugly on display.
Model Summary: Manny Pacquiao-Floyd Mayweather fight won't save boxing, says Mike Downey. He says the sport is in decline due to mismanagement and competition from MMA. Downey: Why do we watch fights? Because we love them so much.

Actual Summary: Most of the victims were children, according to reports. Condolence messages appear online with images of boys in soccer uniforms. The bus collided with a fuel tanker near the southern Moroccan city of Tan-Tan.
Model Summary: A bus collided with a fuel tanker in southern Morocco, state and local media report. The dead included athletes traveling for a sporting competition, an eyewitness tells 2M TV.

Actual Summary: Marleni Olivo, 54, hit Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro in the head with a mango. In a national TV broadcast, Maduro said he would grant her request for a new apartment. She wanted to give him a note, she says, but had no paper, only a mango.
Model Summary: Marleni Olivo wrote a message on a mango and threw it at Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro. Maduro is seen in a video lowering his head and picking up the mango.

Actual Summary: Errol Louis: New AG Loretta Lynch will try to get cops to improve community relations, end abusive practices. He says Baltimore case shows too many local departments not getting message. Lynch will have to apply range of tough measures to fix this, Louis says.
Model Summary: Loretta Lynch is new attorney general; her first job will be to crack down on police brutality. Sally Kohn: Justice Department must use its power to withhold funds from local police departments.

Actual Summary: Ben Affleck admits he asked PBS show "Finding Your Roots" to avoid mentioning his slave-owning ancestor. Dean Obeidallah says the actor and the show were right to leave the detail out.
Model Summary: Ben Affleck's great-great-great grandfather was a slave owner in the mid-1800's.

Actual Summary: Jamaluddin Jarjis, former Malaysian ambassador to the U.S., among casualties. Azlin Alias, a member of the prime minister's staff, also dies, news agency reports.
Model Summary: Malaysia's former ambassador to the United States is among the six people killed in a helicopter crash. The prime minister orders an investigation.

Actual Summary: "No challenge poses more of a public threat than climate change," the President says. He credits the Clean Air Act with making Americans "a lot" healthier.
Model Summary: President Obama: "No challenge poses more of a public threat than climate change" He says Americans can take steps to reduce their carbon footprint and help fight climate change. Obama says he's not concerned about Supreme Court ruling on Affordable Care Act.

Actual Summary: Two Australian drug traffickers on death row in Indonesia have had legal bids rejected. The men were seeking to challenge President Widodo's decision to refuse clemency in their cases. Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran are members of the "Bali Nine" drug syndicate.
Model Summary: Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran are awaiting death by firing squad for their role in a failed 2005 heroin smuggling plot. An Indonesian court has rejected their bid to challenge the President's refusal to grant clemency.

Actual Summary: Loeb says he filed a complaint against the actress to prevent her from destroying their two embryos. The couple created the embryos while they were engaged.
Model Summary: Nick Loeb is fighting to keep two female embryos he shares with Sofia Vergara. The embryos were created through in vitro fertilization. Loeb says he believes "life begins at fertilization"

Actual Summary: Six people taken hostage in a kosher market siege say media outlet endangered their lives. They hid in a cold room during the attack in Paris by gunman Amedy Coulibaly.
Model Summary: Six survivors of the Paris kosher supermarket siege are suing a French media outlet. CNN affiliate BFMTV is accused of endangering the lives of the hostages.

Actual Summary: A U.S. drone strike accidentally killed hostages Warren Weinstein and Giovanni Lo Porto. Michael Rubin: Hostages such as journalist Jason Rezaian are canaries in the coal mine.
Model Summary: Frida Ghitis: U.S. drone strike kills two hostages, but Iran has long history of hostage-taking. She says rogue regimes often seize hostages to extract concessions, humiliate the United States or signal unease.

Actual Summary: Marc Randazza: Court upholds a trademark denial for Asian-American band The Slants on the grounds that name was disparaging. He says court is wrong: Trademarks are commercial speech, protected by First Amendment. Ruling a sign or our easily offended times.
Model Summary: The Slants band wanted to trademark their name, but trademark office said it was disparaging to Asians.

Actual Summary: Italian Navy retakes fishing boat seized by smugglers. Boat was being steered towards Libyan port of Misrata. Italian navy says shots were fired accidentally, one fisherman injured.
Model Summary: The fishing boat was seized by gunmen off the coast of Sicily, the Italian military says. A Libyan soldier was taken into custody by the Italian navy, it says.

Actual Summary: School print shop operator Ron Lane was killed, college president says. The man believed to be the gunman is identified as former student Kenneth Stancil. The two knew each other, authorities say.
Model Summary: Gunman walks into Wayne Community College in Goldsboro, North Carolina, and shoots a print shop operator, authorities say. The victim, Ron Lane, was a longtime employee at the school. The suspect, 20-year-old Kenneth Morgan Stancil III, remains at large, police say.

Actual Summary: CNN investigation uncovers the business inside a human smuggling ring. 10% discount offered for every referral of another paying migrant, desperate to reach Europe.
Model Summary: An estimated 1,600 migrants have died so far this year trying to cross the Mediterranean. Smugglers offer discounts to get onto overcrowded ships if people bring more potential passengers. A CNN producer secretly filmed a smuggler in the Libyan capital of Tripoli.

Actual Summary: Scientist measured the thousands of small earthquakes in Yellowstone to scan the earth underneath it. They discovered a vast magma reservoir fueling a vast one scientists already knew about. Prehistoric eruptions of Yellowstone supervolcano were some of Earth's largest explosions.
Model Summary: Yellowstone's magma reserves are many magnitudes greater than previously thought, scientists say. It may help scientists better understand why Yellowstone's previous eruptions were some of Earth's largest explosions. An eruption in the next few thousand years is extremely unlikely, the USGS says.

Actual Summary: Show will return with a one-hour special, followed by spinoff, star John Stamos says. He announced the show Monday night on "Jimmy Kimmel Live"
Model Summary: Netflix has ordered up a reunion special and a spinoff series called "Fuller House" The show will feature Candace Cameron Bure, who played eldest daughter D.J. Tanner in the original series.

Actual Summary: Matyas Gutai is pioneering the use of water as an insulator for sustainable architecture. Reacting to its surroundings, the water keeps the house at a comfortable temperature.
Model Summary: Hungarian architect Matyas Gutai has designed a house that uses water as a building material. The house is able to reheat itself to keep its temperature at a comfortable level. Gutai says the house is a great example of "liquid engineering"

Actual Summary: U.S. Navy moves aircraft carrier, cruiser to waters near Yemen. U.S., allied ships prepared to intercept Iranian vessel if they enter Yemen's waters. Iranian admiral says his country's ships operating legally.
Model Summary: U.S. warships are being deployed to Yemen to monitor ships traveling from Iran that could be trafficking arms to Houthi rebels in Yemen. President Obama says the United States has been clear in its messages to Tehran on sending weapons to the Houthis.

Actual Summary: Control of strategic seaport of Aden divided between Houthi rebels and government loyalists. Some Saudi arms are falling into rebel hands. Terrified residents line up for bread and fuel and try to stay indoors.
Model Summary: Saudi Arabia began airstrikes on Houthi rebels in Yemen three weeks ago Thursday. Aden remains a city not fully in the hands of Houthi forces or forces loyal to the ousted government.

Actual Summary: The person climbed the fence on the south side of the White House complex. Charges are pending.
Model Summary: Jerome R. Hunt, 54, of Hayward, California, climbs the fence on the south side of the White House complex. Hunt is in custody and charges are pending. The package was being examined and later deemed to be harmless, a Secret Service source says.

Actual Summary: Agent was taken to an area hospital as a precaution. He passed a drug test and was discharged, Alaska Airlines says. The cargo hold is pressurized and temperature controlled.
Model Summary: Alaska Airlines Flight 448 was bound for Los Angeles. Upon landing, a ramp agent was discovered inside the front cargo hold.

Actual Summary: White Sox Hall of Famer tweets the closed-door game also should be postponed. Baltimore unrest leads to postponement of two baseball games. Third game in series will be first ever played without spectators.
Model Summary: Wednesday's game between the Baltimore Orioles and Chicago White Sox will be closed to the public. It follows the postponements of Monday's and Tuesday's games against the White Sox.

Actual Summary: Wisconsin, which last won a title in 1941, was led by birthday boy Frank Kaminsky. Justise Winslow leads Duke with 19 points, while Jahlil Okafor has 18. Coach K says his team's defense was "terrific"
Model Summary: Wisconsin rallies to beat Kentucky 71-64 in the NCAA Final Four. The Badgers will play Duke in Monday's title game. The Blue Devils beat Michigan State 81-61 in the other semifinal.

Actual Summary: Avalanche of appellate rulings have struck down state bans on same-sex marriage. Judge Jeffrey Sutton is behind only recent appellate decision to uphold such state bans. "Judge Sutton's opinion stands alone," says official with gay rights advocacy group.
Model Summary: Jeffrey Sutton wrote the only recent appellate court decision to uphold state bans on same-sex marriage. Critics call the opinion an outlier and don't believe it will carry much weight.

Actual Summary: New Belgium Brewery will make a beer inspired by Ben & Jerry's ice cream. It will be called "Salted Caramel Brownie"
Model Summary: New Belgium and Ben & Jerry's are teaming up on a beer inspired by ice cream. The salted caramel brownie ice cream will be part of a new campaign. The beer is set to hit shelves in the fall.

Actual Summary: Spacecraft to crash on Mercury this month. MESSENGER probe has been in orbit since 2011.
Model Summary: Mercury is the closest planet to the sun in our solar system. NASA's MESSENGER spacecraft is running out of fuel. It will crash onto Mercury on April 30.

Actual Summary: Houthis call for halt to fighting and resumption of peace talks. The cessation of airstrikes lasted less than 24 hours. Next phase, called "Operation Renewal of Hope," will focus on political process.
Model Summary: Houthi rebels call for peace talks, but only after a halt to airstrikes. Airstrikes resume after rebel forces attack a government military brigade, sources say. Houthis release Yemeni Defense Minister Mahmoud al-Subaihi, source says.

Actual Summary: Zimbabweans make up the largest group of immigrants in South Africa. Attackers have targeted foreigners and their businesses.
Model Summary: At least six people have been killed in attacks against foreigners and their businesses. Attacks started after a Zulu king said foreigners should "pack their bags and go" African nations are evacuating their citizens from South Africa.

Actual Summary: The wave of ISIS beheadings has horrified people all over the world. It may also have contributed to isolated beheading incidents by non-jihadists, says an academic. Professor Arie W. Kruglanski says exposure to the videos could help "prime" some to emulate them.
Model Summary: ISIS beheadings have galvanized international opposition to the terror group. Psychologist: Beheadings may be encouraging copy-cat acts from non-jihadists. Arie W. Kruglanski: Beheading could be psychologically "priming" people to be more inclined to emulate them.

Actual Summary: Bobbi Kristina Brown has "global and irreversible" brain damage, her grandmother says. "We can only trust in God for a miracle at this time," Cissy Houston says. Bobby Brown, her father, had said at a concert that she was "awake"
Model Summary: Bobbi Kristina Brown has "global and irreversible brain damage," her grandmother says. The 22-year-old is no longer in a medically induced coma, she remains unresponsive, Cissy Houston says.

Actual Summary: Opening statements are scheduled Monday in the trial of James Holmes. Jury selection took three months. Holmes faces 165 counts in the movie theater massacre that killed 12 people.
Model Summary: James Holmes is accused of killing 12 people and injuring 70 others in a 2012 movie theater shooting. He says he was insane at the time of the shootings, and that is his legal defense and court plea: not guilty by reason of insanity.

Actual Summary: Gunfire erupts after senior U.S. official meets with Afghan governor in Jalalabad, U.S. Embassy says. Afghan soldier fires at U.S. troops, Afghan police official says.
Model Summary: A U.S. military official says a soldier was killed in an attack in eastern Afghanistan. An Afghan police chief says an Afghan soldier opened fire on the troops as they left a meeting. Other troops were injured in the attack, the official says.

Actual Summary: A white police officer in South Carolina is charged with killing an unarmed black man in the back. David Love: What happened tells us the epidemic of police deadly force against black people continues.
Model Summary: Officer Michael Slager was charged with murder in the shooting death of Walter Scott.

Actual Summary: Tens of thousands of migrants and refugees risk the perilous journey across the Mediterranean every year. Many make the trip in dangerous boats owned by people smugglers; thousands have died along the way in recent years.
Model Summary: More than 10,000 people have arrived from Libya since last weekend alone, according to the Italian Coast Guard. Thousands of migrants and refugees make the desperate journey from North Africa to Europe's Mediterranean coast.

Actual Summary: Photographer James Oatway captured a violent attack that resulted in death of a Mozambican in South Africa. Seven people have been killed in recent violence against poorer immigrants, many from South Africa's neighbors.
Model Summary: Mozambican Emmanuel Sithole was attacked in Johannesburg's Alexandra Township. Photographer James Oatway captured the brutal attack on his camera. Police have arrested four men in connection with the attack.

Actual Summary: Were the police justified in stopping Freddie Gray? Can they be held liable for his death?
Model Summary: Frida Ghitis: Freddie Gray's death raises questions about police use of force. She says police justified stop, frisk because suspect ran away from them.

Actual Summary: Government names Abdirahim Abdullahi as one attacker; his father is a government official. Kenyan government tweets that attack mastermind was Mohamed Mohamud. Al-Shabaab threatens "another bloodbath" in Kenya.
Model Summary: Mohamed Mohamud, also known by aliases Dulyadin and Gamadhere, is the mastermind of the attack, officials say. Al-Shabaab, an al Qaeda-linked militant group based in Somalia, took responsibility for the attack.

Actual Summary: Iran's military held annual National Army Day parade over the weekend. Top military official says he hopes U.S.-Iranian enmity will fade. U.S. has welcomed limited Iranian help in fight against ISIS but neither side plans full coordination.
Model Summary: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani has praised the country's military as peacemakers. The country's top military official said he hopes the U.S. and Iran can work together to fight ISIS in Iraq. But Iran's leadership is showing no sign of toning down its fiery rhetoric.

Actual Summary: Baltimore mayor says she wants to "clarify" use of the term. Some community leaders in the city call the term equivalent to the n-word. Others disagree and don't want the debate overshadowing the issues.
Model Summary: President Obama and Baltimore Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake used the term "thug" to describe rioters. Baltimore City Councilman Carl Stokes: "It's amazing" Rev. Jamal Bryant: "These are not thugs, these are upset and frustrated children" Author Kevin Shird: "Thug" is "not like the n-word in my mind"

Actual Summary: Ford Vox: When celeb doc Mehmet Oz slammed by doctors for 'quack' medicine, he hit back, but their complaint has some basis. He says Oz scorned by some in medical community, at Senate hearing; comics joke about him. He serves himself at cost to his hospital.
Model Summary: Dr. Mehmet Oz has been accused of promoting quack treatments for personal financial gain. Dr. Aaron Carroll: Oz's critics' ineptitude may have helped boost his media empire. He says Columbia University and New York Presbyterian Hospital have stood by Oz.

Actual Summary: The terror attacks in India left more than 160 people dead. A court granted the suspect bail last year.
Model Summary: Zaki-ur-Rehman Lakhvi, a top leader of the terrorist group Lashkar-e-Taiba, was released early Friday. He was charged in Pakistan in 2009, accused of masterminding the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks that left more than 160 people dead.

Actual Summary: Beatriz Paez was walking Sunday when she saw police activity. She says marshals told her to stop recording but she refused. Marshals Service said it is looking into incident after man took her phone and smashed it.
Model Summary: Beatriz Paez was recording police activity in South Gate, California. She says a deputy U.S. marshal grabbed her phone and smashed it with his foot.

Actual Summary: Djokovic wins Monte Carlo Masters. Defeats Berdych 7-5, 4-6, 6-3. Djokovic had earlier beaten clay expert Nadal in semis.
Model Summary: Novak Djokovic wins Monte Carlo Masters title. Beats Thomas Berdych 7-5, 4-6, 6-3 in rain-interrupted final. Serbian has now won 17 matches in a row.

Actual Summary: Suzanne Crough was the youngest member of TV's "Partridge Family" Crough died Monday at 52 in Nevada.
Model Summary: Suzanne Crough played youngest daughter Tracy on "The Partridge Family" She also played tambourine and percussion in the traveling band.

Actual Summary: Tim Stanley: Muhammadu Buhar won Nigeria vote on campaign against corruption. He's an ex-dictator, but there's reason for optimism. He says Jonathan administration failed to address corruption, poverty and rise of Boko Haram. Buhar may be tonic to years of misrule.
Model Summary: Muhammadu Buhari won Nigeria's presidential election on an anti-corruption platform.

Actual Summary: "The Breakfast Club" script was found in a high school filing cabinet 30 years later. School officials hope to display the draft script.
Model Summary: A draft script of "The Breakfast Crew" has been found in a filing cabinet in the school district where it was filmed. The manuscript sports the approval signature of the district's then-superintendent.

Actual Summary: The death sentences will be appealed. Mohamed Soltan, a 27-year-old U.S.-Egyptian activist on a hunger strike, is sentenced to life in prison. Letter from Soltan's sister: "Your face, with its beautiful smile... now looks permanently in pain"
Model Summary: Mohamed Badie, 13 others sentenced to death by hanging; 36 others to life in prison. They were arrested in crackdown on supporters of ousted President Mohamed Morsy. U.S.-Egyptian activist Mohamad Soltan among those sentenced to life.

Actual Summary: Sabrina Schaeffer: Tuesday is Equal Pay Day, a fictitious holiday marked by progressive women. She says the wage gap between men and women is grossly overstated.
Model Summary: Tuesday is Equal Pay Day, the fictitious holiday marked by progressive women's groups.

Actual Summary: Amy Bass: Baltimore rioting caused postponement of two Orioles-White Sox games. Now third game of series will be played to empty stadium. She says baseball can bring cities together. But with so few black fans, players, it will be hard for Baltimore to gather around this sport to heal.
Model Summary: Frida Ghitis: Major League Baseball's decision to postpone Orioles-Red Sox game in Baltimore is striking. She says it's not the first time major league baseball has postponed games in wake of violence.

Actual Summary: "Monty Python and the Holy Grail" celebrates 40 years Thursday. The 1975 film is considered a comedy classic. Troupe made three movies together, not including concert works and compilations.
Model Summary: "Monty Python and the Holy Grail" premiered 40 years ago Thursday. The movie was a box-office hit, made $5 million and became a comedy classic. The film is perhaps the loosest and most Python-esque of the Python oeuvre.

Actual Summary: NBA player Jeff Green had open heart surgery to repair an aortic aneurysm in 2011. Green missed the entire 2011-2012 basketball season. Now he donates time to young cardiovascular patients.
Model Summary: Jeff Green was diagnosed with an aortic aneurysm while playing for the Boston Celtics. He had to have open heart surgery and missed the entire 2011-2012 NBA season. He returned to college to finish his degree and get back on the court. He's now using his story to raise awareness of hidden heart risk.

Actual Summary: Sherrilyn Ifill: Police violence against unarmed African-Americans is a national crisis. U.S. policing needs dramatic overhaul, she says.
Model Summary: Frida Ghitis: Police-involved killings and assaults on unarmed African-Americans are unlikely to end soon. She says it's not a "moment," but a deadly continuum of conduct that has created resentment and anger. Ghitis says there's no quick fix, but federal funds must be tied to compliance with anti-racial bias standards.

Actual Summary: Accused of leaking a document revealing Party's ideological battle plan to counter advocates of constitutional democracy. Amnesty: Her sentencing is in line with the very stern approach President Xi Jinping's team has taken on dissent. Gao was arrested in April last year, ahead of the sensitive 25th anniversary of the Tiananmen Square crackdown.
Model Summary: Veteran journalist Gao Yu sentenced to seven years in prison for revealing state secrets. Gao, 71, immediately said she would appeal, her lawyer Mo Shaoping told CNN. The government had accused Gao of disclosing a highly confidential "Document No. 9"

Actual Summary: New York reports 160 hospitalizations related to synthetic marijuana. Gov. Andrew Cuomo issued a health alert.
Model Summary: More than 160 patients have been rushed to New York hospitals for adverse reactions to synthetic cannabinoid, known as "spice" or "K2" "Spice" is often marketed as legal plant material coated with chemicals that are supposed to mimic the effects of marijuana.

Actual Summary: Amy Schumer took a fake tumble Tuesday in front Kanye West and Kim Kardashian. The comedian pulled the prank at the TIME 100 gala in New York. Schumer, whose "Inside Amy Schumer" also premiered Tuesday, is having a moment.
Model Summary: Amy Schumer took a fake tumble on the red carpet Tuesday night at the TIME 100 gala. The prank came the same night the third season of her show premiered.

Actual Summary: Response across social media led to multiple trending topics for Hillary Clinton's presidential announcement. Some responded to her video and her new campaign logo.
Model Summary: Hillary Clinton announces she will run for president in 2016. Social media immediately responds. Terms like "Hillary Clinton," "#Hillary2016," and "#WhyImNotVotingforHillary" are trending.

Actual Summary: The WikiLeaks founder is wanted for questioning over sexual abuse claims; he denies the allegations. Assange has been holed up in the Ecuadorian Embassy in London since June 2012.
Model Summary: Julian Assange has been holed up in the Ecuadorian Embassy in London since June 2012. Prosecutors want to question him about 2010 allegations that he raped one woman and sexually molested another.

Actual Summary: Report says North Korea may have as many as 20 nuclear warheads. Victor Cha: Washington has tended to downplay North Korean threats.
Model Summary: Wall Street Journal: China says North Korea has 20 nuclear warheads. Peter Bergen: It's more likely that Pyongyang has more than 20. He says it could double its arsenal by next year with weapons-grade uranium.

Actual Summary: Salk's vaccine began with inoculating school children in April, 1955. Polio was declared eradicated in the U.S. in 1979, but still exists in other countries. A new microneedle patch is easily used by minimally trained personnel.
Model Summary: The microneedle patch could bring polio vaccines to the doorsteps of the people that need it. It's been 60 years since a mass inoculation of Jonas Salk's vaccine began. Polio was declared eradicated in the United States in 1979.

Actual Summary: East Asia sees soaring rates of myopia, with 80-90% of young adult population affected. Evidence that myopia rates are increasing in Europe and the U.S. Scientists advice for kids: Go outside and play.
Model Summary: Myopia rates have doubled or tripled in East Asia over the last 40 years, researchers say. Rates of myopia are also rising in Western nations like Germany and the U.S. Researchers say sunlight can help prevent myopia.
