His brother, 15, and the driver of the van, 40, were also killed by bullets fired by the same man, police say. The suspect, Ricky Ricardo Chiles III, took his own life as authorities closed in on him, the police chief says.

Actual Summary: Officer Michael Rapiejko was sued in New York over claims he used excessive force during an arrest. The city settled the lawsuit while Rapiejko and others admitted no guilt. Rapiejko left the NYPD voluntarily in 2006, source tells CNN.
Model Summary: Officer Michael Rapiejko was with the New York Police Department from 2003 to 2006. He was one of the defendants in a suit filed by a man who alleged he was choked during an arrest.

Actual Summary: Two survivors were arrested on suspicion of human trafficking, police say. European officials propose a 10-point plan meant to address the crisis. A survivor tells authorities that migrants were trapped behind locked doors.
Model Summary: International Organization for Migrants says there may be three more migrant boats in distress. European Union ministers propose a 10-point plan to help address the migrant crisis.

Actual Summary: "Slip and capture" explains why deputy shot suspect, investigator says. Sheriff's office says a reserve deputy thought he had pulled out a Taser. Instead, he shot the suspect, who later died at a local hospital.
Model Summary: Tulsa Police Sgt. Jim Clark: Reserve Deputy Robert Bates "inadvertently" shot Eric Courtney Harris. Clark: Bates was not in his normal state of mind because of the stress of apprehending the suspect.

Actual Summary: Protests in South Carolina have been calm compared to the violence in Ferguson. North Charleston's mayor says hundreds of body cameras will be on officers. It took six days for Ferguson police to identify Darren Wilson, who was not wearing a camera.
Model Summary: The shooting of Walter Scott in North Charleston, South Carolina, bears only mild resemblance to that of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Missouri. Both shootings involved police officers who were white and unarmed, and the victims were black and unarmed.

Actual Summary: A charity group is preparing aid packages for those who want to return home. The attacks have left 5 dead -- two immigrants and three South Africans. A 14-year-old boy is among those killed after a mob with machetes targeted foreigners.
Model Summary: Mobs with machetes attacked immigrants in Durban, leaving at least five people dead. Police scrambled to stop clashes this week after residents accused immigrants of taking their jobs.

Actual Summary: Police say Victor White III and Jesus Huerta shot themselves while handcuffed in cars. Report: Police ignored Jorge Azucena's complaints that he had asthma and couldn't breathe. Kelly Thomas died five days after he was beaten by police in Fullerton, California.
Model Summary: Vineland, New Jersey, man died after being arrested and handcuffed. Sheriff's deputies in Louisiana claimed he shot and killed himself in the back of a squad car.

Actual Summary: Sheriff's spokeswoman: Ebony Dickens is out of jail after posting $10,000 bond. Police: Authorities found a firearm, three computers in her East Point residence. Dickens is accused of posting her Facebook rant under the name Tiffany Milan.
Model Summary: Ebony Dickens of East Point, Georgia, threatened to kill 15 people, police say. She used a fake name, Tiffany Milan, to post the threat on Facebook. She was arrested after authorities obtained a search warrant for her home.

Actual Summary: The ship was sunk in 1942 hundreds of miles of the coast of South America. A British company says the salvage operation occurred at a world record depth. The torpedoing is the subject of the book "Goodnight, sorry for sinking you"
Model Summary: The SS City of Cairo was sunk by a German U-boat in November 1942. It was carrying 100 tons of silver from India to England as part of the war effort. It sank to more than 16,800 feet under the Atlantic Ocean.

Actual Summary: In the murder trial of James Holmes, 12 jurors and 12 alternates have been selected. The mostly middle-aged group includes 19 women and five men. Jury selection started in January; opening statements are scheduled to begin on April 27.
Model Summary: James Holmes is accused of killing 12 people and injuring 70 others in a 2012 movie theater shooting. Opening statements in the trial are scheduled to begin on April 27.

Actual Summary: Tickets for Mayweather v Pacquiao on sale online for $180,000. Majority of the 1,000 tickets for the general public snapped up within minutes. The fight in Las Vegas on May 2 is one of the biggest in the sport's history.
Model Summary: Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao fight in Las Vegas on Saturday night. Most of the 16,500 tickets for the highly-anticipated fight have been sold out. But some ringside seats are still on sale for as much as $180,000.

Actual Summary: In the first recording, an unidentified officer talks to Slager about what might happen. The second audio captures a phone call between Slager and someone CNN believes is his wife.
Model Summary: Michael Slager is charged with murder in the death of Walter Scott, 50, in South Carolina. Slager's voice can be heard in two audio recordings made in the immediate aftermath of the shooting.

Actual Summary: In July 2010, Joyce Bruce got pregnant in an unusual way -- with repeated attempts using a turkey baster. The man who gave her his sperm wanted to have a role in his son's life. They ended up in court, and he has won joint custody and visitation rights.
Model Summary: Robert Boardwine's friend used his sperm and a turkey baster to get pregnant. Boardwine and Joyce Bruce never had sex, and she thought she was entitled to sole custody. A Virginia appeals court says the kitchen utensil doesn't constitute reproductive technology.

Actual Summary: Court has adjourned for the day after more than seven hours of deliberations. Jurors sent out two questions that are set to be addressed Wednesday. If Dzhokhar Tsarnaev is found guilty of at least one capital count, trial will go to penalty phase.
Model Summary: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, 21, faces life in prison or the death penalty if convicted. Jurors sent out two questions to be addressed when they return to court Wednesday. Defense says Tsarnaev was acting under the influence of his older brother, Tamerlan.

Actual Summary: "We have the power and... today shows we have the numbers," says a protester. The Justice Department is looking into whether a civil rights violation occurred. Autopsy results on Gray show that he died from a severe injury to his spinal cord.
Model Summary: Police release names of six officers suspended with pay in Freddie Gray's death. Baltimore's mayor says she wants to find out how Gray died.

Actual Summary: Denver teacher Kyle Schwartz asked students to share what they wish she knew. Their honest answers moved Schwartz and sparked a discussion online.
Model Summary: Denver teacher Kyle Schwartz passes out Post-it notes to her third grade students. Many of the students she teaches just wish they had something in common with her.

Actual Summary: Witness who took the video says "Mr. Scott didn't deserve this" North Charleston police Officer Michael Slager is fired. The city orders an additional 150 body cameras.
Model Summary: Officer Michael Slager fired after video shows him firing eight shots at Walter Scott, striking him five times. Slager, who is white, is charged with murder in the shooting death of the 50-year-old man. Police chief says he was "sickened" by the video and ordered 150 more body cameras for officers.

Actual Summary: #tacocannon trends in Omaha as excited fans eat up the idea of flying tacos. The cannon will shoot off tacos at University of Nebraska-Omaha's new arena.
Model Summary: The University of Nebraska at Omaha is getting a new $81.6 million stadium. A taco shop has teamed up with the university to shoot tacos into the stands at sporting events.

Actual Summary: Japanese maglev train sets new speed record: 603 kilometers per hour. The train is planned to begin service in 2027.
Model Summary: A Japan Railway maglev train hit 603 kilometers per hour (374 miles per hour) on an experimental track in Yamanashi Tuesday. The train broke its own record from last Thursday, when it ran at 590 kilometers. Maglev trains work by using magnets to push the train away from the tracks and drive the train forward.

Actual Summary: Olympic champion Charlotte Dujardin remains world's leading dressage rider after Vegas contest. Swiss Olympic showjumping champion Steve Guerdat finally wins World Cup jumping title at 10th attempt.
Model Summary: Charlotte Dujardin and Valegro win the FEI World Cup Dressage title in Las Vegas. It is the French rider's second consecutive victory in the prestigious event. The 19-year-old Irish showjumper Bertram Allen claims the bronze medal.

Actual Summary: Horses complete transatlantic trip to Las Vegas in 'business class' luxury. 80,000 fans expected as organizers spend $8m bringing horses back to Vegas. Celebrity chefs and legends of sport will mix with top jumping and dressage riders. World Cup Final trophies to be won -- some of the most prestigious in the sport.
Model Summary: Showjumping and dressage World Cup Finals take place in Las Vegas this week. The event is the first to be held alongside Olympic, world and European gold. More than 80,000 fans are expected at the Thomas & Mack Center. Germany's Daniel Deusser is the defending champion in showjumping.

Actual Summary: Nepal is a popular place for Israeli couples to have surrogate children. An estimated 10 to 15 surrogate mothers are due to give birth soon in Kathmandu.
Model Summary: Nepal is a popular place for Israeli couples to have surrogate children. Ronen Ziv had tickets to travel to Nepal for his child's birth from a surrogate mother. Now he has no choice but to wait in his native Israel for news.

Actual Summary: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe will address Congress on Wednesday. Mike Honda: Abe must commit to educating future generation honestly, humbly.
Model Summary: House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi says Japan's prime minister has an opportunity to do right by the "comfort women"

Actual Summary: CNN Hero Chad Bernstein started music program that helps at-risk middle school students. Nonprofit group Guitars Over Guns pairs Miami-area kids with professional musician mentors. Do you know a hero? Nominations are open for 2015 CNN Heroes.
Model Summary: Chad Bernstein's nonprofit, Guitars Over Guns, helps at-risk kids in Miami. The program pairs middle-school students with professional musicians. It also provides free instrument instruction and mentorship. Do you know a hero? Nominations are open for CNN Heroes 2015.

Actual Summary: Anuradha Koirala and 425 young women and girls have been sleeping outdoors because of aftershocks. Pushpa Basnet and 45 children she cares for were forced to evacuate their residence. Seven other CNN Heroes and their organizations now assisting in relief efforts.
Model Summary: Two CNN Heroes are among the earthquake survivors in Kathmandu, Nepal. One, Anuradha Koirala, rescues victims of sex trafficking. The other, Pushpa Basnet, cares for children whose homes were damaged.

Actual Summary: Jody Farley-Berens helps single parents who are battling cancer. Farley-Berens saw the need firsthand through her childhood friend. Do you know a hero? Nominations are open for 2015 CNN Heroes.
Model Summary: Jody Farley-Berens started Singleton Moms to help single parents with cancer. Since 2006, the group has helped more than 300 parents in the Phoenix area. Do you know a hero? Nominations are open for CNN Heroes 2015.

Actual Summary: Jeff Yang: The media has a misconception about urban unrest in light of Baltimore turmoil. He says there's no pattern of African Americans "targeting Asian-owned businesses for destruction"
Model Summary: Frida Ghitis: NPR report says Baltimore unrest was fueled by Asian-owned businesses being targeted. Ghitis says it's a myth that Asian businesses have been targeted out of racial animus.

Actual Summary: Jordan Spieth hails autistic younger sibling as his biggest supporter. Ice-cool display made him second-youngest winner behind Tiger Woods.
Model Summary: Jordan Spieth tells CNN he misses his autistic sister Ellie after winning the Masters. The 21-year-old equaled Tiger Woods' 1997 record winning score of 18 under par. Spieth says he had a chip on his shoulder after losing the Masters last year.

Actual Summary: Louis Jordan says his sailboat capsized three times. He survived by collecting rainwater and eating raw fish. Frank Jordan told CNN his son isn't an experienced sailor but has a strong will.
Model Summary: Louis Jordan, 37, took his 35-foot sailboat out in late January. He hadn't been heard from in 66 days when he was spotted Thursday.

Actual Summary: There are now more people of faith who favor marriage equality than stand against it, according to a new poll. If the U.S. Supreme Court has been paying attention, it likely saw this trend coming.
Model Summary: In 2003, less than 30% of religiously affiliated Americans supported same-sex marriage. By 2014, that number had climbed to 47%, according to a survey by Public Religion Research Institute.

Actual Summary: Adam Sobel: California's steps against drought are a preview for rest of U.S. and world. Tying climate change to weather doesn't rest on single extreme event, Sobel says. The big picture should spur us to prepare for new climates by fixing infrastructure, he says.
Model Summary: Last week, California Gov. Jerry Brown ordered mandatory restrictions on water use for the first time in the state's history. Julian Zelizer: Drought has global significance, but it's not clear whether it's caused by climate change.

Actual Summary: Carol Costello: Talk to any millennial and you can envision an America virtually marriage-free. In countries like Sweden or Denmark, people don't feel pressured to marry even if they have kids together.
Model Summary: Frida Ghitis: Millennials say they'll marry when they're ready. She says Pew study shows they're more likely to be single than older generations. Ghitis says Scandinavians have more divorces than Americans.

Actual Summary: Strung out on heroin, Anthony Sideri robbed a bank. He had to go through withdrawal in a jail cell. Overcoming addiction is possible, he says, as he's building a new life as a family man.
Model Summary: Anthony Sideri was 25 when he robbed a bank after shooting up heroin all day. He spent eight years in rehab and 22 months in jail before he was released. He says he's still struggling with the effects of heroin withdrawal.

Actual Summary: Hundreds of desperate migrants have died attempting to cross the Mediterranean in recent says. And Italians are alarmed that this year as many as a million migrants could arrive in Europe.
Model Summary: As many as 1,600 migrants have died in the Mediterranean in the past 10 days.

Actual Summary: NASA's Messenger probe smashes into Mercury, ending mission. Space probe hit the planet's surface at 8,750 mph.
Model Summary: NASA says its Messenger space probe crashed into Mercury on Thursday. It was the first spacecraft to orbit the planet closest to the sun.

Actual Summary: Volcano already has erupted twice this week. It has spewed ash to a depth of about 23½ inches in some places, Chilean officials say. Authorities issue an alert for two towns, and there's a 12-mile exclusion zone.
Model Summary: Chile's Calbuco Volcano has erupted twice this week, spewing ash into Argentina. Geologists warn of more activity Friday.

Actual Summary: Winston's lawyer: Kinsman's "false accusations have already been exposed and rejected six times" Erica Kinsman said Jameis Winston raped her in 2012; a prosecutor declined to bring criminal charges. Her lawsuit alleges sexual battery and false imprisonment; Winston has said they had consensual sex.
Model Summary: Erica Kinsman has accused Jameis Winston of rape. She alleges sexual battery, false imprisonment and infliction of emotional distress. Winston has said the sex was consensual.

Actual Summary: Ben Wedeman joins the Calabrese, an Italian patrol boat as it traverses the Mediterranean looking for migrants. Often the crew have little to report, only coming across fishing boats or other commercial vessels. The Calabrese was involved in a rescue in October 2013, during which more than 350 people died.
Model Summary: Italy's Guardia di Finanza regularly patrols the Mediterranean off Lampedusa. In recent years, it has been the first point of entry to Europe for tens of thousands of migrants.

Actual Summary: South Korean lawmaker quotes intelligence officials as saying Kim Jong Un countenances no disagreement. Official reportedly executed for expressing dissatisfaction with forestry program. Four member of Unhasu Orchestra also reportedly executed.
Model Summary: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is continuing to rule with an iron fist, a lawmaker says. He has executed about 15 senior officials so far this year, Shin Kyung-min says.

Actual Summary: Pop star Taylor Swift revealed Thursday that her mom has cancer. The nature and severity of Andrea Swift's cancer have not been divulged.
Model Summary: Taylor Swift says her mother, Andrea, has cancer. The singer did not divulge the nature or severity of the cancer. #PrayForMamaSwift was a trending hashtag Thursday on Twitter.

Actual Summary: Two people are taken into custody, but the protests -- on the whole -- are peaceful. Baltimore police commissioner sits down with the Gray family.
Model Summary: At least two people are detained for disorderly conduct and destruction of property, police say. Protesters are upset over the death of Freddie Gray, who died after being arrested by police. A police union has compared the protests to a "lynch mob"

Actual Summary: Yoga guru Bikram Choudhury denies sexual assault allegations. His accusers, he says, were manipulated to lie about him. A former student says he uses his yoga accomplishments to hide the harm he's caused.
Model Summary: Bikram Choudhury is accused of rape or sexual assault by six of his former students. He says he wants to set the record straight.

Actual Summary: India predicted to outpace China as as world's fastest-growing economy in next year. China's economy is slowing after over 25 years of breakneck growth. But experts say India simply can't size up against China's raw economic might.
Model Summary: Chinese President Xi Jinping and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi are two dynamic leaders at the helm of the world's two most populous nations. Modi's India is out to put its economy on the fast track, while China's economy is slowing after over 25 years of breakneck growth. It's been predicted that India could outpace China as world's fastest growing economy as soon as this year. Despite Modi's big pro-business push, India simply can't size up against China's raw economic might.

Actual Summary: .50-caliber bullets equipped with optical sensors can follow moving targets. The "smart bullets" can help shooters compensate for high winds. The goal of the program is to give shooters greater range and make American troops safer.
Model Summary: DARPA says it has passed its most successful round of live-fire tests to date. The "smart bullets" are.50-caliber projectiles equipped with optical sensors.

Actual Summary: NRA says although it disagreed with Sarah Brady, she was an honorable and respected woman. Sarah Brady became involved in campaigns against gun violence after her son to picked up a loaded gun. Her husband died in August, having spent the last part of his life in a wheelchair from being shot.
Model Summary: Sarah Brady died of pneumonia, her family says. She and her husband, James, pushed for stricter gun control laws. James Brady was President Ronald Reagan's press secretary.

Actual Summary: The Dadaab refugee camp is the world's largest, with more than 600,000 people. Kenya will change "the way America changed after 9/11," deputy president says. William Ruto adds that "we must secure this country at whatever cost"
Model Summary: Kenya's deputy president gives U.N. three months to relocate refugees from the Dadaab camp. "We shall relocate them ourselves," William Ruto says. The camp is home to more than 600,000 Somalis, many of whom are Al-Shabaab sympathizers.

Actual Summary: Six protesters scale the Polar Pioneer, hundreds of miles northwest of Hawaii. Greenpeace opposes Shell's plans to drill for oil in the Arctic.
Model Summary: Greenpeace activists climb aboard a Shell oil rig to protest the company's plans to drill in the Arctic near Alaska. The activists say they have enough supplies to stay on the rig for several days. Shell says the boarding was illegal and jeopardized the safety of the activists and the crew.

Actual Summary: Putin to spend hours fielding questions from the general public on live television. Sanctions and Russia's deep economic crisis likely to be a major theme. Critics of the Kremlin slam event as Russia's imitation of democracy in action.
Model Summary: Vladimir Putin will hold an annual Q&A session in which he will answer questions from the general public on live television. The event is widely anticipated in Russia, where Putin's interactions with ordinary people are rare.

Actual Summary: Saudi military official accuses Iran of training and arming rebels. Yemeni officials say school hit by airstrikes; one source says three students killed. Noncombatants are caught up in Yemen's fighting.
Model Summary: Yemeni officials say a Saudi airstrike hit a school, injuring at least a half dozen students. Separately, Saudi airstrikes wiped out about a fifth of the armored vehicles captured by southern separatists.

Actual Summary: U.S. military doesn't have further information to evaluate the Iraqi media reports. Al-Douri's body arrives in Baghdad where DNA samples are taken. Izzat Ibrahim al-Douri was the highest-ranking member of Iraqi President Saddam Hussein's regime to evade capture.
Model Summary: Izzat Ibrahim al-Douri was a former top deputy to Saddam Hussein. He was also a key figure in Sunni extremist groups battling the Iraqi government.

Actual Summary: Solar plane attempting to be first to circumnavigate world without using fuel is stuck in China. Solar Impulse 2 attempts to prove the power of renewable energy.
Model Summary: Solar Impulse 2, the experimental plane attempting to fly around the world without using a drop of fuel, has been grounded by the weather in China. It's just a quarter of the way along a journey that will cover some 35,000 kilometers (21,748 miles) over five months.

Actual Summary: ISIS is known for brutal takeovers and medieval justice, but it sees itself as a state. Official documents show just how far their rules affect daily life.
Model Summary: ISIS sees itself as a government operating under a rule of law in Iraq and Syria. Official documents give a window into the bureaucracy of the self-declared caliphate. Some subjects such as democracy and political thought are banned by ISIS.

Actual Summary: Wei Tingting, Wang Man, Zheng Churan, Li Tingting and Wu Rongrong freed. They're still considered suspects in an ongoing criminal investigation, may face charges in the future. They will be under surveillance for a year with their movements and activities restricted.
Model Summary: The five women were arrested on March 8, the International Women's Day. They had been planning a campaign against sexual harassment on public transportation.

Actual Summary: Paul Nungesser says he was target of gender-based harassment campaign. The case drew national attention after his accuser started carrying a mattress around campus.
Model Summary: Paul Nungesser was cleared of responsibility in Emma Sulkowicz's 2013 rape claim. He is now suing the school, its president and the professor who oversaw her mattress project.

Actual Summary: U.S. President Obama, Cuban President Raul Castro meet in Panama City. The two nations -- only 90 miles apart -- have been at odds for more than 50 years.
Model Summary: President Obama and Cuban leader Raul Castro shake hands at a dinner for Latin American leaders. The two leaders have been building up to the historic face-to-face. In Panama, Obama is expected to announce he's removing Cuba from the United States' list of countries that sponsor terrorism.

Actual Summary: Joseph Kent's attorney says his client was released from jail. Police in Baltimore detained Kent on live TV after start of curfew. That triggered a wave of interest on social media.
Model Summary: Joseph Kent was arrested in front of a phalanx of police Tuesday night. His lawyer says he was released from jail Thursday morning.

Actual Summary: Aid organizations are still working to help the people of Nepal in the wake of two major earthquakes. Thousands were killed in a magnitude 7.8 earthquake in Nepal on April 25. A second quake rocked the country less than three weeks later.
Model Summary: Nepal is still recovering from two major earthquakes and a mudslide. There are several organizations that have created funds for relief efforts.

Actual Summary: SpaceX founder Elon Musk: "Rocket landed on droneship, but too hard for survival" This was the second attempt at historic rocket booster barge landing. Dragon spacecraft will head toward International Space Station on resupply mission.
Model Summary: SpaceX founder tweets: "Ascent successful. Rocket landed on droneship, but too hard for survival" The private space exploration company tried to land a rocket on a floating barge for the first time. This is the sixth SpaceX mission to the International Space Station.

Actual Summary: Questions Tuesday centered on whether defining marriage should be left to voters in individual states or decided by judicial system. Chief Justice John Roberts, who shocked conservatives with his swing vote to uphold Obamacare, seemed to lean conservative. Eyes on Justice Anthony Kennedy, a key vote for challengers to the state bans, who has penned decisions in favor of gay rights.
Model Summary: Supreme Court justices appeared divided during historic arguments over the constitutionality of gay marriage. Chief Justice John Roberts seemed to lean more closely to conservative justices. Justice Anthony Kennedy, considered a key vote for challengers to the state bans, has penned three decisions in favor of gay rights.

Actual Summary: Freddie Gray was arrested on a weapons charge April 12; he was dead seven days later. He was put in a police van after his arrest; it's unclear what happened inside the van. Gray has a criminal history but it's not known if that had anything to do with his arrest or death.
Model Summary: It's unclear how Freddie Gray, 25, suffered a severe spinal cord injury that led to his death. He was arrested on a weapons charge April 12 in a high-crime area of Baltimore known for drugs. None of the six officers involved in the arrest described using force against Gray.

Actual Summary: Boko Haram has killed thousands in the nation's northeast since 2009. Aid agencies are scrambling to provide the refugees with clean water, shelter, food and education.
Model Summary: U.N. appeals for $174 million to help Nigerian refugees who've fled to neighboring nations. Boko Haram has killed thousands in the nation's northeast by attacking villages, schools, churches.

Actual Summary: Inkster, Michigan, Police Chief Vicki Yost resigns in the wake of charges against one of her former officers. William Melendez was caught on police car dashcam video in January beating an unarmed black motorist. Melendez was charged with assault on Monday; all charges against the motorist have been dropped.
Model Summary: William Melendez, 49, is charged with assault and mistreatment of a prisoner. He is seen in police car dashcam video grabbing the unarmed motorist, Floyd Dent, around the neck and punching him several times in the head. On Wednesday, all charges against Dent were formally dropped in Michigan Circuit Court. Inkster, Michigan, Police Chief Vicki Yost announced Wednesday her resignation.

Actual Summary: U.S. Navy is developing an unmanned drone ship to track enemy submarines to limit their tactical capacity for surprise. The vessel would be able to operate under with little supervisory control. Advances are necessary to maintain technological edge on Russia and China, admiral tells House panel.
Model Summary: Report: U.S. must rethink role of manned submarines and prioritize new underwater detection techniques. Concerns that China could match U.,S. underwater capabilities has encouraged development of unmanned drone ship.

Actual Summary: Grass tried in his literature to come to grips with World War II and the Nazi era. His characters were the downtrodden, and his style slipped into the surreal. He stoked controversy with his admission to being a member of the Waffen SS.
Model Summary: Guenter Grass is best known for his novel "The Tin Drum" He was awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1999 for his work on the horrors of war and genocide. Grass, 87, died of pneumonia, his publisher says.

Actual Summary: Witness who took video of shooting said when he arrived officer was on top of Walter Scott. Feidin Santana says Walter Scott didn't take Michael Slager's Taser. Santana said he never saw officers perform CPR before he left the scene to go to work.
Model Summary: Feidin Santana says he was told by another officer to stop recording Walter Scott's death. Scott, an unarmed black man, was shot dead by North Charleston police officer Michael Slager.

Actual Summary: NGO official says people will urgently need food, water, medicine and shelter. More than 1,800 people across Nepal confirmed dead, official says. People treated outside hospitals; avalanches reported on Everest.
Model Summary: U.N. secretary-general says death toll is expected to rise. At least 17 people are killed on Mount Everest, where the quake caused multiple avalanches. More than 1,800 people have been killed across the region, officials say.

Actual Summary: Police: Yuhei Takashima, 64, says he had sex with girls as young as 14 in Philippines. Officers seize nearly 150,000 photos that the former principal kept of his activities.
Model Summary: Yuhei Takashima says he paid for sex with more than 12,000 women in the Philippines. Police say he photographed an obscene act with a girl of 13 or 14 and produced pornography.

Actual Summary: 9 indicted on organized crime charges related to bourbon thefts. Employees at two Kentucky distilleries among those indicted.
Model Summary: 65 cases of Pappy Van Winkle were reported missing from a Kentucky distillery in October 2013. The sheriff said at the time that the heist was "indicative of an inside job" Nine members of a criminal syndicate have been indicted in the case.

Actual Summary: Police say 275,000 demonstrators marched in Sao Paulo. Many want President Dilma Rousseff to be impeached. A corruption scandal has implicated politicians in her party.
Model Summary: Protesters are pushing for the impeachment of President Dilma Rousseff. They are fueled by a corruption scandal that has implicated politicians in her party.

Actual Summary: Attorney for the family of Freddie Gray says developments are step forward but another issue is more important. Family will have a forensic pathologist do an independent autopsy. Police say Gray should have received medical care at different points before he got to a police station.
Model Summary: Freddie Gray was not buckled into a seat belt while being transported in a police van, police say. Police Commissioner Anthony Batts says there are no excuses for the incident.

Actual Summary: A company called CyArk specializes in digital preservation of threatened ancient and historical architecture. Founded by an Iraqi-born engineer, it plans to preserve 500 World Heritage sites within five years.
Model Summary: CyArk is a non-profit company that specializes in digital preservation of threatened ancient and historical architecture. CyArk uses groundbreaking laser scanning to ensure that incredibly accurate digital versions of the world's treasures will stay with us forever. Founder Ben Kacyra has a plan to scan 500 World Heritage sites in five years.

Actual Summary: The World Happiness Report highlights the happiest countries. People live longer and experience more generosity and social support in these counties. The United Nations first declared a World Happiness Day in 2012.
Model Summary: Switzerland took the top spot from Denmark in 2015, rising from third to first place in this year's list of the world's happiest countries. Even if you don't live in one of the 10 happiest countries, a visit to these happy places will give you a taste of what the locals enjoy.

Actual Summary: "The Cold War has been over for a long time," President Obama says. The thaw in ties has dominated discussion at the Summit of the Americas in Panama. The top leaders from the United States and Cuba haven't met for substantive talks in more than 50 years.
Model Summary: President Barack Obama meets with his Cuban counterpart Raul Castro for an hour. It's the first time the two nations' top leaders have sat down for substantive talks in more than 50 years.

Actual Summary: The European Union is trying to stop thousands of migrants from drowning at sea. Migrants risk their lives by paying people smugglers to get them to Europe. Australia has successfully stopped the flow of migrant boats to its waters.
Model Summary: Migrant deaths at sea have increased by a factor of 30 compared to the same time last year. European Union has unveiled a new 10-point action plan to stop migrants crossing the Mediterranean. Australia's asylum policy has been designed as a deterrent to asylum seekers.

Actual Summary: Conservationist Edwin Sabuhoro founded a cultural village in Rwanda. The village provides work for poachers and unemployed youth.
Model Summary: Edwin Sabuhoro worked as a warden in Rwanda's Volcanoes National Park, home to endangered mountain gorillas. He decided to help poachers make a living by turning them into farmers by giving them money to rent land, buy seeds and start farming. His work with the cultural village has received international recognition, including a meeting with U.S. president Barack Obama.

Actual Summary: Footage shows groups of captives in jumpsuits executed at 2 locations, narrator says. Video makes numerous references to Christians failing to pay tax or tribute to Muslims.
Model Summary: The Ethiopian government says 30 of its citizens are among the two groups of prisoners. The prisoners are believed to be Ethiopian Christians. The al-Furqan Media video was released by ISIS' media arm.

Actual Summary: Ernst Haas, a celebrated 20th-century photographer, was a regular on movie sets. His work from the industry has been brought together in a new book, "Ernst Haas: On Set"
Model Summary: Ernst Haas was one of the 20th century's great photojournalists and image-makers. He was an early member of the great Magnum Photos cooperative. A new book of Haas' movie photography is out.

Actual Summary: Saturday is Record Store Day, celebrated at music stores around the world. Many stores will host live performances, drawings and special sales of rare vinyl.
Model Summary: Record Store Day is Saturday, an annual celebration of your neighborhood record store.

Actual Summary: Ousted Egyptian President Mohamed Morsy is convicted of charges involving violence against protesters. But he is acquitted of murder. "We promise you unexpected revolutionary surprises," a Muslim Brotherhood spokesman says.
Model Summary: Mohamed Morsy was convicted on charges of violence and inciting violence. He was sentenced to 20 years in prison for the torture of protesters outside the presidential palace in December 2012. His party calls the verdict a "travesty of justice"

Actual Summary: Obsidian can produce cutting edges many times finer than even the best steel scalpels. Some surgeons still use the blades in procedures today.
Model Summary: Obsidian is a volcanic glass that can produce cutting edges many times finer than even the best steel scalpels. In Neolithic times, trepanation was thought to be a cure for epilepsy and migraines. Today, surgeons are using obsidian scalpels to carry out fine incisions that they say heal with minimal scarring.

Actual Summary: An Italian prosecutor announces suspected al Qaeda affiliates may have targeted the Vatican. ISIS produced propaganda videos showing beheadings of Egyptian, Ethiopian Christians. Al-Shabaab has singled out non-Muslims to kill them, as at a Garissa University College.
Model Summary: There's ample evidence that Christians have been targeted by some of the world's worst terrorist groups.

Actual Summary: 2 minors were sentenced to 10 years in prison, in addition to adults getting life. 52 of the 73 defendants were sentenced in absentia. The Virgin Mary Church was burned along with dozens of others in August 2013.
Model Summary: The Virgin Mary Church in Kafr Hakim was torched and looted by a mob in August 2013. It was one of at least 42 churches and many more businesses and homes targeted that August. Most of those sentenced -- 52 of the 73 defendants -- were tried in absentia.

Actual Summary: Robert Bates said he meant to subdue a suspect with a Taser but accidentally shot him. The preliminary hearing is scheduled for July 2. The judge said Bates was free to travel to the Bahamas for a family vacation.
Model Summary: Robert Bates is accused of fatally shooting Eric Harris. Bates says he meant to subdue Harris with a Taser, but accidentally shot him with a gun.

Actual Summary: If you turned on the television this past Sunday, a new vision of Jesus came into view. Darker, in mood and skin tone. Earthy rather than ethereal. According to the Apostle Paul, almost every depiction of Jesus so far has gotten at least one detail wrong.
Model Summary: Hollywood has been remaking the image of Jesus for decades. Recent reenactments include "Killing Jesus," "Finding Jesus" and "A.D." Scholars say it's a reflection of changing demographics in America.

Actual Summary: Mourners attend visitation service for Walter Scott. Police meet with man who was passenger in his car when it was pulled over. Michael Slager's lawyer says police aren't being helpful at this point.
Model Summary: Walter Scott's casket is laid to rest in Charleston, South Carolina. Mayor Joseph Riley says the Scott family is too exhausted to attend Friday night's visitation. Police meet with a man who was in Scott's car at the time of the traffic stop.

Actual Summary: Fatu Kekula, 23, saved most of her family from Ebola. Thanks to donors, she is being trained at Emory University. Kekula was one year away from finishing a nursing degree when Ebola struck.
Model Summary: Fatu Kekula was just a year away from finishing her nursing degree in Liberia when Ebola struck. A CNN story and donations from around the world helped fund her education in the U.S. Now she's learning skills she can take back home to care for her fellow Liberians.

Actual Summary: Footage shows a traffic stop and early interactions between Officer Michael Slager and Walter Scott. The two men speak, and then Scott gets out of the car, running. Slager, charged with murder, was fired from the North Charleston Police Department.
Model Summary: Dash cam video shows interaction between Walter Scott and North Charleston police officer Michael Slager. Slager shot and killed Scott on Saturday after pulling him over for a broken taillight. A witness says he never saw Scott try to get Slager's Taser.

Actual Summary: Family of American medic killed posts message on Facebook says she died while at base camp. At least 13 die after avalanches at Mount Everest base camp, authorities say; Climber says 17 dead. Dining tent at one base camp has been transformed into a hospital, another hiker says.
Model Summary: NEW: Jon Reiter says 17 people have been killed on Mount Everest. NEW: A doctor says he has seen 14 bodies, many of them from other countries. The Indian Army's Everest Expedition evacuated 13 mountaineers from a base camp.

Actual Summary: Hospital gowns have gotten a face-lift with help from fashion designers such as Diane von Furstenberg. What patients wear needs to be comfortable yet allow health professionals access during exams. Patient satisfaction is linked to the size of Medicare payments hospitals get.
Model Summary: Hospital gowns are among the most vexing parts of being in the hospital. The Cleveland Clinic and Henry Ford Health System have redesigned their gowns.

Actual Summary: UPDATE: Shelby Offrink lost her battle to cancer on June 28, 2015. Offrink was diagnosed at 30 with rare inoperable brain cancer. Her husband, Ben, was diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma, which had been in remission 15 years.
Model Summary: Shelby and Ben Offrink met in college and married in 2010. In 2014, Shelby was diagnosed with a rare form of brain cancer. The cancer has spread to her spine, leaving her paralyzed from the belly button down. Ben has Hodgkins lymphoma, which he has battled for 15 years.

Actual Summary: Swiss Professor Jean-Pierre Wolf is pioneering the use of lasers to affect the weather. He suggests lasers could also be used to limit the impact of climate change.
Model Summary: Swiss physicist Jean-Pierre Wolf is working on using laser beams to affect the weather. Laser is a cleaner version of cloud seeding, a form of weather modification used for several years. Laser seeding can make more than clouds: it can also trigger lightning. Wolf reckons lasers could be used to "repair" the weather, reducing the occurrence of hurricanes.

Actual Summary: A jury has found ex-New England Patriots star guilty of murder. Aaron Hernandez also charged with murder in 2012 double homicide. 'Golden boy' had just inked $40 million contract when troubles began.
Model Summary: Aaron Hernandez is found guilty of first-degree murder in the shooting death of Odin Lloyd. The former New England Patriots tight end also faces murder charges in a 2012 double homicide.

Actual Summary: A lawyer for Dr. Anthony Moschetto says the charges against him are baseless. Moschetto, 54, was arrested for selling drugs and weapons, prosecutors say. Authorities allege Moschetto hired accomplices to burn down the practice of former associate.
Model Summary: Dr. Anthony Moschetto faces criminal solicitation, conspiracy, burglary, arson, criminal prescription sale and weapons charges. His attorney calls the allegations against his client "completely unsubstantiated"

Actual Summary: Most of those released were women and children. Freed Yazidis sent to capital of Iraq's Kurdish region.
Model Summary: Most of those released were women and children, a Peshmerga commander says. Yazidis were killed, captured and displaced when ISIS overtook their towns in northern Iraq last summer.

Actual Summary: The recruiting tactics used by ISIS differ from those traditionally employed by al Qaeda. ISIS benefits from a media environment that amplifies its propaganda, officials say.
Model Summary: U.S. prosecutions of would-be recruits to ISIS have exploded in recent months. They highlight challenges that ISIS poses in comparison with al Qaeda, which has attracted fewer U.S.-based recruits.

Actual Summary: Twin sister of Freddie Gray asks for people to stop breaking things, scuffling with cops. Fans are permitted to exit Camden Yards after briefly being told to stay put. 12 people arrested during protests, police commissioner says.
Model Summary: Demonstrators clash with police near Baltimore's famed baseball stadium. At least 12 people are arrested, police say.

Actual Summary: 21-year-old student Jackson Gordon has designed and built a functional Batsuit. Made with money raised on Kickstarter, the outfit has received a prestigious endorsement.
Model Summary: Jackson Gordon is a 21-year-old industrial design student at Philadelphia University. He has created a replica of the Batsuit from Christopher Nolan's "Dark Knight Trilogy" Gordon's creation is made of Kevlar, memory foam, polycarbonate and ABS plastic. He is also an expert in Shaolin Kung Fu.

Actual Summary: Indonesia executed eight drug smugglers Wednesday morning. Mary Jane Veloso was meant to be the ninth but was given reprieve. Supporters, family "overjoyed" -- Indonesia stresses it's just a delay.
Model Summary: Mary Jane Veloso, a Filipina maid and mother of two, was due to be executed by firing squad. She was convicted of drug trafficking after $500,000 worth of heroin was found in her luggage. The Philippines says she is a victim of human trafficking.

Actual Summary: Police arrest demonstrators near Union Square in New York. Protests also held in Washington, Minneapolis and Boston.
Model Summary: NEW: Denver police report nine arrests in Wednesday's demonstrations. NEW: "NYC Rise Up & Shut It Down With Baltimore" rally is held in Union Square. Hundreds of people march in support of protesters in Baltimore. Three people are shot in Ferguson, Missouri, police say.

Actual Summary: Zuriel Oduwole is a 12-year-old filmmaker. To date, she has interviewed 14 heads of state.
Model Summary: Zuriel Oduwole is a 12-year-old filmmaker from California. She has four documentaries under her belt -- all of which focus on African issues. She was named by Business Insider as one of world's 100 most powerful individuals.

Actual Summary: Assyrians are an ancient Middle Eastern minority -- they are part of the rapidly dwindling Christian population of Iraq. After ISIS overran their villages, some Assyrians formed a militia to fight for survival against the terror group.
Model Summary: Assyrians are a Middle Eastern minority with a history reaching back more than 4,000 years. Many Assyrians see the fight with ISIS as a final battle for survival against the Islamists.

Actual Summary: Maysak has sustained winds of more than 130 mph but is expected to weaken. It's forecast to hit the Philippines during the Easter weekend.
Model Summary: Typhoon Maysak is moving west-northwest over the Pacific Ocean. Its eye is projected to make landfall in the central or northern part of the Philippines on Sunday.

Actual Summary: L'Hermione is a painstaking replica of an 18th century ship of the same name. The original fought with American colonists against the British in the Revolutionary War.
Model Summary: L'Hermione is a replica of an 18th century French frigate that fought with the U.S. in the War of Independence. In 1780, the original Hermione was assigned to a French nobleman who fought as a general in George Washington's army. After a year of testing, it set sail Saturday to retrace Lafayette's journey 235 years after the original.

Actual Summary: Patients flood hospitals in Nepalese capital after devastating earthquake. CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta helps with girl's operation at Nepalese medical team's request. "This is as bad a situation as I've ever seen," Gupta says.
Model Summary: Dr. Sanjay Gupta helped perform a craniotomy on a young girl in Kathmandu, Nepal. Gupta scrubbed up at the request of a Nepalese medical team to help with the operation. Questions have arisen about the identity of the girl who Gupta helped operate on.

Actual Summary: More than 1,800 deaths reported after Nepal earthquake. Rescue efforts range from digging by hand to military deployments.
Model Summary: The Red Cross opens a blood bank in Kathmandu. The U.S. government is providing $1 million in immediate assistance. India is sending 10 more aid flights to Nepal.

Actual Summary: San Bernardino sheriff says 10 deputies have been put on leave. Video from a news helicopter shows deputies punching and kicking a man repeatedly.
Model Summary: The FBI says it will investigate whether civil rights were violated. Ten deputies have been placed on paid leave, the sheriff's office says. A helicopter video shows a man being beaten by deputies.

Actual Summary: Nepalese authorities struggle with trying to coordinate a massive influx of international aid. Relief organizations say lots of aid supplies remain stuck in cargo aircraft on the tarmac. Damaged roads and infrastructure have hampered distribution efforts and rescue teams trying to access remote areas.
Model Summary: Nepal is still trying to come to terms with the scale of the disaster. Aid groups and at least 16 nations have rushed to send supplies and workers to the stricken country.

Actual Summary: A French rescue team finds Rishi Khanal more than three days after the quake. A 4-month-old baby is reported to have been rescued after 22 hours in rubble.
Model Summary: Rishi Khanal, 27, was trapped for 82 hours under the rubble of a building in Kathmandu. His survival is unusual, as it's rare for people to survive more than 72 hours after a disaster. A 4-month-old baby was rescued from a destroyed building 22 hours after the quake.

Actual Summary: Former Turkish ambassador to the Vatican calls use of the word "genocide" a "one-sided evaluation" Pope discusses massacres of Armenians a century after they took place. Turkey denies the mass killings constituted a genocide.
Model Summary: Pope Francis uses the word "genocide" to refer to mass killings of Armenians a century ago. Turkey recalls its ambassador to the Vatican for "consultations" just hours after Francis' comments.

Actual Summary: A total of 47 bodies have been exhumed from two mass graves. Iraqis find mass graves inside presidential palace compound in Tikrit. ISIS claimed to have executed 1,700 Iraqi soldiers captured outside Camp Speicher.
Model Summary: A total of 47 bodies have been exhumed from two of 11 mass graves discovered in Tikrit. Up to 1,700 bodies may be recovered. ISIS claimed to have executed that many soldiers captured in June outside Camp Speicher.

Actual Summary: Protests spread to New York and Denver, with more scheduled for other cities. More than 100 people arrested in Baltimore this week are released.
Model Summary: More than 100 people were arrested in New York during a "NYC Rise Up & Shut It Down With Baltimore" rally. Demonstrations are planned in Philadelphia, Seattle, Portland and Oakland. Baltimore's mayor says she will re-evaluate the 10 p.m.-5 a.m. curfew.

Actual Summary: Katie and Dalton met as patients dealing with cystic fibrosis. Two years later, they were married. Dalton received a lung transplant, but Katie is still waiting.
Model Summary: Katie Donovan and Dalton Prager met on Facebook. They have cystic fibrosis and need lung transplants.

Actual Summary: Noelle Velentzas and Asia Siddiqui are arrested in connection with a plot inspired by ISIS. Thursday's arrests are part of a series of cases being built by the federal government.
Model Summary: Noelle Velentzas, 28, and Asia Siddiqui, 31, are accused of plotting attacks in the United States.

Actual Summary: Victim's brother says he felt "anger and happy at the same time" upon seeing video. Officer Michael Slager pulls over Scott at 9:33 a.m. Saturday. Video shows the officer firing eight times as Scott runs away, with his back to police.
Model Summary: Officer Michael Slager is charged with first-degree murder in the shooting death of Walter Scott. Slager, 33, is also "terminated" from the North Charleston, South Carolina, police force, mayor says. Scott's brother says video shows his brother was "running for his life" as he ran away from the officer.

Actual Summary: For the first time ever, Ferguson's City Council will be half black. The two winning black candidates vowed to bring reform. The election was a critical test in this beleaguered city.
Model Summary: Ella Jones and Wesley Bell win seats on Ferguson City Council. They will make the six-member council 50% black. Jones will be the first black woman to serve on the council.

Actual Summary: ISIS and other rebel groups control most of the refugee camp, activists say. "Never has the hour been more desperate" in the camp, U.N. says. ""Reports of kidnappings, beheadings and mass killings," PLO official says.
Model Summary: UNRWA: "Never has the hour been more desperate in the Palestine refugee camp of Yarmouk" Activists: ISIS and al Qaeda-affiliated Al-Nusra Front have taken control of 90% of the camp. The camp has been engulfed in fighting between the government and rebels since December 2012.

Actual Summary: A random sample from a Michigan store tested positive for Listeria monocytogenes. No illnesses caused by the hummus have been reported so far.
Model Summary: Sabra Dipping Co. is voluntarily recalling 30,000 cases of hummus. No illnesses have been reported.

Actual Summary: Walter Scott owed over $18,000 in back child support payments, documents show. Walter Scott had four children and served in the Coast Guard, his brother says. He was shot in the back and killed by a North Charleston police officer.
Model Summary: Walter Scott served in the Coast Guard before being honorably discharged. He was shot dead by a police officer in North Charleston, South Carolina, on Saturday. His brother says the shooting has traumatized the family.

Actual Summary: The company says it is seeking to "redefine sexy" Victoria's Secret was criticized for its "Perfect Body" campaign.
Model Summary: Lane Bryant has launched an ad campaign for its Cacique line. The campaign is a not-so-subtle dig at Victoria's Secret and its very popular Angels line.

Actual Summary: 25-1 shot Many Clouds wins Grand National. Second win a row for jockey Leighton Aspell. First jockey to win two in a row on different horses since 1950s.
Model Summary: Many Clouds wins the Grand National by a length and a half. Jockey Leighton Aspell becomes first jockey since 1950s to win back-to-back Grand Nationals. AP McCoy, who has won 4,356 races, finishes fifth.

Actual Summary: Sewol ferry sank a year ago off the coast of South Korea, killing 304 people. Families hold protests, vigils, say not much has been resolved since sinking. Government has yet to decide whether to raise the ferry.
Model Summary: The Sewol sank on April 16, killing 304 people, mostly high school students. South Korean President Park Geun-hye called for the salvage of the Sewol's wreck "as soon as possible"

Actual Summary: Looming threat of Al-Shabaab has terrified students and teachers in Kenya. Terror group massacred 147 at Kenyan university last week.
Model Summary: Al-Shabaab militants have launched a series of deadly attacks over the last few years in the region. The Somali-based terror group has targeted schools and teachers in northern Kenya.

Actual Summary: Capitol police said a male shot himself as shocked onlookers watched. The incident appears to have no connection to terrorism, police said.
Model Summary: Capitol Police Chief Kim Dine says the shooting is a suicide and does not have an apparent connection to terrorism. An unidentified male walked through a public area on the west front of the Capitol and shot himself, Dine said. He had a backpack and a rolling suitcase that authorities treated as treated suspicious packages.

Actual Summary: Three people shot, one man in custody, city spokesman says. Hundreds of demonstrators gathered in support of protests in Baltimore. Police not sure if shootings are related to protests, spokesman says.
Model Summary: Two people were shot in the neck and another in the leg, a city spokesman says. A 20-year-old man from St. Louis County is in custody in the latter case, he adds.

Actual Summary: The type of plane used for a jaw-dropping stunt in "Furious 7" is 60 years old. Lockheed's C-130 Hercules is the longest continuously produced military plane in history. C-130 factory in Georgia celebrates the flight of the first C-130 production model.
Model Summary: The Lockheed C-130 Hercules is the oldest continuously produced military plane in history. In the film "Furious 7," the plane drops five cars 12,000 feet in a spectacular free-fall stunt.

Actual Summary: Peggy Drexler: Media, even candidate herself call Clinton just 'Hillary.' This reinforces stereotypes about women needing to be approachable. She says especially in global context, trust, respect important for the potential leader of free world, not familiarity. Just 'Hillary' not appropriate.
Model Summary: Hillary Clinton has been referred to by her first name since she announced her presidential bid. Julian Zelizer: Calling her by her name reinforces gender stereotypes and infantileizes her.

Actual Summary: "Galaxy Quest" TV series in the works. Show would be based on the cult classic 1999 sci-fi comedy.
Model Summary: A TV series based on the 1999 sci-fi film "Galaxy Quest" is in the works. The film's scribe Robert Gordon is expected to write the TV version.

Actual Summary: Blackwater sniper Nicholas Slatten is sentenced to life in prison, mandatory for his first-degree murder conviction. Three others get 30 years plus one day in the 2007 shooting in Baghdad that left 17 dead.
Model Summary: Nicholas Slatten sentenced to life in prison, mandatory for first-degree murder conviction. Paul Slough, Evan Liberty and Dustin Heard sentenced to 30 years each, plus one day. The four were among seven Blackwater employees who opened fire in 2007, killing 17 people.

Actual Summary: Police in Dallas shot and killed Jason Harrison last year. A grand jury has decided not to indict the officers. The officers are still facing a civil lawsuit filed by Harrison's family.
Model Summary: A grand jury decides not to indict two officers in the fatal shooting of Jason Harrison. The officers are still facing a wrongful death lawsuit from Harrison's family.

Actual Summary: Saudi Arabia airstrikes on the capital increase as jets hit military facilities in Sanaa. The U.N. Security Council meets to discuss the situation. Social media: A senior al Qaeda commander stands in a presidential residence after a jail break.
Model Summary: The Red Cross calls for a 24-hour ceasefire in Yemen. The U.N. Security Council adjourns without a decision.

Actual Summary: Air India has evacuated 2,500 people in recent days from Yemen, Indian official says. Passengers could only bring carry-on luggage onto the airplane. The Saudis have not destroyed the airstrips, which are controlled by Houthis.
Model Summary: Air India evacuated 188 people from Yemen's capital, Sanaa, to Djibouti. The passengers were mostly Indian nationals, plus Yemenis and people from other countries who had been working in Sanaa.

Actual Summary: Shell casings, glass and blood stains litter dorm at Garissa University College. At least 147 died in Thursday attack at the Kenyan college.
Model Summary: At least 147 people were killed at Garissa University College, many of them students. Four Al-Shabaab militants stormed the campus, killing some students and others, a witness says.

Actual Summary: NASA chief scientist Ellen Stofan believes we're close to finding alien life. Indications within a decade; definitive evidence within "20 to 30 years," she said. Finding water on other celestial bodies is key to determination.
Model Summary: NASA chief scientist: "We're going to have strong indications of life beyond Earth within a decade" John Grunsfeld: It's just a matter of time before we find life outside our solar system.

Actual Summary: For a decade, the New South China Mall has lain empty. It was labeled a "ghost mall" -- symbol of China's runaway speculation on real estate. However, a recent visit showed it may be springing back to life.
Model Summary: New South China Mall is the biggest shopping mall in the world in terms of leasable space. It opened to the public in 2005 in Dongguan in the south of the country, with a goal of attracting 100,000 visitors a day. The mall has been an embarrassment for its owners and China for more than a decade.

Actual Summary: Anbar provincial official: Suicide and car bombs were part of the ISIS assault. Iraqi and allied forces have had recent success, but ISIS remains powerful.
Model Summary: At least 10 Iraqi security forces are killed, an official says. ISIS fighters seize several districts in Ramadi in an hours-long assault, the official adds.

Actual Summary: Two Australian drug smugglers, part of the Bali Nine, await word whether they'll face a firing squad. Less is known about the seven other members of the group.
Model Summary: Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran are on death row for their part in a failed heroin smuggling plot. Seven others who took part in the operation are serving lengthy prison sentences for trafficking the drugs.

Actual Summary: Brynn Duncan has mast cell disease, which causes her to be allergic to almost everything. Duncan has a feeding tube and is on constant doses of antihistamine.
Model Summary: Brynn Duncan has mast cell disease, which affects her immune system. Doctors don't know what causes the disease.

Actual Summary: More than 1.5 million people are displaced, including 800,000 children, UNICEF says. The kidnappings that inspired #BringBackOurGirls were a year ago this week. UNICEF is launching a #bringbackourchildhood campaign.
Model Summary: More than 800,000 children have been forced to flee their homes, UNICEF says. More than 1.5 million people have fled their homes due to the violence, it says.

Actual Summary: Statue of Liberty to reopen Saturday. Locker thought to have a suspicious package was empty, police say. Statue of Liberty evacuated after bomb threat, officials say. The evacuation came after a phoned threat, sources say.
Model Summary: The Statue of Liberty and Liberty Island will reopen to the public Saturday. A bomb threat that led to its evacuation was declared unfounded. The NYPD bomb squad examined a locker thought to contain a suspicious package.

Actual Summary: "High Profits" follows the owners of a recreational marijuana dispensary. The CNN Original Series airs Sundays at 10 p.m. ET.
Model Summary: Brian Rogers and Caitlin McGuire own the Breckenridge Cannabis Club. Colorado became the first state in the nation to allow the sale of recreational marijuana. The pair's journey to build a legal marijuana empire is documented in the new CNN Original Series "High Profits"

Actual Summary: Final troop pullout oddly detached as U.S. military operations die down in Afghanistan. Ambitious projects, like a police logistics center in Jalalabad, may not live up to their potential.
Model Summary: The U.S. is nearing the end of its longest-running war in Afghanistan. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh visited a logistics hub for Afghan police near Jalalabad. The facility was originally intended to supply the entire east of the country with uniforms, ammunition, even fuel for vehicles. But it has become a bottleneck for the Afghan police, who are struggling to get the supplies they need.

Actual Summary: Protesters angry over bribery scandal involving state-run oil company Petrobras. Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff also is struggling with an economic downturn.
Model Summary: Protesters want President Dilma Rousseff to be impeached. Rousseff is facing a massive bribery scandal at the state-run oil company Petrobras.

Actual Summary: Tikrit is under the control of Iraqi forces, Iraqi Prime Minister says. ISIS departs, leaving city strewn with booby traps, explosive-filled vehicles. Officials hope to avoid Shia reprisals for ISIS slaughter of air force recruits.
Model Summary: Iraqi Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi arrives in Tikrit to claim the liberation of the city from ISIS. Iraqi forces find vehicles laden with explosives and buildings that might be booby-trapped. Officials fear Shiite militiamen might take "scorched earth" reprisals against Sunni residents.

Actual Summary: Detective: "I sincerely apologize" for berating Uber driver. NYPD investigating encounter that was caught on tape by passenger. Detective placed on modified assignment.
Model Summary: Patrick Cherry, an FBI agent with top-secret clearance, apologizes for angry exchange with Uber driver. Police Commissioner William Bratton: "No good cop can watch that without a wince" Police union president: Cherry "should not be judged by one isolated incident"

Actual Summary: The drone is sparking terrorism concerns, authorities say. It was equipped with a bottle containing radioactive material. It was discovered as a court approved a plan to restart two Japanese nuclear reactors.
Model Summary: A staff member spotted the drone on the roof of Japan's prime minister's residence. Police say the drone was equipped with a small camera, smoke flares and a plastic bottle. The bottle contained small traces of a radioactive material believed to be cesium.

Actual Summary: A company called UltraHaptics has developed a technology to create 3D shapes in mid-air. A tactile sensation is provided by ultrasonic waves, which alter air pressure. The technology could be applied to electronic devices, car dashboards, and virtual reality headsets.
Model Summary: UltraHaptics' technology uses ultrasound to create three-dimensional shapes out of thin air. Sensors emit sound waves, which travel through the air and create sensations in the user's skin. Technology could be used to control virtual reality and other electronic devices.

Actual Summary: Laura Bernardini is a lifelong Catholic but had never read the Bible from cover to cover. For the next year, she's going to read every word, from Genesis to Revelation.
Model Summary: Laura Bernardini has never read the Bible from Genesis to Revelation. Bernardini is a CNN director of coverage and a lifelong Catholic. She will read the Good Book each day for a year and chronicle it weekly for Belief.

Actual Summary: Google Maps has a temporary Pac-Man function. Google has long been fond of April Fools' Day pranks and games. Many people are turning their cities into Pac-Man courses.
Model Summary: Google Maps turns into a Pac-Man course for April Fools' Day. The company is known for its impish pranks.

Actual Summary: Rick Santorum says "religious freedom" debate is about government telling people what to do. Santorum, a likely 2016 GOP presidential candidate, weighs in on Indiana Gov. Mike Pence's decision.
Model Summary: Santorum says he hoped Indiana Gov. Mike Pence would veto the "fix" to his state's religious freedom law. Instead, Pence signed a follow-up bill that made clear the law couldn't be used to refuse services based on sexual orientation. Santorum: "It doesn't really open the debate up on some of the more current issues"

Actual Summary: Xi Jinping's sayings now available in a new smartphone app. Scholars call it a new version of Mao's "Little Red Book"
Model Summary: China has launched a smartphone app starring its current leader, President Xi Jinping. The app features the latest news about Xi and allows users to access the traditional texts that Xi quotes from. It was designed by the Central Party School, which trains Chinese Communist Party leaders.

Actual Summary: Aaron Hernandez, even when on trial for murder, keeps that certain bounce in his step. Hernandez seemed to watch his former boss and fiancee closely when they were on the stand.
Model Summary: Aaron Hernandez is on trial for murder in the death of Odin Lloyd. His defense team has been representing him since June 2013.

Actual Summary: Mitchell is best known for her hits "Big Yellow Taxi" and "Free Man in Paris". Paramedics came to her Los Angeles home on Tuesday afternoon.
Model Summary: Joni Mitchell was found unconscious in her Los Angeles home on Tuesday afternoon . She regained consciousness and is in intensive care . Some of her best-known songs are ”Big Yellow Taxi,” ”Help Me” and ”Free Man in Paris”.

Actual Summary: Vijay Das: So-so jobs numbers contain truth that worries labor experts: Too much American job growth is in part-time low-income work. He says erratic work schedules tied to customer traffic wreaks havoc with low-wage workers' lives. Congress can fix this.
Model Summary: Nearly 60% of the U.S. workforce is part-time; many low-wage workers don't get much notice of their shifts. Congress should pass a bill that would give workers more control over their schedules.

Actual Summary: Kenyans gather in Nairobi to remember victims of a terrorist attack that stunned a nation. The attack at a Garissa university last week killed 147 people, mostly students.
Model Summary: Mourners gather in Nairobi's Uhuru Park to remember the 147 people killed in the Garissa attack. Kenyans use social media to talk about the lives of the victims.

Actual Summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu slams nuclear framework deal with Iran. He says it would legitimize Iran's nuclear program and bolster its economy.
Model Summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has been a vocal critic of Iran's nuclear program. He wants a "clear and unambiguous Iranian recognition of Israel's right to exist" in any final deal, he says.

Actual Summary: Holland America says two passengers died in an apparent murder-suicide. "The cabin was immediately secured and the authorities were notified," cruise line says. The FBI is investigating the deaths; the ship is in San Juan, Puerto Rico.
Model Summary: Holland America Line says two guests were found dead inside their stateroom on the ms Ryndam. The cruise line says the deaths appear to be a murder-suicide.

Actual Summary: Kenya's security has been bogged down by concerns over civil rights. Kenyan Muslims have been targeted in raids and robbed, says Human Rights Watch.
Model Summary: 147 people were killed and 79 injured when Al-Shabaab militants attacked a college in Garissa, Kenya, on Thursday. Many Kenyans believe security has improved since last year's mall siege in Nairobi. But experts say it's still not enough to contain the terror group.

Actual Summary: Generations of Everest climbers have left tons of trash. The Indian army plans to remove at least 4,000 kilograms from the peak.
Model Summary: Indian army team plans to pick up at least 4,000 kilograms (more than 8,000 pounds) of waste from the mountain. The trip marks the 50th anniversary of the first Indian team to scale Mount Everest.

Actual Summary: Thunderstorms with large hail are predicted for the Midwest and the Plains. Tornadoes could strike Thursday night and Friday.
Model Summary: Severe weather is predicted for the Midwest and Plains on Thursday and Friday. Severe storms are expected from the Ozarks eastward to the lower Ohio Valley.

Actual Summary: Thunderstorms with large hail are predicted for the Midwest and the Plains. Tornadoes could strike Thursday night and Friday.
Model Summary: Severe weather is predicted for the Midwest and Plains on Thursday and Friday. Severe storms are expected from the Ozarks eastward to the lower Ohio Valley.

Actual Summary: Iranian President says a nuclear deal would remove a major obstacle for business. "We can cooperate with the world," President Hassan Rouhani insists. He says, "We do not lie," and Iran will abide by its promises on nuclear deal.
Model Summary: Hassan Rouhani says Iran will stick to its promises and become a more active player in world affairs. He says Iran is pursuing peaceful objectives, not nuclear weapons. Rouhani says the deal shows Iran's commitment to removing a major "obstacle... for business"

Actual Summary: Many girls in Nima,one of Accra's poorest slums, receive little or no education. Achievers Ghana is a school funded by the community to give the next generation a better chance of success. Girls are being taught to code by tech entrepreneur Regina Agyare, who believes her students will go far.
Model Summary: Regina Agyare is teaching local girls in Nima, a slum in Accra, Ghana, how to code. Achievers Ghana is a non-profit organization that aims to empower local girls through education. The aim is for the girls to go on to study computer science and become software developers.

Actual Summary: CNN team finds a man at "unofficial" displaced camp willing to provide children to be "fostered" He says he can't take money for them, but eventually demands $500 for two girls.
Model Summary: The Global Slavery Index says Nigeria has the highest number of people in modern slavery of any sub-Saharan country. 8 million children are currently engaged in forced labor in Nigeria, according to the index.

Actual Summary: Bodies of suspected gunmen paraded in front of crowd in Garissa. Kenya's President slams those who finance and support groups like Al-Shabaab. Al-Shabaab threatens "another bloodbath" in Kenya.
Model Summary: Cynthia Cheroitich, 19, describes hiding from Al-Shabaab gunmen in her dorm room. Kenya's president calls on Kenyans to unite against terrorism. The governor of Garissa county slams the terrorist group's "calculating mindset"

Actual Summary: Judge also throws out bombshell sex claims against lawyer Alan Dershowitz. He asks a federal court to "strike" sex-related allegations against him. A court filing says Dershowitz had sex with minors via Jeffrey Epstein; he denies it.
Model Summary: U.S. District Court Judge Kenneth Marra denies a motion by two alleged victims to join a lawsuit. Dershowitz: "I hope that people will now understand that they were completely false and made up"

Actual Summary: Talks run until early Thursday morning; expected to resume hours later. Iranian minister: Other side must "seize the moment," not try to pressure Iran. U.S. official: "It is still totally unclear when this might happen, if it happens at all"
Model Summary: Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif and U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry hold talks in Lausanne, Switzerland. There's still no deal on what will be the parameters for an endgame pact on Iran's nuclear program.

Actual Summary: Autopilot could have taken control of Germanwings flight and flown plane to safe altitude. But some experts say taking control away from humans could lead to other dangers. Another concern: Autopilot might be vulnerable to hackers.
Model Summary: Experts call for enhanced crash avoidance software that could take control of an aircraft away from a pilot. The technology would work in a fashion similar to crash avoidance technology used in automobiles.

Actual Summary: Fishing vessels are searching for 15 people still thought to be missing. There were 132 people on board the ship, 78 of them Russians, Tass news agency says. The rest were foreign nationals from Myanmar, Ukraine, Lithuania and Vanuatu, it says.
Model Summary: The Dalniy Vostok freezer trawler sank off the Kamchatka Peninsula. More than 60 people were rescued from the chilly waters.

Actual Summary: Stan Freberg was famed comedian, song parodist. He later became adman, did a number of outrageous commercials. "Weird Al" Yankovic: " A legend, an inspiration, and a friend"
Model Summary: Stan Freberg was known for his irreverent commercials and musical parodies. He won a Grammy Award in 1959 for "The Best of the Stan Freberg Shows" Freberg also had a successful career as a cartoonist. "Weird Al" Yankovic called him a major influence on his career.

Actual Summary: Gov. Mike Pence is making the right call to fix Indiana's religious freedom law, which can be used for discrimination. Mark Goldfeder: Indiana should aim to be a shining beacon of cooperation: the real "crossroads of America"
Model Summary: Gov. Mike Pence said he will "fix" Indiana's Religious Freedom Restoration Act. Julian Zelizer: It's easy to add a line to the law that says discrimination is harmful.

Actual Summary: The film is expected to gross $115 million or more. Paul Walker died in a car crash during filming. "Furious 7" poised to nab the biggest opening of 2015 so far.
Model Summary: "Furious 7" is getting the widest release in Universal's history. It's expected to gross $115 million or more when opening at the box office this weekend.
